loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, estado civil madre soltera y tiene dos hijos.  Estudió educación secundaria.
Trabaja desde hace seis años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la  venta de artículos artesanales como bordados en bayeta.
Con su nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales como cincuenta metros de bayeta y lanas de diferentes  colores, la señora vende lindos paisajes, cultura y cojines en Uros Chulluni.
Su sueño de la señora es crecer en su negocio, tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Benita’s a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank located in Juli District, Chucuito Province and Puno Department.  She’s 45 years old and the single mother of two children. She finished secondary school.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles and she invested it in her business.  She sells crafts like embroidered baize.

She will use her new, 600 new sol, loan to buy supplies like 50 meters of baize and wool yarn in various colors.  She sells beautiful scenery, culture and cushions in Uros Chulluni.  Her dream is to make her business grow and have a store.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Patricia Marisol

texts.es:
Patricia, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, es casada, dueña de una venta de juguetes, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 5 años y los vende fuera de iglesias y centros escolares, es por ello que no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, que es juguetes plastiscos, esta compra le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y obtener mas ganancias económicas para su hogar.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos darles a ellos un estudio adecuado hasta terminar siendo formados academicamente.
texts.en:
Patricia lives with her husband and three children.  She’s married and sells toys.  She’s been in this business for five years and sells them outside churches and schools so she does not have a fixed work schedule.

She’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her business, which is plastic toys.  This purchase will help her have higher income and obtain more profits for her home.

Her greatest wish is to improve her and her children’s quality of life and to give them adequate schooling so that they will become well-formed academically.

loans.use: to buy plastic toys.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five children. Two of them are enrolled in school while the others have completed school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Elizabeth has operated a retail shop for the past two years; her potential clients are the residents of the local area. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of maize flour and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of maize flour and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 44 years old man, he is married with three sons and two daughters.  He works in agriculture, which is the only source of income to the family. 

Ahmad wants to pay the university fees of his three sons who are studying Law, English language and Economics but he does not have enough money to pay for this.  So he needs to take a loan from FATEN.  When Ahmad gets the loan, he will be able to pay his sons' university fees so they will be able to continue their studies and develop to themselves in work and life.  Ahmad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for three of his sons.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Emelita has a poultry house and she raises & sells chickens. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy feed for the chickens.

Emelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en: Gorreti is a hardworking single parent with one child.  They live in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her goal is to educate her child. Her current business is selling pharmaceuticals in her shop, which she started two years ago. However her challenge is lack of enough capital to expand her business. Her desire is to have her pharmacy well known in her town. Gorreti needs this loan to buy pharmaceuticals to sell in her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals to sell in  her pharmacy

loans.name: Jessica Pamela

texts.es:
La Señora. Jessica es socia del banco comunal Futuro de Vida, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una gran riqueza cultural, natural y arquitectónica, esta bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Jessica tiene 19 años, vive en unión libre, su esposo trabaja en un taller en donde elaboran cielos rasos, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Ella labora hace 3 meses prestando los servicios en una lavadora de ropa y por las noches está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir para iniciar con el negocio de comida rápida, va a comprar carne, salchichas, pan, papas y otros víveres.

Su meta es ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the Futuro de Vida (Future of Life) communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city of great cultural, natural, and architectural riches. It is bathed by the four rivers which give it the name Santa Ana of the Four Rivers. Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Jessica is 19 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage, and her husband works in a workshop where they make ceilings. She does not have her own house, so she rents.

She has worked for 3 months renting out a washing machine, and at night she is studying at a school in the city.

This is her second loan with the communal bank. She will use her loan to start a fast food business. She is going to buy meat, sausages, bread, potatoes, and other foods. 

Her goal is to be a good professional.

loans.use: to purchase meat, sausages, bread, potatoes, and other foods.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он занимается посевом овощей. В основном он выращивает лук для торговли. В этой области он 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the town of Istaravshan.  He is 57 years old and married.  He has five children.  He grows onions for trade and has lived in the same area for twenty years.  His wife helps him.  He has requested a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nyamosense B Group

texts.en:
This is the Nuru International Group of five farmers called Nyamosense B. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Stephen, who is raising his hand, is 48 years old. He is married with nine children. He solely depends on farming to earn a living and is therefore keen on practicing better farming methods. During the 2014 long rains, Stephen will plant a one acre farm with 1/2 acre of maize and 1/4 acre each of sorghum and millet.

He is therefore requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies. With the necessary supplies, he is hopeful that the harvest will be good and that he will ensure food security for his large family.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Rwot Amio Group

texts.en:
Anna is a divorced mother with 4 school going children. She resides in Apii village Lira Municipality having divorced her husband who took to over drinking and became irresponsible and stopped taking care of the family.

She sales second hand clothes in outside markets a business which supports her family and pays school fees for her children.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 through the group to boost her business.
She is grateful to Kiva funders and Ugafode MIcrofinance for the support accorded.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en:
Sardar was born in 1960 in town of Azerbaijan Kalbajar.He is married and has 2 children. Sardar is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbajar.He and his family settled in the building of the Repair Construction Office №47 in Khirdalan. He has own board shop, which locate in his residence. He reqruited 3 workers. He is a well known joiner in Khirdalan. He borrowed $400 from Komak Credit Union and spent this loan amount to buy the board materials. Using these materials in his materials in his board shop he has produced the doors and windows. His unique productions  attracts a lot of customers to his board shop. 
He applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy the additional board materials, to obdate the joiner\\\\\\\'s bench and to expand the business area.He will have been working in this business for 13 years by the end of December.

loans.use: to buy power-saw bench

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica owns a butcher in Temeke market in Dar es Salaam, which is different from other butcher shops. She buys cows from wholesalers, slaughters them, sells some of the meat to other butcher shops, and sells the remainder herself. She has been in this business for six years now.

She want to buy more animals to enjoy economies of scale. Previously she used to buy and slaughter four to five animals at a time. She wants to increase the number the number of animals up to ten. She is in need of USD1200 to subsidize her working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong N. is a mother of 6 children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells dessert on the road side and typically makes around $3/day in revenue, while her husband works as a cook for wedding and funeral ceremonies and generally contributes his entire wage to the household. One of N.'s children is a grocer, another one works at the hotel, and four others attend school.

Eventually, N. hopes the loan will assist her to purchase a stand and some sweet's utensils to operate a business. In the future, N. hopes to expand her stand and sell all kinds of dessert in order to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To purchase a stand for selling desserts on the roadside

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Like most of the women in her village, Magdalena has many irons in the fire. She has two little plots of land where she grows corn, the staple food of Guatemala. She also grows vegetables, and with this loan she will buy a calf to raise for sale. 
Magdalena is 40 and has five children, four of school age. Two of them are still in school, but the 13- and 14-year-olds are now working instead of going to school. She herself never went to school and does not read or write. Magdalena's husband left long ago. Magdalena hopes someday to rent another little plot of land to grow more vegetables. Magdalena's village is nestled right against the side of the Santa Maria volcano, part of a complex of volcanoes that regularly rumbles the area and that completely destroyed the village in the early 20th century. It's a place of beautiful green hillsides and lush plots of corn and vegetables, all divided into little sections called cuerdas. The poorer women often rent just one cuerda and try to grow their own corn for the family and sell some vegetables from it. Those who have more sometimes own two or more cuerdas, and sometimes rent even more. It's hard work, and they always refer to their life as a "battle" or "struggle", but they continue with the battle to feed their families and keep the kids in school.
Written by Randy Fay and Nancy Lewis, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase a calf to raise for sale

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en: Haydar M. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz in northeastern Azerbaijan  with his wife and two children. For the last 14 years he has sold hardware in a booth he rents in a local market. In the past, Haydar successfully expanded his business with a loan of $350 from Normicro Khachmaz. Now he would like to expand his business -- and his income -- again, with a loan of $500 which he will use to increase the stock of goods he can sell to his customers.

loans.use: To increase the number and variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Tailoto

texts.en: Tailoto is 23 years old and married with one daughter. She runs a profitable business selling cold desserts such as shaved ice and ice cakes to the people of her village and to students at the local school. She has come to us for a loan of $300 to buy more ingredients , such as ice blocks, cordials, sugar and plastic bags. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business and provide a better income for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her business selling cold desserts

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: I am Sakina B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.  I am married with nine children. My husband operates a shop in the used items market, located near our house. He buys and sells various spare parts of different machines and vehicles. He is in this business for more than three years. My husband hopes to improve his business by adding a complete range of used spare parts. He needs $425 for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis is a hard-working and responsible woman, mother of four children (three girls and a boy). A few months ago, she took a loan from FSMA with which she started a small business of selling fresh cut-up chicken parts within a small locale she had bought beforehand.

Every day, hundreds of people visit her business to make the purchase of chicken. In fact, rice with beans and chicken is one of most popular meals among Dominican traditional foods. Currently, Alexis makes an average monthly profit of US$ 200. With her loan, the entrepreneur will purchase more live chickens to butcher and retail to people of her community.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to re-sell in her community

loans.name: Mouniratou

texts.fr:
Ms. L. Mouniratou was born on January 20, 1966 in COTONOU. A widow and a mother of 4 children, she manages a small company which produces and sells lollipops, yoghourt, ice cream and similar products. Her business is located in Yénawa, one of the most popular districts of Cotonou, which is a commercial area with demands growing day after day. She has thus decided to ask for a loan to satisfy her customers' requests.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame L. Mouniratou est née le 20 janvier 1966 à COTONOU. Veuve et mère de 4 enfants , elle est gérante d’une petite entreprise ayant pour activité principale la production et la commercialisation des sucettes, yaourt, glace et autres. Située à Yénawa l’un des quartiers les plus populaires de Cotonou qui est une zone bien située où la demande croît de jour en jour. Elle a donc décidé de faire recours au crédit pour satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 bags of milk powder and 2 bags of sugar

loans.name: Porpeal Khe Group

texts.en: This is a group loan that will be shared between 28 members of the Porpeal Khe Village Bank in Kandal Province. Mrs. Yol C., 44, is a farmer and also the Village Bank President. She is married with five children, all of whom are students and do not make money. Their parents can make around $7 to $9 per day. Mrs. C. requests this loan  of $3625 to buy more vegetables to sell everyday.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Alejandro Anastasio

texts.es:
Mr. Alejandro Torres has been a farmer for two years, owning his own farm in the El Sauce area of León city in Nicaragua. He is a married father with responsibility of supporting his three children who need the unconditional support of their mother and father.

For quite a while he has been farming. Previously he worked on a farm that wasn’t his but now he owns his own farm which he runs, raising cattle. Today this gentleman finds himself in need of buying calves to raise. Therefore he is seeking financial help from Ceprodel, who a few months ago supported him with loans to buy his cattle, thereby enabling him to support his family by working in agriculture and cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Alejandro T. desde hace dos años se dedica al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propio local en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Es padre casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos que necesitan del apoyo incondicional de su padre y madre.

Por mucho tiempo ha tenido experiencia en el trabajo de agricultura ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una finca que no era propia pero ahora que posee su propia finca la administra junto con el ganado que posee. Hoy en día, la necesidad que este caballero atraviesa es la compra de vaquillas para la crianza de estas. Por este motivo busca financiamiento en Ceprodel quien desde hace varios meses le ha apoyado con prestamos para la compra de su ganado y así continuar manteniendo a su familia por medio del trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería .

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sarim L. is the leader of this group of five in Prey Pouch Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 49 and the mother of a child employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sareourn Pring, is a policeman in the province. Mrs. Sarim L. owns a small restaurant where she sells rice, Chinese noodles and rice soups to the villagers. She wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy additional and more varied food. She has already obtained a loan from AMK to start her small restaurant, and since the business is successful,  she wants to make it larger.

loans.use: To buy additional and more varied food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair products to expand her salon.

loans.name: Leinati

texts.en:
Leinati T., 20, is married with 2 children. She has 2 years of experience in the elei printing business. Elei is a traditional way of printing textiles for shirts and dresses. Leinati sells her wares to the villagers and general public 5 days a week.

Leinati has received 2 previous loans from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Leinati’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. This loan will be used to maintain her business by purchasing more materials for elei printing. Her husband works at Elaine Mart to help support the family.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for elei printing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 55-year-old widow and mother of five children. She also supports ten orphans in her household. Rose runs a grocery stall which she initiated in 2005 in Bware Migori, Kenya. She specializes in selling food items such as sukuma wiki (kale), onions, and tomatoes. She also sells cereal to enable her to generate more income. Her hard work, perseverance, and good reputation ensures that her business continues to grow despite stiff competition. Rose has applied for a loan of US $500. She plans to use 3/4 of it to purchase additional stock of cereals and vegetables. The remaining amount will be saved in case of unforeseen circumstances.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Haydee es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Haydee vende ropa de segunda en la feria del distrito de San Juan Bautista que se realiza solo los días domingos, y también cada 15 días viaja al distrito de Tambo, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Haydee junto a su esposo tiene 2 mototaxis con el cual trabaja su esposo y su hijo, y en algunas oportunidades lo alquila.

Haydee necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa usada. Haydee sueña con comprar su casa, un carro para realizar transporte y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Haydee is married, 35 years old and has two children. Haydee sells second-hand clothes in the market in in the San Juan Bautista district. The market is only open on Sundays. She also travels to the Tambo district every 15 days, which she does with her sister. They buy their products in the city of Lima. Additionally, Haydee, along with her husband, has two mototaxis that she works with her husband and son. Sometimes they also rent them to others.

Haydee needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will invest in buying used clothes. Haydee dreams of buying a house and a car to transport her goods and she dreams that her children become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
Faizullo I. is 53 years old. He is married and has three children. He is a hard-working man struggling to feed his children and parents (who are living with him) by selling the national fabrics for the national dresses.

Faizullo has a trading place in the center of the local markets of Dushanbe City. Faizullo is trying to have a wide range of goods in order to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income.

Faizullo, being a devoted father, is doing the best he can so his children can be well educated and happy. Today Faizullo feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income, so he is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) with the term of 4 months to jumpstart the business and raise the family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible father give his children a brighter future.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new fabrics for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 52 year old man. He lives in a small village near Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. He sells fruits and vegetables and wants to increase his capitA. in the market. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua. Salim has been a micro-credit client for 6 years and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To increase his capital by selling more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Suraiya M.hanif Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is a 45-year-old woman who resides in Kasur, Paksitan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 18 years. Her husband, M., sells leather. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son helps his father in his leather business. Her daughter works in a cotton factory. 

Suraiya baji is a cook by profession. She cooks Punjabi (Daal Chawal) food and sells it in the community to earn a profit. She has successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more leather to expand her husband’s business. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Shamim baji, Rani baji and another woman named Rani baji each want a loan to buy leather to resell. Jia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather to resell

loans.name: Maliyama

texts.en:
Maliyama S. manufactures palm kernel oil for sale. This type of oil is used for a variety of things, including the making of soap, at Abura. Maliyama has received no formal education. She is married and has 5 dependents; her husband is a farmer.

Maliyama has been manufacturing palm kernel oil for sale since 2000. She assists her husband in the paying of utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to enable her buy more palm fruits for the production of the palm kernel oil on a larger scale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits for the production of the palm oil on a larger scale

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Mrs. Yam L. is a villager in Krodas Kor village, in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Khin Khuy, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On their land, they have an obstacle. Their field has infertile soil. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yam L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and make the crop more productive. Yam is 63 years old and the mother two children who are palm juice collectors who gather juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field and make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Kelenya Group

texts.fr:
Elles sont toutes des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 4 enfants. Les femmes du groupe Kelenya   vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux. Elles résident dans le village de Sirimou sous préfecture de Kenekou relevant de la préfecture de Koulikoro région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de voisinage et de commerce. Elles font en majorité le commerce de beurre de karité.
 Pour développer leur activité génératrice de revenu, ces femmes ont intégré le programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter, une tonne de beurre de karité auprès de leurs camarades vendeuses du village pour les vendre au comptant, en détail et à crédit aux grossistes venant de Fana. La clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA  chacune à la fin du cycle qui sera utilisé pour l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
All these women are married and average 30 years of age and four children. They form the group Kelenya and live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children, and spouses in the village of Sirimou (Kenekou sub-prefecture, part of Koulikoro prefecture) in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They know one another by ties of community and commerce, and for the most part they do commerce in karité butter.

To develop their income-generating work, they joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to buy a tonne of karité butter from their fellow retailers in town, so as to sell the butter retail, cash or credit accepted, to wholesalers from Fana. Customers are composed of men and women.

The group members each hope to obtain a profit of 35,000 francs CFA at the end of the cycle. The funds will be used for clothing the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy karité butter

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Mrs. Thea B. is a villager in Thkouv Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Tib Ton, is a palm juice collector who gathers it to process into palm sugar and wine. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Thea B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells that cow. Mrs. Thea B. is 35 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario M. P., reside en Lourdes Colón junto a su compañero de vida y su único hijo menor de edad. Ella posee una pequeña venta de dulces y otro tipo de golosinas, su negocio está ubicado frente a una cancha y un centro escolar, lo cual la beneficia ya que percibe ganancias gracias a la compra que los alumnos de dicho centro escolar realizan  en su negocio. Rosario solicita un préstamo con el fin de contar con el dinero para poder invertir más en su negocio comprando más golosinas y productos de primera necesidad. Todo esto ella lo desea con el fin de poder colaborar con los gastos del hogar con la finalidad de poder ver feliz a sus hijos y con la satisfacción de poderles brindar todo lo necesario para su hogar, poder brindarles una mejor alimentación y todo lo necesario para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rosario M. P., lives in Lourdes suburb together with her partner and her only son who is still a minor. She has a small store selling sweets and other snacks. Her business is located in front of a playing field and a school, which helps her as she makes money thanks to the purchases made by the students from the school. Rosario is asking for a loan with the aim of using the money to invest in her business by buying more snacks and essential goods. She wants all this in order to contribute to the household expenses with the aim of seeing her children happy and being satisfied that she can provide them with everything necessary for their homes: she will be able to give them better food and everything necessary for their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase essential goods

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr: Haby S. âgée de 45 ans est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle voudrait promouvoir son activité de vente de pâte d’arachide afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Haby S. is 45 year old, married and the mother of six children. She would like to promote her peanut butter business in order to improve their living conditions, and the health and education of her family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Processing and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Josefa del Carmen G. , tiene  la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio el Edén , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos , los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , para darle un mejor bienestar , ella desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que afectan al cultivo, ella inicio los trabajos agrícolas , con la ayuda de su esposo y el esfuerzo propio de ella . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar las condiciones de sus siembras. En donde tiene la esperanza que esta vez será una buena cosecha la cual le generara buenas ganancias. Este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por los beneficios  y el apoyo que ha obtenido para seguir adelante con la producción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa del Carmen G. is 37 years old and lives in the Eden neighborhood in the city of Ticuantepe together with her husband, who helps her with the household expenses. They have three dependent children, all in school. Their plan for their familiy is to improve the conditions in which they live in order to improve their wellbeing. Josefa has worked in agriculture for 21 years. The greatest difficulties she faces are the lack of financing and the pests that affect the crops. She started the farming business with her own efforts and the help of her husband. She wants the financing to buy supplies and fertilizers, in order to improve the growing conditions of the crops she plants. She has hope that this year will be a good harvest and will generate good earnings. This is her sixth loan cycle with Afodenic and she is thankful for the benefits and the support that she has received and that have made it possible for her to move ahead with her crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers in order to treat her crops and improve crop production.

loans.name: Tehmenaneh Group

texts.en:
This is Ya Marie S., Mary C., Ishmael K. and Yeabu T.. They named their group Tehmenaneh.

Ya Yeabu S. (left) is the leader of the group. She is 30 years of age and was born in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have five children, who are in secondary and primary schools. Ya Yeabu sells dishes and rubber bowls. She has been in business for over fifteen years.

This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT through Kiva. Previous loans have been a great blessing to these borrowers. With these loans, their businesses expanded and they increased their profit margins. Consequently, their living standards have also improved.

Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 4,400,000.00 to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more dishware for sale in order to increase her business

loans.name: Genaro Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Genaro es un cliente antiguo de la institución, se dedica a la confeccion de buzos deportivos para niños y chamarras para niños y mayores. Tiene también un minibús pequeño de siete pasajeros, con el cual trabaja llevando pasajeros al centro de la ciudad, por las mañanas y a partir de mediodía se dedica a la costura. Su esposa es quien lleva sus productos a venderlos a las ciudades de Oruro y Potosí, ella también le ayuda a costurar. Don Genaro es muy puntual y responsable, el crédito será invertido en la compra de tela polar(tela gruesa y caliente) para confección de chamarras para la época de frío.
texts.en:
Señor Genaro has been a member of the organisation (Kiva partner Emprender) for a long time. His job is making tracksuits for children and jackets for both children and adults. He also has a small 7-seater minibus that he uses to transport passengers to the centre of town in the mornings. After midday he works at his sewing job. His wife sells the clothing in the cities of Oruro and Potosí, and she also helps with the sewing. Sr. Genaro is very punctual and responsible with his repayments. The loan will be used to buy polar fleece (thick and warm material) so that he can make jackets for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Ofori

texts.en:
Ofori A. is 32 years old, and is married with one child who is currently in school. Ofori is an experienced taxi driver and he also runs a grocery store. He has been involved in these businesses for five and seven years respectively.

Due to his good customer service, a lot of people buy items from Ofori's shop. He sells milk, Milo, sugar, soap, toiletries, candy, biscuits and so on. He works as a taxi driver from morning to late afternoon, and opens his grocery shop in the evening when his customers have returned from work. He sells his grocery items from a shed and hopes for the opportunity to acquire his own store.

Ofori wants to use his loan money to buy, for example, more bags of rice and sugar, and cartons of milk and Milo. He hopes to increase his income in order to support his child’s education. He belongs to a community group, called Honesty Group, where members guarantee for one another as a means of collateral.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification A., a 62-year-old woman, is married to Rolando, a 64-year-old man and her partner in a canteen (outdoor restaurant) business. She is a mother of two children, a son and a daughter, both of legal age. She live in the beautiful town of Cardona in Rizal Province in the Philippines.

She is a woman who believes in the gift of God. She believes that the most precious gift for humankind is opportunity. In 2006, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, hoping that with the access to capital, she could improve and even expand her canteen. She had been operating the business for ten years and she noticed the good proceeds it brough to them.

Currently on her fifth loan, she proposes the amount of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her canteen needs. She will be using a portion of her loan to renovate her canteen. The canteen is along the main thoroughfare and is very accessible to customers. She hopes that someday her small canteen will grow into a much bigger one. She also dreams about helping her children to raise her grandchildren to have successful lives someday.

loans.use: To renovate her canteen and buy supplies.

loans.name: Carl Harvey

texts.en:
Carl Harvey B. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. He is 24 years old. Carl Harvey is single. To make a living, Carl Harvey owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling snacks like barkeron in the local community. Carl Harvey is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Carl Harvey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carl Harvey is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Carl Harvey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de septiembre”, en el centro poblado de M. del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con el cual pudo adquirir animales menores.

En la Actualidad ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para la compra de ganado menor como ovinos y cerdos.  Luego de engordarlos los venderá.

Su deseo es ser mayorista en venta de ganado.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank “22 de Septiembre” (September 22), which is in the central town of M. in Ilave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 24 years old, single, and has 3 children. She completed her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 4 years. Her fist loan of 300 soles was used to acquire small animals.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to purchase small livestock, such as sheep and pigs, to fatten for resale.

Sra. Gloria hopes to become a livestock wholesaler. She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings and being on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & pigs

loans.name: Komi Nestor

texts.fr: Nestor est un jeune homme du quartier de Gblinkomé. Il a appris la restauration et est donc cuisinier. Ne trouvant pas d’emploi dans un hôtel, il a décidé d’ouvrir en 2004 son petit restaurant pour subvenir à ses besoins. Son cafétéria est situé au bord d’un grande route internationale, ce qui fait qu’il est visité par beaucoup de clients. Pour éviter une éventuelle baisse de son stock, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 cartons de lait, 01 panier de tomates naturelles, 15 plateaux d’œufs, 10 casiers de bières, 03 cartons de pâtes alimentaires (spaghetti) et 01 grand bidon d’huile. Nestor n’est pas marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
Nestor is a young man from the Gblinkomé district. He learned food service and is a cook. Not having found work in a hotel, he decided in 2004 to open his own little restaurant in order to support himself. His cafeteria is situated along a big international road so he gets a lot of customers. To avoid running short of foodstuffs, he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 3 cases of milk, 1 basket of fresh tomatoes, 15 trays of eggs, 10 cases of beer, 3 cases of spaghetti, and 1 big tin of oil. Nestor is not married and not raising any children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various foodstuffs and drinks for his restaurant

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is married to Gaudencio and they are blessed with four children, all high school graduates. Unfortunately, their parents were not able to send them to college because it was too expensive.

Charlita is a direct seller of beauty products in their village at Barangay Burgos Ramon in Cagayan Valley's Isabela Province. According to her, selling is what makes her happy, and she is also able to support some of her family’s needs this way. She roams from house to house in their village offering her products. Charlita wants her business to be profitable so she might improve their living status.

In this regard, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to meet the demands of her customers. She believes this will help her direct sales business to grow.

loans.use: To buy more products for her direct-sales beauty supplies business

loans.name: Rose Eden

texts.en:
Rose Eden D. is a 44 year-old vegetable vendor. Her excellent performance in ASHI in terms of repayment and business all throughout her membership made her one of the most outstanding member. Despite the financial struggle she had in all of her life since birth and during marriage especially on raising her 11 children whose age range is from six to 25 years old, she had manage to remain strong and happy. Her loving husband who is a driver has been so supportive to her especially on her desire for requesting bigger amount of loan. As agreed by both of them, Rose Eden is now requesting for a much bigger amount of loan which will be used for buying a new motorcycle intended for a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire business to be managed by her husband. This is to replace their old second hand motorcycle which was bought more than five years ago.

Tricycle is one of the most common means of transportation people in the municipality take in going to different villages and neighboring municipalities. 

Though at some point of her life, Rose Eden is so disappointed because three of her elder children had decided to stop schooling yet she never loses hope that the rest of them aside from her disabled child will be pursuing their education. She hoped that through her continues loaning, she will be able to grow her business to be able to sustain the education of their children and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for purcahsing a motorcycle needed for her tricycle (motocycle wit hsidecar) for hire business.

loans.name: Tijani

texts.en: Tijani sells fire wood at the corner of his house in Ibadan.He has been in the business for quite a long time. He is hoping to expand this business. He hopes for a loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase additional fire wood to sell. He says thanks to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fire wood to sell

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco B. is 25 years old, is single with one dependent, and he lives in Gatsibo district. Here he has had a bulk supply/household goods shop for the past five years. He is a true entrepreneur and loves having his own business. The hours of his business requires that he work from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day. He does not employ anyone else in his business - it's just Bosco.

The nature of his business is somewhat capital intensive and in order to grow, Bosco is now requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He will use the loan in order to expand his shop through purchasing larger quantities of bulk goods and supplies at lower costs. With this additional capital, it will allow him to get the best pricing and adequately satisfy the product needs and wants of his customers.

As any entrepreneur, Bosco hopes to get more profits, which will help him to build a secure future for himself and his family (someday?!).

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of bulk goods and household goods

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 53 años D. edad, se casó a los 18 años D. edad y es  madre D. 05 hijos, estudió hasta el segundo grado D. primaria, vive en el Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno.

Doña Rosa es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, con su primer  crédito D. 500 nuevos soles aumentó a su capital y compró un ganado vacuno.

Con este préstamo D. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará un ganado vacuno, valorizado en 2,000.00 nuevos soles y con el resto comprará alimentos balanceados para la alimentación del ganado vacuno.

Su sueño es tener 06 cabezas D. ganado vacuno mejorados y continuar con el negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado.

Nos manifiesta que a ella le gusta trabajar con el Banco Comunal, porque  aprendió a ahorrar.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, got married at the age of 18 and has 5 children. She completed second graD. and lives in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao provvince, Puno department. Rosa is one of the founding members of the "Miraflores" communal bank. With her first, 500 new sol loan, she bought cattle. With this, 3000 new sol loan, she will buy cattle, valued at 2000 new soles, and with the rest will buy nutritionally balanced feed for them. Her dream is to own 6 head of improved cattle in order to continue with her cattle raising and sales business. She tells us that she likes working with the communal bank because it taught her how to save.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Tamalinda Group

texts.en:
Fatma H. is a widow with four children aged 12, 14, 18 and 7 years. Fatma has operated a flour business (lishe - a variety of maize) for two years now and works from 10 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. She manages to make a monthly profit of  around $317.

This is Fatma’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She says she hopes for a loan to increase her capital and pack more flour bags for sale.

Fatma will share this loan with her loan group, Tamalinda, which has eighteen members. Many of the group have small restaurants like Christina, but some of them have salons, tailoring shops, fish stands, and produce shops. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Faruma is first from the right in the first row.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her flour business

loans.name: Orowole

texts.en:
Orowole is 38 years old and married with five children. She is a focused, hardworking woman. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization, a Kiva partner, is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

Orowole sells mattresses in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more mattresses to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more mattresses to sell

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Mejía se dedica a la actividad de reparación de llantas de vehículos camiones buses y otras reparaciones. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo tales como neumáticos llantas herramientas para el enderezado de rines. Es importante destacar su experiencia de más de 22 años en la actividad lo cual lo hace tener clientela numerosa por ser una zona de mucha actividad de transporte ya que está cerca a una empresa productora de cemento.
texts.en:
Mr. M. makes a living by repairing truck and bus tires, as well as other repairs. Currently he is requesting a loan for the purchase of work materials such as inner tubes, tires, and tools for straightening rims. It is important to emphasize his experience of more than 22 years in this activity, which has earned him a large clientele, especially because he works in a zone with a lot of transportation activity, near a company that produces cement.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase work materials

loans.name: Oasis De Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oasis de Amor está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ella es Mercedes Amalia G. D. quien desde hace cinco años comercializa ropa.  Ella comenzó con poca mercadería con el tiempo fue creciendo su negocio y es por ello que requiere de una mayor inversión.

Su compañera Elena del Carmen F. P. empezó desde muy joven a  vender cosméticos primeramente entre sus compañeros, amigos y vecinos luego decidió comercializar ropa. En estos le fue muy bien y espera seguir creciendo. Mientras  Heidi Adriana F. D. vende ropa usada de manera ambulante ella se levanta muy temprano para salir a ofertar su producto y llega hasta muy tarde a su casa rendida por las largas camitas y el calor incesante.

Ellas ocuparan el prestamo para comprar mercaderia en sus respetivos negocios y seguir trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
The group "Oasis de Amor" (Oasis of Love) is formed by three working women. One of htem is Mercedes Amalia Gutierrez D. who has been selling clothing for 5 years. She began with just a little merchandise and with time has been growing her business, and is requesting this loan for more working capital. Her companion in the group, Elena del Carmen F. P., began selling cosmetics when she was very young. She began selling them among her friends and neighbors and later decided to send clothing. The business has been going well and she hopes to keep growing. Heidi Adriana F. D. sells used clothing as a street vendor. She wakes up very early to sell her products and doesn't get home until very late, at which point she is very tired from all the walking and the intense heat. The group will be using the loan to buy merchandise for their businesses and to continue to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch H. is 50 years old and ives in Chrouy village, Takeo province. She is married and has two children who all are students in the public school and also support their parents with the farming. Mrs. Touch H. and her husband, Mr. Lav Vann, are farmers who own 2.5-hectare field to cultivate rice and a variety of fruit, which has allow them to support their family.

Mrs. Touch H. is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to grow more crops.

loans.name: Agali Awamu Kikajjo Group, Kampala

texts.en:
M. Enid appears in the photo at the top right and also in the big group photo. She is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is a hard-working young lady. She is married with one child, aged 6 years, and she takes care of her grandmother.

Enid has had a salon on Namaruba stage in Namasuba for 6 years. Through good customer care, together with the help of loans, she has been able to have enough stock in her salon. She hopes to have a first-class salon in the future, plus have a good and rich family. Some of the challenges she faces in her salon are the capital and power shortages. However, this does not stop her from requesting another loan to help buy braids and weaves for plaiting her customers’ hair.

loans.use: To buy braids and weaves for her salon

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora   CRISTINA R. N.  tiene 75 os, vive en el distrito Del Porvenir,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES RESPONSABLES. La socia presenta estudios hasta 6TO  de Primaria, es casada  y tiene 5 hijos ya mayores e independientes.
Cristina se dedica hacer adornos para el calzado de damas como: zapatos y sandalias. Para elaborar estos adornos ella utiliza lentejuelas, hilos, perlas, y herramientas de perforado.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra de materiales como: lentejuelas, perlas, hilos, tintes, hebillas, etc.  y ahora con su próximo crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de : lentejuelas, perlas, hilos, tintes, hebillas y tubos para su perforado.
Ella sueña con aumentar su  producción de adornos y así vender más y así poder obtener para ayudar a su nieta que es madre soltera y tiene 2 niños.
texts.en:
Sra. Cristina R. N. is 75 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad in Peru. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Responsables” (Responsible Women). Cristina has a sixth grade education. She is married and has five grown children who are independent.

Cristina makes decorations for women’s footwear, such as shoes and sandals. To make these adornments, she needs sequins, thread, beads, and drilling tools. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and used to buy sequins, beads, thread, dyes, buckles, and other items. Now she needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy sequins, beads, thread, dyes, buckles, and perforated tubes.

Her dream is to increase her production of decorations so that she can sell more and earn additional money to help her granddaughter, who is a single mother with two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sequins, beads, thread, dyes, buckles, and perforated tubes

loans.name: Rosa Pricila

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Juan Eudes se reúne en la ciudad de Montecristi en la costa manabita, este es un gran grupo de socias que se dedican en su gran mayoría a la artesanía y a la pesca.

La señora Priscila de 26 años es casada desde hace 10 años el esposo tuvo que emigrar a  los Estados Unidos en busca de mejores días para el y su familia, de esta relación nació una hija, la señora Priscila  se  dedica a la venta de  productos Avon, su forma de trabajo es salir a recorrer por las tardes  vende a sus amigas a sus familiares, con gran facilidad de cobros para poder mantener la clientela  los productos de belleza los deja a 15 días y en su casa tiene una bisutería donde vende de todo un poco la mercadería que ella vende es de diferente partes como de EE.UU, y elaboraras en el país.

Con este nuevo préstamo la señora Priscila podrá invertir en el negocio como viajara para poder surtir su  vitrina de bisutería como collares, artes, pulsera entre otros y los productos  Avon los compra según el pedido que le hagan los clientes.
texts.en:
The San Juan Eudes Communal Bank meets in the city of Montecristi on the coast of Manabita. This is a large group of members who are mostly dedicated to making handicrafts and fishing.

Sra. Priscila is 26 years old and has been married for ten years to her husband, who went to the United States in search of better days for himself and his family. Their relationship resulted in the birth of her daughter. Sra. Priscila sells Avon products to her friends and relatives in the afternoons. She offers payment options so that she can keep her customers. Priscilla places orders for beauty products every 15 days. At her home, she keeps costume jewelry that she sells to a small trader who then sells it to different parts of the United States. Some of the items are manufactured domestically.

With this new loan, Sra. Priscila will invest in her business by traveling so that she can restock her jewelry case with necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and other items. She will also purchase Avon products based on the requests submitted by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and other items; acquire cosmetics to fulfill her customers' orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nelbi

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. NELBI,  Nuestra socia tiene 37 años  conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, de 17 y 10 años de edad, nuestra socia trabaja desde hace muchos años en el transporte ella tiene un par de combis que prestan servicio urbano en la ciudad del Cusco y la socia ahora solicita el préstamo para poder ampliar su casita y construir un ambiente más, la socia está trabajando con este banco comunal 3 años y también tiene sus tierras agrícolas y siembra papa y maíz.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nelbi is a member of the community bank SACRO. She is native to the town of Chinchero, Urubamba Province, Cusco. Nelbi is 37 years old, married, and has two children, age 17 and 10. For a number of years, she has been working in the transportation field. Nelbi has a few vans that she uses for an urban shuttle service in Cusco. Nelbi has applied for a loan so that she can do some home renovations. She has been working with SACRO for three years. She also has land where she grows potatoes and corn. Nelbi appreciates your support, and promises to make all her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en:
H. Mairam is 57 years old. She lives with her spouse and works every day starting very early in the morning so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her six children successfully finish University. Her business is located in the central market of Tursunzade and she sells clothes for women. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort, she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of 6,000 Somoni, Mairam will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Bulowooza B Kikaire Ruth Group

texts.en:
K. Ruth is 48 years old, married, and blessed with eight children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of three dependants, who are in school, too.
Ruth is a hardworking businesswoman who has operated a retail shop business for over four years. She is using her loan to purchase retail items such as salt, maize flour, cooking oil, paraffin and so forth, for resale in her shop. She is an inspiring businesswoman whose dream is to work hard for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as salt, maize flour, cooking oil, paraffin, etc.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
T. Immaculate has been toiling hard for the last five years operating her food stall business in Bisheshe, Ibanda. She has mostly been selling tomatoes, avocados, cabbages and soya beans.

Despite the threat of pests and fluctuations in the local market prices of most of the goods that she sells, Immaculate has persisted, well knowing that she has responsibilities that lie ahead of her. She has two children and one dependent to take care of.

Given the variety of fruits, vegetables and other foods that she sells, Immaculate has managed to attract and hold her own big and reliable share of clients. These have been the reason why her business has survived and is still standing.

In a month, given the unpredictability of the seasons, Immaculate says she makes profits totaling to 120,000 shillings or even more. She is full of hope that this loan will help her strength her business further, as she will be able to buy foodstuffs on a larger scale.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell such as cassava, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a variety of fruits & vegetables

loans.name: William

texts.en: William B. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is 52 years old. William is married and has three adult children. To make a living, William operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, powdered soap, energy drinks and canned goods. William has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, William joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. William is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by William from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old. Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products and also baking and selling a variety of breads in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: El Paraiso (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La  señora María de Lourdes Gomes Domínguez, vive en Tecpatán Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Abildai Muñoz Gómez, y tiene un hijo de siete años de nombre Tahaylí Muñoz y le dicen (el bebe) por ser el único, es muy inteligente y quiere ser doctor para apoyar a su pueblo.

  Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras que inicio hace unos meses, en donde comenta que le va bien a un que el espacio es pequeño obtiene buen resultado, así también tiene el negocio de abarrotes que también lo inicio hace poco y de las dos actividades obtenga ingresos para su familia.

   El motivo por el cual solicito el préstamo con fundación realidad a.c, es para comprar mas mercancia y tener surtido su negocio  para que  tenga más clientela y su negocio crezca día a día.

  Con la ganancia que tenga de su negocio lo invertirá para comprar más mercancía, como también pagar el préstamo que solicito con fundación realidad a.c, a un así también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja para que juntos aporten en su hogar.

   Su sueño de María  de Lourdes es tener un local propio para que pueda vender mejor y día con dio crezca, pero lo más grande es apoyar a su hijo para que tenga una profesión y tenga un mejor futuro.

  Lourdes formo parte del grupo ya que se izo  una promoción en su localidad y se intereso invito a sus compañeros a integrarse al programa, el grupo se llama el paraíso la razón del nombre es porque el barrio donde vive así se llama.

 
Las personas que integran el grupo el paraíso son la siguiente:

 María de Lourdes Gómez Domínguez: invertirá para surtir su negocio de  frutas y legumbres, como también de abarrotes.
 Víctor Manuel Gómez Domínguez: invertirá el préstamo en la tienda de abarrotes.
 Catalina O. A.: se dedica a la compra i venta de pollos para venderlo en pie y aliñados (destazados).
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Lourdes Gomes Domínguez lives in Tecpatán, Chiapas, México. She is married to Mr. Abildai Muñoz Gómez and has a 7-year-old son named, Tahaylí Muñoz, called “El Bebé” because he’s an only son. He is very intelligent and wants to become a doctor to help his town. She sells fruits and vegetables, an activity se began a few months ago. She tells us that she does well even though the space she has is small. She also has a small grocery store that she began a short time ago and from both activities she earns income for her family. The reason why she asked for funding from Fundación Realidad, A.C. is to buy merchandise to stock her store so that she can have more customers and her business will grow daily. Profits from the store will be used to buy more merchandise as well as to repay the loan she asked from Fundación Realidad, A.C. She also counts with support from her husband so that they support their home together. María de Lourdes’ dream is to own her own locale so that she can sell better and grow daily. But her biggest dream is to support her son so that he will have a profession and a better future. Lourdes became a member of the group when a promotional offer was made in her locality and she became interested. She invited her companions to join the program. The group is called El Paraíso (Paradise) so named because that’s the name of the neighborhood they live in. The group members are: María de Lourdes Gómez Domínguez: will use the loans to stock her store with fruits and vegetables as well s some grocery items. Víctor Manuel Gómez Domínguez: will invest the loan in his grocery store. Catalina O. A.: sells live and butchered chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables as well as groceries like sugar, cooking oil and beans, among others.

loans.name: Keresenja

texts.en:
Keresenja W. is a 51-year-old widow with one son who is aged 27 years and currently in college.

Keresenja runs a dairy business in  Bungoma area and he has been in this, for about eight years.  He is able to make a profit of about Kshs 2,300 per month from the sale of milk to his customers who come from within the town.
 
Keresenja has applied for his first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the money to buy a bull for farming purposes.

Keresenja hopes to use the profits he will make to improve his brick-molding business, which has not picked up well, and thus be able to supply bricks within his town. He believes anything is achievable with hard work.

loans.use: To buy a bull for farming purposes

loans.name: Farizat's Group

texts.en: Farizat B. is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married with a son and three daughters. The son and two daughters are at school and the third daughter is not in school yet. Farizat is a farmer and she also breeds cattle to make money. Her husband provides tractor services. Farizat applied for a loan because she wants to increase her number of cattle. She makes money to cover family expenses by fattening cattle to sell at a higher price. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land and build a big new house for her family. Nurzaada S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 26 and married. She has two sons; both of them are preschool age (under seven). In order to make money, Nurzaada takes orders and sews national clothes and dressmaking supplies. Her husband is engaged in cattle breeding. With money from this loan, Nurzaada wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the near future, she plans to repair her house. Muranbek M., 40, is married. He has three sons and a daughter. The sons are at school and the daughter is not in school yet. Muranbek works in construction and his wife is a school teacher. They also breed cattle to sell after fattening. In this way, they make additional money to cover their family's expenses. With money from this loan, Muranbek wants to purchase cattle for breeding. Tunubek T. is 27 years old. He is a farmer. He applied for a loan because he needs money to purchase fuel and hire labor for the sowing process. In the future, he wants to get married and purchase a vehicle. Jyldyz K., 37, is married. She has a son and two daughters. The first daughter and the son are at school, and the second daughter is preschool age. In order to make money, Jyldyz sells flour on the market and her husband is a farmer. With money from this loan, they want to purchase fuel and hire labor. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a dairy farmer in Kiambu. He is married and blessed with five children. He has been farming for the past nine years. He sells milk to the people of his local residence. In addition to farming, he is a photographer.  

As a businessman, he says that Faulu Kenya has helped him to save his money. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, he will buy another cow.  He hopes that he will become a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a vegetable seller who has been running her business in the market for years. S. normally goes to the big busy market where she orders vegetable in bulk and then hurries to deliver her items by trailer-motorcycle to the other markets where she retails them for a profit. She is married, with four school-aged kids.Her husband also earns income for the family by working in the construction sector. In addition to her job, Mrs. S. also cultivates rice crops on her own farmland. 

S. needs a loan to purchase a new motorbike to make family transportation easier, as well as buying fertilizer to improve her rice crop that is not growing well.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to make family transportation easier, as well as buying fertilizer to improve her rice crop that is not growing well.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es soltero, tiene 35 años de edad, y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola desde que era muy joven, trabaja en diversos campos de cultivo de la zona. Como esta actividad no le ofrecía la estabilidad suficiente para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres empezó a trabajar adicionalmente en la crianza de animales y en la comercialización de leña.

Juan compra troncos de algarrobo recién talados a comercializadores de la zona y lo corta en trozos para ofrecérselos a sus clientes en “armadas” (atos de leña) de 30 unidades. El negocio de la venta de leña es de utilidad en la zona donde vive ya que la mayoría de familias cocinan sus alimentos con este producto. Adicionalmente cría animales de corral para venderlos a los comerciantes que visitan la zona eventualmente.

Juan ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva y gracias a ese dinero adquirió mas leña con lo que pudo ampliar su negocio. Ahora que se ha vuelto más conocido en el rubro y que su demanda ha aumentado planea seguir creciendo como empresario. Por este motivo ha creído conveniente volver a solicitar un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles

Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con el a través del programa Kiva. La ayuda recibida le ha motivado a reanudar sus fuerzas para luchar por salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is single, is 35 years old and lives with his parents in the La Pava village, Mochumi district, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been dedicated to working as a farm worker since he was young. He works in diverse fields in the area. Since this activity does not provide him with enough stablility to pay his personal expenses and help his parents, he began additional work raising animals and selling wood.

Juan buys carob trees recently felled from sellers in the area and cuts them into pieces to offer them to his customers in 30-unit "armadas" (bundles of wood). The business selling wood is useful in the area where he lives since the majority of families cook their food with this product. Additionaly, he raises animals in pens to sell them to vendors who visit the area.

Juan has already had a loan financed by Kiva and, thanks to that money, he acquired more wood with which he was able to expand his business. Now that he has become better known in this work and his demand has increased, he plans to keep growing as a businessman. To that end, he has seen fit to reapply for a loan of 1,700 new "soles."

Juan is very thankful for the people who have collaborated with him through the Kiva program. The help received has motivated him to resume his efforts to fight to get ahead and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase wood to expand his business.

loans.name: Chourb

texts.en: Chourb S., 43, is married and lives with her husband and six children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. raises pigs, earning an income of about US $3 per day. Her husband operates his motorbike with a trailer attached to provide transportation services, earning an income of about US $3 per day.
