S. has to spend US $75 on food, US $3 on electricity and water supplies, and US $13 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase more rice to stock and sell when the price is good. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: to buy more rice to stock and sell

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Soleado Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama NUEVO AMANECER SOLEADO. Porque se imaginan amanecer siempre con dinero y visualizan un día excelente. Está ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes. La Sra. Roció Salas Solís, es una integrante  del grupo  quien tiene 29 años. Tiene una hija de  7 años. Se dedica a vender productos de madera, ropa y artículos de papel. Solicita su préstamo para invertir en su negocio y poder adquirir materias primas, ya que se acerca la época navideña. Ella trabaja en su casa. Siempre se le ha conocido como una persona muy trabajadora a su corta edad.
texts.en:
The name of the group is “Nuevo Amanecer Soleado” (Sunny New Dawn).  It got its name because they always imagine waking up with money, and they visualize an excellent day.  The group is located in the state of México, and it is comprised of 11 members.

Roció Salas Solís, age 29, is a member of the group.  She has a seven year old daughter.  She sells wood products, clothes, and paper items.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her business to be able to get basic materials for the coming Christmas season.  She works in her house.  She has always been known to be a very hard-working young person.

loans.use: To buy basic materials

loans.name: Nataly Concepcion

texts.es:
Nataly  se  dedica a la venta de carne, hielo, pólvora, es una persona de familia vive con su madre, está soltera y tiene 25 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, el negocio lo aprendió de sus padres.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en compra de productos como carne de res y pólvora, con la intención de mantener en el inventario la disponibilidad para los clientes, con esta inversión estará produciendo más ingresos para su hogar.
El objetivo de Nataly  ser una comerciante con estrategias para mantenerse en el negocio a largo plazo, aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nataly earns her living by selling meat, ice, and fireworks. She is 25 years old, single, and lives with her mother in Jiquilisco, in the  department of Usulután. She took over the business from her parents.

Nataly is seeking a loan to buy such items as meat and fireworks so she has plenty of stock to offer to her customers. This will enable her to earn more money for household expenses.

In the long term Nataly wishes to continue with her business plan and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, es un joven de 22 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de medicina y ropa, vive con su esposa y su hija de 2 años de edad, residen en San Rafael Oriente departamento de Usulután, José inicio este negocio desde 2 años, y por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería (prendas de vestir), esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el inventario y tener a disponibilidad de los clientes variedad de productos.
Su objetivo es tener un buen negocio que genere ganancias y que le ayude a superarse junto a su familia, brindándoles estabilidad y una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: José is a young man of 22 years. He sells medicine and clothing, and lives with his wife and 2 year-old daughter. They live in San Rafael Oriente, in the Usulutan department. Jose started this business 2 years ago, and at the moment he is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise (articles of clothing). This investment will help him to strengthen his inventory and have a variety of products available to his customers. his goal is to have a good business that generates earnings and helps him and his family to succeed, offering them stability and better living conditions.

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise (articles of clothing)

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Bertha Isabel

texts.es:
Bertha Isabel L. G. tiene 43 años. Es casada vive con la esposo en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos.  Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Bertha Isabel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Bertha Isabel L. G. is 43. She is married and lives with her husband in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Bertha Isabel has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for three years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a house.

She enjoys dancing.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Suzette Joy

texts.en:
Suzette Joy R. is from the village of San Roque, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old and married, and she has one school-aged child. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Suzette Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Don Jesús, de 52 años, casado con 5 hijos  a su cargo, es comerciante, originario del departamento de Estelí. A duras penas logro terminar la primaria pues su situación económica lo obligo a dejar  a temprana edad sus estudios. Inicio en una empacadora, localizada en el costado sur del hospital de Estelí, su primer trabajo fue  como vendedor de pan  ahí  duro 3 años. Luego tomo la iniciativa de poner su propio negocio empezó a trabajar  solo , con créditos  que le otorgaron diferentes  micro financieras llegando  obtener  una línea de crédito de hasta C$3,000.00(Tres Mil Córdobas Netos). En l actualidad se dedica  a vender  pan, ya que es un producto masivo y le ha ido muy bien pues desde muy joven ha conocido este negocio.  
Esta  solicitando el crédito para capital de trabajo, necesita invertirlo en compra de materia prima , y  de nuevos producto como  la rosquilla somoteña ya que este  producto tiene gran demanda entre su clientela.
Su próxima meta es hacer  crecer  el  negocio, tener su propio capital de trabajo, darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos  y mejorar  la infraestructura de su vivienda,teniendo estabilidad economica atraves de su negocio.
texts.en:
52 year old Don Jesús is married and has 5 children to care for. He is a merchant and a native of the city of Estelí. Although it was a hard struggle, he was able to finish elementary school. However, his economic situation meant that he left school at an early age. He began working in a packing plant to the south of Estelí hospital. His first job was selling bread there, which he did for 3 years. Later, he took the initiative to start his own business and began to work for himself, using loans from various micro-finances institutions he had a line of credit up to $3,000 net (in Córdobas). He currently sells bread as it is an always-needed product and he is doing very well because he has understood this business since he was very young.
He is requesting a loan for working capital. He needs to buy raw materials and new products such as a type of donut that is in great demand by his customers. 
His next goal is to grow his business and have his own business capital so he can give his children a better standard of living and improve their home. He hopes his business will bring them economic stability.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and new food products

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating fishing and fish vending businesses. Her husband Benito, who is 45 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 15 and 24 years old. Isabelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Isabelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 to buy fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for education and home repairs. Isabelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra belongs to Faisalabad which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its textile industry. She has been living there in the area of Madina town with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 10 years. 

She is married to N. M. who is 38 years old and operates a billiard shop in the market where young children come to play billards and pay a fee. He has been in this business for the past three years and in this number of years, he has become renowned for his business.  
   
Azra is a very supportive lady by nature. She works as a lady health worker in her community. She gives health awareness talks among the ladies of her region. It earns her a reasonable income every month. She is the mother of two children. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another billiard table to provide more playing opportunities to his customers. 

Azra is hopeful that an investment will be productive one for him. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application through Asasah.

loans.use: To buy another billiard table for billiard shop.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 49 years old and widowed with one child who is in school.  Flora works very hard to provide for him.

Flora runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock.

Flora has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, sugar, bread, vinegar, salt etc. Flora also earns income from buying and selling frozen products.

In the future, Flora would like to be able to send her child to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: La Gloire Du Seigneur Group

texts.fr: N. B.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire « La Gloire du Seigneur »,  âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants et tous fréquentent l’école. Son mari est une sentinelle dans une entreprise Pétrolière « Station Africom ». La cliente N. B. est vendeuse des produits des denrées alimentaires. Elle s’installe au long de la rue donnant axer aux avenues de son quartier. Elle vient de réaliser 8 cycles opérationnels en bénéficiant de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouveaux produits (30 kilos d’arachides, 1 bidon d’huile, 50 kilos de haricots, 25 kilos de riz, etc. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et construire confortablement une maison pour sa famille.  La cliente N. B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  La Gloire du Seigneur » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: N. B. is an entrepreneur, president of the business group "The Glory of the Lord". She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 8 children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a watchman in "Station Africom," a petroleum company. N. B. sells food products. She set herself up along the street that runs through the avenues of her neighborhood. She has just completed 8 operational cycles while benefiting from MFI Hekima loans. This new loan will enable her to stock up with new products (30 kilos of peanuts, a can of oil, 50 kilos of beans, 25 kilos of rice, etc..) In addition, her goal is to expand her company and to build a comfortable home for her family. N. B. thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor people excluded from traditional banks. It should be noted that the business group "The Glory of the Lord" is mostly women.

loans.use: To buy 30 kilos of peanuts, 1can of oil, 50 kilos of beans, 25 kilos of rice, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Juana Toralba que tiene la edad de 55 años, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero a lo largo de su vida a prendi a contar y a escribir un poco, ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de nombre Erick que asiste a la preparatoria de su comunidad.

Doña juana nos platica que ella desde muy pequeña inicio a trabajar y actualmente se dedica a la venta de nopales, chiles, ciruelas y platanos, los cuales vende en el mercado de Tierra Blanca.

ella nos dice que inicio a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que desea que su hijo estudie una carrera y darle una mejor calidad de vida.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de platanos, nopales, chiles, platanos y bolsas desechables para poder realizar su actividad.

ella nos dice que espera en un futuro poder poner una pequeña verduleria en su comunidad para seguir ayudando a su hijo con sus estudios, Tambien envia un saludo   a la fundacion y mucho agradecimiento por el prestamo que le ha otorgado.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, here lives Juana T. who is 55, had no opportunities to go to school, but throughout her life she learned o count and write a little, she is a single mom, her son Erick attends the community's high-school.  

Juana says that from a young age she started to work and currently sells cactus, pepper, plums and bananas, at the market of Tierra Blanca.

She tells us that she started her own business because she wants her son to go to University and give him a better quality of life.

She needs this loan to invest it in the purchase of bananas, cactus, peppers, bananas and plastic bags for her business activity.  

She tells us that she hopes in the future to be able to start a small vegetable store in her community and this way continue to help her son with his studies, she sends greetings to the foundation and is thankful for the loan that they provided.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, cactus, peppers and plastic bags

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en: Salvador is 43 years of age and married with two school-aged children. He earns about PHP 10,000 for each crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. He grows corn and has been doing it for over 20 years. Salvador is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds for his farm. He dreams of having high yields to earn profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en: Enhtur is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in his parents' backyard. They live in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His older son, age 5, goes to kindergarten and his younger son who hasn't reached school age stays home. He runs a food cafe with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2005 but, because of family problems, had to shut it down for two years and start a construction business to supplement his earnings. Now he wants to reopen his food cafe at a local market. He is a friendly and open-minded person who attributes his business success to good managerial skill. He says: "I want to have my own house with the savings." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for his new cafe.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for a cafe

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla Vanessa de 32 años de edad, labora como asistente administrativa en la Universidad URACCAN  desde hace 7 años  desempeñandose con gran honestidad y responsabilidad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en la alcaldia municipal. Esta solicitando su 5to crèdito para construir una habitaciòn y asi gozar de mejores condiciones junto a su familia, es importante mencionar que Karla ha demostrado excelente capacidad y voluntad de pago,  su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia goze de salud y permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Karla Vanessa is 32 years old and works as an administrative assistant at URACCAN (University of the Autonomous Regions of the Nicaraguan Caribbean Coast). She has worked at this job for seven years with great honesty and responsibility. Karla has the support of her husband who works as a city employee.

She is requesting her fifth loan so that she can build a house in order for her to enjoy better living conditions with her family. It is important to mention that Karla has demonstrated an excellent capacity and willingness to submit her payments.

Her dream in life is for her family to be in good health and to always be together.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Guadalupe Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Guadalupe de profesion enfermera con mas catorce años, laborando en un hospital capitalino, casada, madre de dos hijos estudiantes. Su objetivo es mejorar su vivienda el cual lo ha venido haciendo con prestamo que Afodenic le ha otorgado en trece ciclos.
Pues ha sido viable ya que son a plazos, en donde demostrado un buen comportamiento de pagos, hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para cambio de techo el cual esta en mal estado.
Materiales a comprar: veinte laminas de zinc, quince perlines, bloques y hierro, cemento para levantar el alero, ante de poner el techo. Sastifecha por que podra dar  a su familia mejores condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a nurse by profession.  She has been working as a nurse for 14 years, in a hospital in the capital.  She is married and has two children who are in school.  Her aim is to improve her home and she has been doing this with loans from Afodenic over the course of thirteen loan cycles.  This has been possible because payments are made in instalments.  She has a good repayment history.

Guadalupe will use this new loan to replace her roof which is in a bad state of repair.  She will buy twenty sheets of corrugated metal, fifteen beams, blocks, iron and also cement which she will use to raise the eaves before she puts the new roof on.  She is happy because she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, beams, bolts, cement, sand and iron to replace her existing roof and raise it higher up

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 38 años, convive con Iván. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que quieren y aman. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. El deseo de Edith, es invertir en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que según afirma, “la mejor herencia es sacarlos profesionales”. Por ello, hace 12 años que viene dedicándose a la venta de verduras, hortalizas y maíz, en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Los días de mayor movimiento comercial son los miércoles, jueves y viernes, donde sale a vender, según cuenta mueve un capital de 3 mil a 2 mil nuevos soles diarios, generándole una ganancia del 10%. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder vender todo lo invertido, pero como todo negocio, ¡hay altibajos!, a veces guarda mercadería para el día siguiente. Por otro lado también se dedica a cuidar sus terrenos de cultivo, en donde siembra papa y arveja en el caserío de Patay y Palca. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para concretar sus objetivos. Razón por la que se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Edith de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de verduras, hortalizas y legumbres para comercializarlos en la feria.
texts.en:
Edith is 38 years old and lives with her partner Iván. They have 4 children, whom they love dearly. The family lives in their own home, located in the city of Tarma. Edith's desire is to invest in her children's education, because she says that "the best inheritance they can have is to grow into professional people". For this reason, she has been dedicating herself to the sale of vegetables, herbs and maize for the past 12 years, in the largest market in Tarma. The main market days are Wednesday, Thursday and Friday, when she can turn over 2000-3000 Soles in a day, generating a profit of 10%. What Edith likes best is when she is able to sell out of everything she has brought, because like any business there are highs and lows, and some times she has to keep stock over to sell the following day.

At the same time, she dedicates time to cultivating her land in the hamlet of Patay y Palca, where she sows potatoes and peas. She belongs to the "Integra" communal bank, and this is her 7th loan from [field partner] MFP. She hopes for your support in achiving her goals and vows to make her repayments on time. On receiving your support, Edith will invest the money in purchasing sacks of vegetables, herbs and pulses to sell at the market.

loans.use: To buy sacks of vegetables, herbs and pulses.

loans.name: Kanymkul's Group

texts.en: Kanymkul is the leader of this group. She is 53 and married to the local school teacher. Together with her husband, she has raised six children: three daughters and three sons. The youngest son studies at school and all the other children are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money to meet their needs, the family breeds livestock. Kanymkul sells six or seven liters of milk a day; in this way, she earns about 3,000 soms per month. Kanymkul applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to increase the number of livestock. She wants to purchase 10 livestock animals for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, Kanymkul wants to repair the house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
“My earnings from my 'tricycle' passenger transport service are not enough,” Danilo says. He is married, 33 years old, and blessed with three school-aged children. His only wife is a housekeeper and his partner in improving the quality of their family living conditions.

Danilo is a hard-working and dedicated to his work to ensure the essential needs of the family. Because his income in "tricycle" transport is not enough, he decided to put up a hog-raising business.

Danilo is asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy additional piglets to raise. He will use the loan wisely for the growth of his business. Danilo believes that this loan is a great contribution for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a thirty-one-year-old man, married with three children whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. He runs a general store in which he sells such items as sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil, and detergents to the local people at Kisimani in Mombasa. He has been in this business for two years now. 

He says that the business is profitable and the major challenges he has are financial constraints and the fact that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. 

He is using his loan of KES 25,000 to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and other items to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He describes himself as honest.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ngaza

texts.en:
Ngaza is a married woman with two children who both attend school. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past two years, she has operated a firewood-selling business, selling from home to neighbors and passersby. Ngaza decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Ngaza is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of firewood to sell and establish a business stall. She dreams of becoming a leading firewood supplier in the future.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and to establish a business stall

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 47-year-old married man and the father of seven children. Ibrahim has been working in selling electronics since 15 years ago. His business is linked with technology's updates, so he has to be aware of all the new releases.

Ibrahim also sells electronic spare parts, necessary to most people dealing with present day technology.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his electronic products capital through buying machines and tools with updated technology.

Ibrahim experienced Al Majmoua loans for two cycles; his previous loan was a good investment, and he's working hard to improve and develop his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To increase his electronic products with updated technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair a production machine

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with seven children who are attending school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has worked as a sweet potato and cassava seller at Kwale open air market for the past ten years; her potential clients are Kwale residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation cost of her products from the farm to the market. She dreams of putting up a decent stall and stocking it fully.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to add a variety of stock like arrowroots, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes and cassava. She decided to join Yehu because it offers good services.

loans.use: To purchase arrowroots, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 49, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Emma, a housewife and mother to their six children. Together they manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Romeo operates a tricycle transportation business. He owns a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar attached into it) that carries up to four to five passengers to their destination within the community. He earns through the boundary (daily quota) that their driver remits each day. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be using the loan for additional spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Romeo hopes to be able to expand soon and to sustain their daily needs. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Pelayo

texts.es: Pelayo de 40 años de edad, convive con Zenayda de 39 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Jose Olaya, Pangoa. Cuando Pelayo, se inició en la actividad agrícola, cultivando y comercializando cacao y café, no  le fue tan bien. Pero perseverante, continuo con este trabajo, y actualmente posee una buena cantidad de plantaciones de cacao y café, de esa manera logra cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes más recurrentes, de manera oportuna y eficaz, por lo cual se siente muy contento por lo hace. Consecuentemente sus ventas aumentaron, pero sin subir el precio del producto por lo que su margen de utilidad se mantiene estable. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa, pero en  temporadas de  cosecha, tiene a cargo de sus peones, con la finalidad de que les pueda facilitar en la extracción de su producto. Este será su primer crédito con MFP: por lo que se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 mil soles desea adquirir una nueva parcela agrícola donde pueda sembrar más plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Pelayo is 40 years old and lives with Zenayda who is 39.  The couple have three children and live together in their own home which is located in the community of Jose Olaya, Pangoa.  When Palayo started out farming, growing and selling cacao and coffee, things didn't go so well.  However, he persevered and continued in this line of work.  He currently owns a good quantity of cacao and coffee plantations.  This enables him to meet the demands of his recurring customers in a timely and efficient manner.  He therefore feels very happy with what he does.  Pelayo's sales have increased but the price he receives for his produce has not risen so his profit margin remains stable.  He generally works alongside his wife but, at harvest time, he hires laborers to help his crop picking go more smoothly.

This will be Pelayo's first loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He would like to use his 3,000 soles to acquire a new plot of farmland where he can grow more cacao plants.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land on which to grow cacao

loans.name: Santos Cristobal

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Cristobal tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero y es padre de 2 hijos,  Santos se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 8 años, también tiene dos manzanas para el cultivo de granos básicos (maiz y frijoles),  Santos utilizara el credito para comprar su propio panel de energia solar, no goza del servicio de energía eléctrica; él trabaja junto con sus familiares que viven en el hogar, por lo tanto los ingresos que perciben cuando se llega la cosecha es en un 100% porque no hace pagos a empleados.
Santos ya no quiere alumbrarse con candiles ni candelas todos los dias, dice que producen enfermedades respiratorias, ademas teniendo luz durante las noches podra utilizar mas el tiempo para hacer trabajos y tambien podra darles entretenimiento a sus hijos por medio de television y equipo de sonido, a la vez podra comprar un celular para estar comunicado con sus otros familiares que viven en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Santos Cristóbal, 47, is single and the father of two children.  Santos has been a coffee grower for 8 years; he also has two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] planted with basic grains (corn and beans).  Santos will use the loan to buy his own solar energy panel.  He does not have electricity.  He works with his family members who live at home and this way the profit from sale of the harvest when it arrives is 100% because he does not have to pay employee salaries.

Santos does not want to use candles for lighting any longer every day; she says they produce respiratory illnesses.  Besides, by having light during the night he will be able to do more work while also providing his children with entertainment via television and a sound system.  He will also be able to buy a mobile phone to be in communication with other family members who live in the city.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty is 38-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 3 and 19 years old. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling bread in Buluk, South Sudan, for five years.

Jenty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread for resale.

loans.name: Malis

texts.en:
Malis (pictured with her loom) is 31 years old and her husband, Sao, is 39 years old.  They live in a village along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons, two of which are in school, the other is still young. 

Malis is a weaver, while her husband is a construction worker.  In addition Malis and her husband also raise fish at home. She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and also to buy fish to raise and fish feed.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and to buy fish to raise and fish feed.

loans.name: Srey Touch

texts.en:
Srey Touch, 50, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a wood trader. Her husband raises animals to sell. 

Srey Touch requests a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase an engine to install a new bamboo train in order to carry wood to sell. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business selling wood and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase an engine to install a new bamboo train in order to carry wood to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo has been working in the farming business for 10 years planting rice.

He is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 in order to continue working in his business and to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. This is the only source of their income, which he uses for expenses for the lives of his wife and four children. Hence, he responsibly works in the field every day just to maintain his business well.

He just hopes to increase his profit to develop his family’s living and also his valued farming business.

loans.use: to continue working in his business and to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Зариф женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Он очень старательный и добрый человек. С большими усилиями и страданием он открыл свой бизнес и продолжает его успешно. Более 10 лет он занимается скотоводством. В настоящее время он имеет одну дойную корову  и теленка. Он продает их на скотном  рынке и получает хороший доход. Он имеет хорошие условия на содержание скота. Он  имеет корм для них. Зариф запрашивает займ для покупки скота и корма. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zarif is married and the responsible father of two children.  He is a very hard-working and kind man.  With great effort and hardship, he managed to open his own business, at which he is now very successful.  He has been working in animal husbandry for more than ten years.  He currently owns one dairy cow and one calf.  He sells his cattle at the market and receives a good income.  He keeps his cattle in good living conditions and has food for them.  Zarif is requesting a loan to buy additional cattle and feed.  He looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Egliceria

texts.en: Egliceria is a hardworking mother from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old and a businesswoman who engages in rice production business. She also buys palay grains for additional income. Egliceria has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Egliceria hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy cows and expand his dairy farming business.

loans.name: Avila

texts.en:
B. has a mini-bazaar where she sells gifts for all occasions, materials for painting fingernails, and school supplies. She was motivated to start her business by her mother-in-law, who gave B. use of a small space in her store so that she could launch her own business. Her husband helped her procure the products. He works selling the same products in the street.

She would use the loan to buy school supplies because the back to school season is about to begin. With the additional earnings, she will be able to expand her business.

B. is 22 years old, with one daughter. Her husband works selling school supplies in the street. Although they are a young couple, they are very hardworking and very motivated to get ahead. B. dreams that her business will grow and she will be able to own her own parcel of land some day.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

B. tiene un mini bazar donde vende regalos para toda ocasión, materiales para pintar uñas, y útiles escolares. Ella fue motivada por su suegra ya que ella tiene una tienda y le cedió un espacio para que se inicie su negocio. Su esposo le ayudó con el material para que se inicie en la casa. Él también trabaja vendiendo estos mismos artículos pero en la calle.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares porque la temporada se inicia. Con los ingresos generados podrá incrementar su negocio.

B. tiene 22 años. Con 1 niña. Su esposo trabaja vendiendo en la calle útiles escolares. Son una pareja joven pero muy trabajadores dispuestos a salir adelante. Su sueño es que sus negocios se incrementen y algún día tener su terreno.

loans.use: Buy school supplies

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en: Sardar lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an old man and he has the responsibility for supporting his family because one of his sons died during left this old man with children to support. He has a retail shop and he wants to buy more things for his shop. He wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like boxes of chocolates, bars of sweets, bags of potato chips, crisps and extra materials. He wants to make a good income for his family and make a better life. He is very happy that he can help the widow of his son.

loans.use: To buy boxes of chocolates, bars of sweets, bags of potato chips, crisps and extra materials

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa R. T., 24, has been sewing for ten years making sweatpants and jackets. She has expanded her business and now employs five other people. Her shop produces 144 items per week, and the jackets sell for as much as 60 Guatemalan Quetzals, or almost US$8.00. She sells the items at wholesale, by the dozen, in the market in nearby San Francisco El Alto. She'll use this loan to feed the shop's insatiable need for more fabric.

Tomasa's husband died about four years ago, leaving her with two small children. The older child is now in school, and the younger will start soon. Tomasa herself had two years of school as a child, so learned to read and write and speak Spanish in addition to her native Quiché.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in Paxixil, San Francisco El Alto, Totonicapán

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase fabric to sew sweatshirts and jackets

loans.name: Nor Khoda

texts.en: Nor Khoda lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married, and he has one small son. He has a metal shop. He was small boy when he started working, so he has a lot of experience in his job. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines for his shop and also increase his stock to attract more clients. He is happy that he can expand his business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Faalagilagi

texts.en: Faalagilagi is 36 years old, married, and a mother of 3. Her husband works for one of the local factories, and the family owns a plantation and a vegetable garden as additional sources of income. However, raising three children has been difficult, because her husband's income is not sufficient even to pay the bills and the children's school fees. Therefore, Faalagilagi has decided to invest more time and money in the plantation and the vegetable garden, because she believes that the family can thus earn more. Faalagilagi first heard about SPBD through the village women, and was very delighted to join, so that she could get an opportunity to develop her business. She has applied for her first loan of US$300, and is very confident that her business will successfully expand.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers, chemicals, and other supplies for a vegetable garden

loans.name: Riski

texts.en: Riski S. is divorced. She has 6 children and two of her sons are already married.Her business is in the trade of children's clothes. She chose  this kind of business because she loves her own children very much.They helped her in difficult situation when her husband divorced her. Her children are the source of her main meaning in her life.Due them she did not lose her presence of mind  and she found the  power to live and thrive.Today Riski is happy because she has 4 grandchildren. Her sons help  her financially.  But she does not want sit at home because her work has  became something that she could not imagine her life without.  Now she is requesting a loan to help repair the roof of her house. She also wants to increase the volume of her goods.

loans.use: Purchase the next batch of goods.

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ha Thi T., 31 years old, has a 35-year-old husband and 2 children who are still going to school. Her main activity is to sell merchandises such as candies, wines, cigarettes, etc. Whoever has come to her store would never forget her friendliness to customers. During 7 years joining the Fund, she always uses her loan effectively. Her current income is 150 USD/month. This time she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more merchandise to improve her business. She also intends to expand her business into other fields like restaurant in the future.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hà Thị Thêu năm nay 31 tuổi, còn chồng chị năm nay 35 tuổi, hai anh chị có 2 cháu đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc chính của chị là bán buôn, bán lẻ các loại hàng hóa như bánh kẹo, rượu, thuốc lá và một số mặt hàng khác. Ai đã từng đến cưả hàng kinh doanh của chị Thêu thì không thể quên được chị bán hàng luôn nhiệt tình với khách đến mua hàng ấy. Trong 7 năm tham gia, chị luôn là thành viên vay vốn và sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả của Quỹ TYM. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Thêu là 150USD. Lần này chị muốn đề nghị Quỹ cho chị vay mức vốn 1200USD để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh. Trong tương lai chị cũng có dự định sẽ mở rộng việc kinh doanh sang các lĩnh vực khác như mở hàng ăn.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Dominga Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Dominga is a strong woman who has supported her husband for eight years by making and selling corn tortillas and beans in her humble home. They are a family of scare economic resources. Her work is tiring because she gets up at 5:00 in the morning and goes to bed at 9:00 at night because she strives to pay some of their home's expenses.

The products that Dominga makes in her home are consumed daily by the neighboring homes in her community because they represent basic food stuffs for poor families. Dominga's husband works as a security guard and pays for the rest of the home's expenses. This credit will be used to construct a room for their son. Right now all three of them sleep in the same room. With this money, they will be able to buy cheap materials to construct a room for their son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Dominga es una mujer esforzada que desde hace 8 años apoya a su esposo elaborando y vendiendo tortillas de maíz y frijoles cosidos en su humilde vivienda, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, su trabajo es cansado se levanta a las cinco de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche con este esfuerzo ha podido suplir ciertos gastos de la casa.

Los productos que la señora elabora en su casa son consumidos diariamente en los hogares aledaños de su comunidad, ya que representan la alimentación básica de las familias pobres. El esposo de la señora trabaja como guarda de seguridad y es quien complementa todos los gastos de la casa. La solicitud del crédito de esta pareja es la de construirle un cuarto a su hijo, en vista que actualmente duermen los tres en la misma habitación, con ese dinero podrán con materiales baratos construirle a su hijo.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron to construct a room

loans.name: Sroun

texts.en: Mrs. Sroun H., 39, a mother of six children, works selling a variety of vegetables in the market close to her house, earning about $5 a day. Her husband contributes to the family income as a construction worker building houses, on average earning about $4 a day. Two of their sons also work at the construction site, normally earning around $3 each per day. Mrs. H. requests a loan of $200 to purchase more grocery products to sell, as she now has many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Señor De Exaltacion Group

texts.es:
In the Villa Tejada Zone lies a Focus Center with the same name, to which the Señor de Exaltacion Association and its 16 members belong to. This is a very pleasant and likeable group, being that aside from working together with the loan system that Pro-Mujer offers them, they all formed a very beautiful friendship.

There are several activities that the women of the association perform. One of them owns a store that sells provisions while others sell prepared meals, ice cream or potatoes, but the majority of them make clothing such as blouses, pants, dresses and other garments. These items are created by them.

They now need more capital to purchase imported fabrics and special equipment to expand their businesses and be able to offer their higher quality products outside of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En la zona de villa tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “señor de exaltacion”que cuenta con 16 socias. Un grupo muy simpático ya que además de trabajar juntas con el sistema de créditos que Pro-Mujer les ofrece, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas. Son varias las actividades que realiza la asociación “, alguna de ellas tiene una tienda de víveres, otras socias venden comida, helados, papas, pero la mayoría se dedica a la confección de ropa como ser: blusas, pantalones y vestidos y otros. Estos artilculos son confeccionados por ellas mismas. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de telas importadas y equipos especiales, de esta manera poder expandir su negocio y lograr ofrecer sus productos de mayor calidad, fuera del país.

loans.use: Obtain capital to purchase imported fabrics and special equipment.

loans.name: Saly Nem Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saly N., the leader of a group of five in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is a palm leaf sewer. She is 49 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the other is yet too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Rom Mao, is a motorbike taxi-driver. Because the family’s current income is small, she is requesting a loan in order to start a business breeding pigs.  Previously, Mrs. Saly N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to start a new business.

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
Fikret A. is a 41-year-old man who breeds calves for meat production in a small village near the Saatli region. He is married and has three children.

Fikret is requesting a loan to purchase four baby calves. Summer is the high season for wedding parties, and Fikret believes that breeding his calves and selling them in this time period will be very beneficial to his sales.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Tepa

texts.en: Tepa I., 48, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to friends, relatives and the village community during the peak season. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~140 USD). She has one previous loan with SPBD; these loans are Aiga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of equipment (shovels, pesticides, knives) for a taro/banana business.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy P., 37, lives in Sa Ang, Cambodia, with her husband and their two children. She and her husband, Touch Rim, work together on the family's farm land, growing vegetables to eat and sell in the market. They typically make US $2 each day out in the fields.

Soy P. has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase more vegetable seeds for their farm. She believes that through increasing her yield, she can also increase her family's income and provide for her future.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji is the wife of M. H. and lives in an area of city Lahore named Ismail Nagar, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 10 years. She is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son. Her elder daughter is married. The next completed her education at the 8th standard and now does household work. Her son is in kindergarten. 

Her husband has a shop where he sells construction supplies (cement and small stones). Her husband has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Shahnaz baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies (cement, hailstones) for her husband's shop.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok N. is a villager in Prey Leak Neng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Chan Pon, is a farmer. They have four children: three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the other is a cow breeder. Although Mrs. Sok N.'s family members are involved in different businesses, they still cannot afford to build a new bathroom their household. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to build a new bathroom to improve her family's living conditions.

Her husband is also present in the photo.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Stella's Group

texts.en:
Stella K. has been selling maandazi and fruit in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. Maandazi is a small, donut-like square of fried, semi-sweet dough. They are commonly eaten for breakfast and as a snack throughout Tanzania.

Stella works for twelve hours every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 180 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ingredients for maandazi and more fruit for her shop. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profit to pay her child's school fees and improve her home.

Stella is 40 years old, married, and has one 22-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Erde and Maryam. Each has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for maandazi

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin K., 49, is married and lives with her husband (pictured in the photo) and 5 children in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn their living by growing rice and different types of vegetables. Together, they earn about $5 per day. Rin K. is requesting a loan of $500 to hire a farm worker to help harvest the crops and plow the farmland in preparation for the next growing season.

loans.use: Hire a farm worker to help harvest the crops and plow the farmland.

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: Essohanam P. est une revendeuse de céréales, depuis 5 ans au marché de Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Essohanam exerce cette activité depuis 7 ans et elle demeure sa principale source de revenus. Elle souhaite augmenter la taille de son commerce avec ce deuxième crédit afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et par conséquent accroître ses profits pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Essohanam P. has been a grain saleswoman for 5 years at the market in Lavie, a village about 135 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children who are all in school. Essohanam has been doing this type of business for 7 years and it remains her primary source of income. She hopes to increase the size of her business with this second loan in order to better satisfy her clientele and consequently increase her profits to better provide for her children.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of corn, beans and groundnuts for selling

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mr. Horn K. was born in 1962 and he now lives in Stoeng Hang village in Kampong Cham province. He is a laborer in the local village. His wife, Mrs. Yun Nhor, is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in the village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it.

In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Horn K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more grocery goods for his wife's business. He is the father of two children, one of whom helps the mother in her business while the other is attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for his wife's business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K., currently in the business of selling bread, is requesting a loan to expand her enterprise. Twenty-seven years old and married to a driver, she has two children, both in school. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Nyimbo

texts.en:
Nyimbo has owned a small store, selling charcoal and firewood, in the Milinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for the last 5 years. She belongs to the Tujitegemee loan group (Group code 2003).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, so that she can buy more  supplies of charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Nyimbo is 42 years old, divorced, and has three children: ages 15, 12 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Mrs. Elena S. is 47 years old, married and lives at Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. With PHP 3,000 starting capital, Elena and her husband strived hard for their "lechon" (roasted pig) & meat-dealing business. Having good sales, the couple decided to acquire a stall in the public market where they can display their meat. In order for them to expand their business, they acquired a loan at Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2007. Being a member in good standing, applying for a loan has been so easy. Elena applies for PHP 40,000 to buy pigs for sale including feed. She plans to buy a rice field and coconut land someday if they have promising sales.

loans.use: To buy pigs for sale and feed

loans.name: Merli Sulema

texts.es:
La Sra.Merli Sulema H., se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de Tortillas desde hace diez años, actividad que realiza todos los dias de la semana, su horario de labores es de 6:00 AM hasta la 1:00 Mediodia, descansa un rato en la tarde y vuelve a comerzar a las 4:00 PM y termina  a las 7:00 PM, tiene clientes fijos ya que su tortillas son muy ricas y estan  elaboradas con maiz de 
color amarillo, La señora necesita un credito para terminar la contruccion del baño sanitario ya que el actual esta muy deteriorado. Con su negocio ha logrado ir mejorando su vivienda, ella tiene tres hijos los que estudian en la escuela, colegio y el mayor trabaja, su esposo es Albañil y el mismo realizara la contruccion del baño.
texts.en:
Ms. Merli Sulema H., has made, and sold, tortillas for a living since she was ten-years-old. She sells tortillas everyday. Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. She rests for a while in the afternoon and starts again at 4:00 p.m. She finishes at 7:00 p.m. She has regular clients because her tortillas are delicious and are made with yellow corn. She needs a loan in order to finish building a bathroom because her current one is in shambles. She has been able to fix up her house because of her business. She has three children. One goes to elementary school, one to high school and the eldest works. Her husband, Albañil, will build the bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales para contruccion de Baño Sanitario

loans.name: Laurentina Naife

texts.pt:
Laurentina nasceu em zavala, tem 40anos de idade vive maritalmente estudou ate a 7 classe e mae de um filho que se encontra a estudar na universidade pedagogica na capital. 

Laurentina sai de zavala com seus pais em emissao de serviço a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilanda pois seu pai era funcionario do governo do distrito, chegado a namaacha não teve acesso a escola devido a falta de documentaçao d transiçao de uma escola para outra e ficou sem estudar. O tempo foi passando e esta fica gravida do seu primeiro e único filho este que foi regeitado pelo seu namorado alegando que o filho que ela esperava ter não lhe pertencia, laurentina fica desesperada e pede ajuda ao seu pai este dalhe um fundo e ela iniicia com o seu proprio negocio de venda de riçois no mercado clandestino.Com o fundo colectado ela começa a fazer refeiçoes na fronteirada swazilandia onde amaior fluxo de gente, hoje e dona de um estabelecimento de refeiçoes  por dia tem comprado 10 frangos a 100 cada, 5kg de dobrada a 50 o kg  , 5kg de carne a 95 cada, cada  prato tem seu preço por exemplo o frango tem feito 40.00mt o prato e consegue fazer 7 pratos por frango a carne e a dobrado não tem numeros esactos dependem muito mais da qualidade da carne, tem vendido diariamente 1.500.00mt nos dias normais e 2.300.00mt nos dias de muito movimento mas consegue poupar somente 500.00mt devido as dispesas do seu filho que se encontra na universidade e  dos 2 empregados um dos quais ajuda lhe na barraca ganhando 800.00mt e outra em casa gahando 700.00mt mensalmente.

Este e o segundo emprestimo de laurentina na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva . estes 10.000.00mt seram usados para comprar mais produtos pois ela esta prestes a abrir um outro estabelecimento de refeiçoes no mercado informal shoprite e revender produtos produtos de primeira necessidade. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo estipulado e pedir um novo emprestimo para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Laurentina was born in Zavala. She is 40 years old, married, and went to school until the 7th grade. She is the mother of one son who is studying at the Pedagogical University in the Capital. Laurentina left Zavala with her parents who were serving in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, since her father was an official of the local government. Having arrived in Namaacha she did not have access to schooling due to a lack of documentation for transfers from one school to another so she went without. Time passed, and she became pregnant with her first and only child who was rejected by her boyfriend who alleged that the child she hoped to have did not belong to him. Laurentina became desperate and asked for help from her father who gave her some funds. She began her own business of selling empanadas on the black market. With the funds collected she began to prepare food on the Swaziland border where there was a large flux of people. Today she is the owner of a food stand. Every day she purchases 10 chickens at 100 each, 5kg of stomach at 50 per kg, and 5kg of beef at 95 per kg. Each plate has a price. For example, the chicken plate is 40MT per plate, and she can make 7 plates per chicken. The beef and the stomach do not have exact numbers because it depends on the quality of the meat. She sells 1,500MT on the normal days and 2,300MT on the busy days, but she is only able to save 500MT due to the expenses of her son, who is at the university, and her 2 employees. One of her employees helps her in the stand earning 800MT, and the other helps at home earning 700MT monthly. This is Laurentina's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. This 10,000MT will be used to purchase more products since she is ready to open another food stand in the informal market, Shoprite, to resell staple products. She is confident that she will be able to pay off the loan before the stipulated time and request another loan in order to furnish her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare foods

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86605&_tpos=7&_tpg=2
Graciela  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas, es casada y tiene 55 años
Graciela  se dedica a dar desayuno  con la ayuda de su esposo, cada día se levanta bien temprano para la preparación de  los desayunos, ella empezó con una carreta y ahora tiene tres carretas y ha contratado a una señora para que atienda su tercera carreta.
Graciela necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para el arreglo de su carreta y compra al por mayor de quinua,  soya, cajas de leche, azúcar. 
Desde que  Graciela  esta  en  Finca aprendió a esforzarse cada día para llegar a cumplir sus sueños 
El sueño de Graciela es tener un restaurante
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of of “Las Orquideas” community bank. She 55 years old and married. Graciela sells breakfast with the help of her husband. Every day she gets up very early to prepare the breakfasts. She began with one cart and now has three, and has hired a woman to take charge of the third cart.

Graciela needs a loan of 1200 soles (Peruvian currency) to fix her cart and to buy quinoa, soy, milk, and sugar at wholesale prices.

Since Graciela has been with Finca she has learned to work hard every day to achieve her dreams. Graciela’s dream is to own her own restaurant.

Graciela's first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86605&_tpos=7&_tpg=2

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix her cart and purchase quinoa, soy, milk and sugar at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores.
Paola es  madre soltera 32 tiene dos hijos de 13 y 11 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Paola  vende hace seis años se separo de su esposo y se puso a trabajar en la venta de sándwich vende diario 40 panes.
Desde que Paola esta en Finca  ha empezado a surgir, esta involucrada en el Bancomunal es la tesorera, y le gusta la  solidaridad.
Paola  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de un carrito sanwichero.
El sueño de Paola es comprarse un carrito sanwichero.
texts.en:
Paola is a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank. Paola is a single mother who is 32 years old and has two children who are 13 and 11 and who are students in public school. Paola separated from her husband six years ago and began working selling sandwiches. She sells 40 loaves daily. Since joining FINCA, Paola has begun to break forth. She is involved in the community bank as the treasurer and she likes the camraderie. Paola needs a loan of 1,000 soles in order to purchase a sandwich cart. Paola's dream is to buy herself said cart.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sandwich cart.

loans.name: Osei

texts.en: Osei is 36 years old.  He is married with four kids.  Three are in school.  He is a taxi driver and has been doing this for the past six years.  Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He picks up passengers from the local station and drives them to nearby towns for a fare of 50 pesewas (0.5 cedis) per head.  However, his business is in crisis because his car has broken down and he needs money for repairs.  He requests a loan to maintain his taxi car to resume his business to make income to support his family and get his kids back to school.  He belongs to a community group called Fervent Trust.  Members guarantee each others loans and apply peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: Maintain taxi car.

loans.name: Mel

texts.en: Mel Y., 56, lives in her small family home in the province of Banteay Meanchey. There, she owns a small restaurant to sell wine, soft drinks and foods to neighbors who come to eat and drink at her shop. She is a married mother blessed with four children, one of whom is married and lives separately, while the others are still living in home. Her husband is currently working in the military police post and also helps as manager for her business activities. Mel Y. will be using her loan to buy additional wine, beer, soft drinks and essential ingredients in order to continue selling.

loans.use: To buy additional wine, beer, soft drinks and essential ingredients

loans.name: Amida

texts.en:
Amida is a member of the Mgadi North borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 34-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of four children. Her children are aged 15, 12, 8 and 2 years. She also cares for one other dependent. 

Amida started her own business nine years ago selling tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 80,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Amida’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes and potatoes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Amida hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Rosario De Fátima

texts.es:
Desde hace 20 años, en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Rosario H. se dedica a vender productos escolares ambulantemente por todo el mercado ofreciendo lapiceros, libretas, marcadores, borradores, entre otros.

Ella está comprometida a llevar el sustento a su hogar y para ello se esfuerza grandemente en la actividad. Hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos escolares y así venderlos ambulantemente en el mercado y mejorar su condición de vida por medio de su actividad.

loans.use: Compra de artículos escolares

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat des articles de quincaillerie

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is engaged in vegetable vending business. She is married to Ronillo, a farmer. She is 29 years old and blessed with two children who were still young. She is thankful because her husband helps her in the business she manages. Improving the business is what she aims for in order to support her two children future education. She wanted to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional capital. She hopes that she could avail the amount of loan she is requesting for she believes it is of big help in the improvement of her vending activity. 

Wilfreda further shared that her daily vending income was utilized to provide for their daily immediate needs at home. Some of her income was being saved for their future family use. With loan she had requested, Wilfreda is hoping that her business become productive to give their children a secure living condition.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Soeur S. is a villager in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a Khmer cake maker. She is 50 years old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a laborer. Now Mrs. Soeur S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow, ten pigs, and pig food for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow, ten pigs, and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 60 years old and married with four children. She sells sarongs of various colors and sizes in the market; she has been in this business for a long time. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to be able to meet the demands of her customers. She is seeking a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell to keep up with demand. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como taxi, es independiente y soltero.
Vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. 
El crédito será destinado para reparación de vehiculo, y compra de llantas.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos has a vehicle that he uses as a taxi. He is independent and single. He lives in the Tembladerani region of the city of La Paz. He lives in his parents’ house. The loan is to repair his vehicle and to buy tires. This is the third time that he has asked Impro for a loan. His history qualifies him as client 1, which means good completion of paying his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of repair and maintenance of his taxi and to buy tires

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
El banco comunal 3 de Noviembre se encuentra en la parroquia de Cumbe al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca,  éste lugar se caracteriza por sus artesanías en tejido, también se han identificado sitios arqueológicos como  Cauzhin y Tambo de Mariviña atractivos que atraen a turista nacional y extranjero.

Ese banco está formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que han forjado  una amistad muy sólida siempre en busca de mejoras para su familia y su banco comunal.


La señora Rosario C. es socia activa de éste banco comunal, vive en la parroquia  Cumbe, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y es  madre de tres hijos de 33, 30, 22 años de edad, su hija mayor formo su propia familia y vive en su casa mientras que sus otros hijos migraron al exterior en busca de mejores días para ellos y sus padres;  su esposo trabaja como albañil y con  el esfuerzo de todos lograron construir su casa.

Rosario se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y también a la cría de animales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos, ovejas  y vacas de estas  últimas la producción de leche entrega a sus vecinos de la comunidad, los animales que cría es tanto para el consumo en casa como para la venta.

Nuestra socia lleva doce años trabajando  con los prestamos de la fundación, con ellos ha comprado poco a poco sus animales y  con el nuevo crédito solicitado  va a comprar abono para sus potreros y sembrar pasto para sus animales.

Su meta es comprar un terreno para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Third of November Community Bank is found in the parish of Cumbe, southwest of the city of Cuenca, Ecuador. This place is known for its craftwork in weaving and also for archeological sites like Cauzhin and Tambo de Mariviña, which attract national and foreign tourists alike. The community bank consists of a group of businesswomen who have forged a solid friendship while always looking to improve their families and community bank. Rosario C. is an active member of this community bank. She lives in Cumbe, is 54 years old, married and has three children, ages 33, 30 and 20. Her eldest daughter has her own family and lives at home, while the other two migrated abroad in search of better days for themselves and their parents. Her husband is a construction worker, and with everyone's efforts they were able to build their home. Rosario dedicates herself to households chores and also raises animals like chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, sheep and cows, which produce milk that she delivers to neighbors in her community. She raises the animals as much for her family to eat as to sell them. Rosario has 12 years' experience working with loans from Kiva partner Foundacion Espoir, and with them she has purchased her animals little by little. With the new loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her animals' pastures. Her goal is to purchase land for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for her animals' pastures

loans.name: Constancio

texts.en:
Constancio T. is married, and all his children are fully grown.

Constancio’s business is providing the ingredients for chip stands. He has a strategic location in town and thanks to high quality and quick service, he has built up a loyal clientele and makes a good profit. He will use his loan to purchase cheese, starch, oils and other ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, starch, oils and other ingredients

loans.name: Fandi

texts.en: Fandi is a 54-year-old married man living in Hasbayya, Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and two children. Fandi has owned a rest house which is in one of the multiple touristic places in the region for five years. Fandi requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to build extra rooms with aluminum windows for the winter season which will attract tourists and Unifil members to his place rather than others. Fandi hopes to have a famous restaurant in the future, depending on the winter customers if he makes his planned changes.

loans.use: To build extra rooms with aluminum windows for the winter season

loans.name: Adela Efigenia

texts.es:
Adela A. de 45 años, vive en una casa de ladrillos con agua y luz como servicios básicos esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, esta casada hace  9 años su esposo trabaja como carpintero y constructor tiene una niña de 3 años.

Adela hace ya un año atrás fue invitada por una amiga a ser parte de las vendedoras Yanbal así comenzó después de tener unos ahorros invirtió en ropa para venderla con los productos Yanbal. Ahora Adela trabaja en cualquier horario en que les pidan los productos  vende perfumes, cremas, lociones, ropa, maquillajes, una de las mayores complicaciones es cuando da crédito de sus productos por lo que no les cancelan rápido para poder invertir ese dinero.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yanbal y ropa para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere poner su propio gabinete de belleza y poder terminar su casa.
texts.en:
