Adela is 45 years old and lives in a brick home with basic services, including electricity and running water. Her home is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has been married for nine years. Her husband works as a carpenter and construction worker. They have a three year-old daughter. A year ago a friend invited her to sell Yanbal beauty products. This allowed her to save up some money, which she invested in clothing, which she sold alongside the Yanbal items. Adela now works anytime her customers request her products. She sells perfumes, creams, lotions, clothing, and makeup. One of her biggest complications is when her customers do not cancel orders in a timely manner and she must then pay for the items herself. She will use the money from this loan to invest in other Yanbal products and clothing in order to be able to offer a wider assortment. In the future she would like to have her own shop and to finish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing and Yabal beauty products

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en: Andriy is 21 years old and single. He sells bags and some clothing at a small store that he rents. Andrei started this business two years ago with the help of his mother, who has been in a similar business for many years. Andrei enjoys learning about sales and making progress with his business. He would like to develop it further and increase the variety of his stock. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH, and hopes to invest the additional income he makes back into his business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his stock

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora J. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local beer and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Flora is 30 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar and restaurant.


 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es: José Daniel R. C. de de 36 años de edad, reside en Zacatecoluca, municipio ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad. José posee una venta de bolsones, carteras, ropa y alpinas, las cuales comercializa a las afueras del mercado Municipal de Zacatecoluca, así mismo trabaja como empleado para una empresa privada por las noches. Durante el día su esposa le ayuda en el negocio vendiendo los productos de manera ambulante tanto adentro como afuera del mercado. José ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora a quien no le importa esforzarse por sacar adelante a su familia, es por esto que él cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que siempre están tratando de salir adelante junto a su esposa, y velando por el bienestar de su hijo, el cual estudia en el kinder. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar su inventario, incrementando los productos que ya posee obteniendo diferentes estilos y colores de bolsones, esto le permitirá abarcar mayor cantidad de clientes, así mismo mayor cantidad de ropa, sobre todo para hombre que es la que más vende.
texts.en:
José Daniel R. C. is 36 years old and lives in Zacatecoluca, a municipality located in the department of La Paz. He lives together with his wife and their small 6-year old boy. José owns a business selling backpacks, purses, clothing and alpine clothing, which he sells in the outskirts of the Zacatecoluca municipal market. He also works as an employee for a private company at night. During the day, his wife helps him with the business selling the products on foot both inside and outside of the market. José has proven to be a very hardworking person who does not mind putting in effort to help his family move forward. This is why he has very good reference from his neighbors, as he is always trying to move forward with his wife and looking out for the well-being of his son, who is in kindergarten. José is requesting a loan to be able increase his inventory (increasing the number of products he already has, obtaining different styles and colors of backpacks). This will allow him to cover a larger number of customers. Likewise, have more clothing is important because it is what he sells the most.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and backpacks

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika T. tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la colocación de unas postizas de acrílico.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de materia prima, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Solicita el préstamo y así poder comprar el material, y así atender mejor a sus clientas.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Erika has been in the business of applying acrylic fingernails for more than one year. The business could use a greater variety of materials, but at the moment [Erika] doesn’t have the money to buy the materials. She is asking for this loan in order to buy materials and better serve her customers. She will repay the loan with the revenue from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Edit Miriam

texts.en:
Edit Miriam is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Edit Miriam is a 38-year-old single mother of one and lives in the city of Cuzco. Her son is currently enrolled in a local university and is studying systems engineering. 

Edit Miriam makes a living selling meat in the San Sebastian market in Cuzco. Here she owns a stand among other vendors. Edit Miriam will use her Kiva loan to invest in her meat business, buying more products to increase her sales. She will also use part of the loan to pay for her son’s university tuition. 

Edit Miriam is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Business capital and tuition payments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy noodles and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es:
La señora Johanna O. G. es casada y madre de  2 hijos pequeños que dependen económicamente de ellos, ella tiene 36 años y hace 3 años emprendieron un negocio de venta de  abarrotes, productos para el hogar y personal.

Fue gracias a la ayuda de su esposo que lograron la apertura de la pulpería, desean invertir en el negocio en la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería, para el negocio, es por esta razón que solicitan de este préstamo, esperan se les apoye económicamente para tener una mejor estabilidad económica que les beneficie a futuro en proyecto de la familia. Este no es el primer prestamo que tienen con Afodenic, gracias a este apoyo es que ellos han  logrado evolucionar el negocio, y cada dia mejoran sus niveles de vida, esperan que esta no sea la excepción.
texts.en:
Sra. Johanna O. G. is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two young children who are financially dependent on her. She started a business three years ago selling groceries, including household and personal products.

Thanks to help from her husband, she was able to open her store. She wants to invest in a large supply of merchandise for her business, which is why she is requesting this loan. Johanna seeks support in hopes of having better financial stability that will benefit her family in the future. This is not her first loan with AFODENIC. Thanks to her previous loans, she was able to develop her business and improve each day her standard of living. She hopes this loan will be no exception.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis is a 42-year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has three dependents living with him. Sarkis has been working as a car painter since 2001. Since he has lots of experience in this domain from his previous job, he decided to open his own garage. His customers include neighbors and friends from his community. Sarkis is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. Sarkis will use the loan to continue to develop his business. This is his fifth cycle and he has always paid on time. Thanks to his previous loans he was capable of improving his work and providing good quality services for his clients.

loans.use: To develop his business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto V. is from the village of Pag-asa, Salawagan Quezon Bukidnon. He is 44 years old. Roberto is single. To make a living, Roberto owns & operates an animal feed & farm-related products business. Roberto has been engaged in his business for over 19 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Roberto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Roberto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Roberto is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 20th loan taken out by Roberto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Bathmorie United Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Bathmorie United”, named after the section in which they live in Magburaka town. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a  loan of SLL 800,000 for each from Kiva lenders through SMT.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.
 
The group’s leader, Al-Hassan S. B. (pictured in the middle) sells used clothes. Born in Matotoka village, the 59-year-old father of four will use his share of the loan to buy used clothes: jeans, T-Shirts, raincoats, sweaters, etc. With many years of experience in this business, Alhassan carefully selects the type of clothes he buys based on the prevailing season.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Chrislene

texts.en:
Chrislene D. is a 30 year-old woman who supports her family by breeding and selling balot (fertilized duck eggs). She lives with her with common-law husband and a child who is a year and four months old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her balot business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Chrislene is borrowing Php 12,000 to use as additional working capital. This will be her fifth cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Chrislene aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure its future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Vanary

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanary T., 29, and her husband, Mr. Phally Chhoun (pictured together), 37, have been married since 1993 and just have a young daughter. The couple lives with Vanary’s parents along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vanary has been a garment factory worker for 8 years. Her husband has been a physician for 5 years. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $600 to build a fence around her land property.

loans.use: To build a fence around her land property.

loans.name: Bekzhan

texts.en:
Bekzhan A. is 35 years old and lives with his family in the neighborhood of Kyz-Molo village. He has two daughters: four and two years old.  At his country place, Bekzhan is known as a hard-working and energetic person.

Bekzhan was born in a farmworker’s family and, from early childhood helped his parents in farming. Over the years, he inherited the farm and a house near it. Gaining a wide experience in stockmanship, 15 years ago Bekzhan started his business in cattle breeding, which became the main source of income for his family. Due to his strong efforts, Bekzhan has developed his farm and today it amounts to ten milk cows and five bulls. Bekzhan and his wife sell milk to their loyal customers and have earnings of 10,000 Kyrgyz Soms monthly.

Bekzhan plans to use the loan of 90,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden his business through buying three milk cows, which will allow for increased milk sales. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle.

Bekzhan is doing his best to provide good conditions in which his children can develop. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan and known for its history and culture. 
She is 35 years old lives in a three-roomed brick house with her family. She has converted her house into a home with her great management qualities.  
Zahida is the mother of a 12 year old son who had to start a business at a very early age and couldn’t get an education. He sells purses and men's wallets. Her husband is illiterate and works in a vegetable market as a vegetable seller. Zahida supports her family by operating a PCO (Public calling office where people make a call and pay the call charges) at her home. She has dedicated a room and converted it to a PCO. Her business is currently going well. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to buy some seasonal vegetables for his business. She hopes that her husband’s business will improve and his income will be increased. She is a regular loan user of Asasahand; this is her fifth loan cycle. She has proven herself as a responsible client who never misses a single meeting and timely pays her installments. 

Note: "In this photo, Zahida is showing the phone sets in her PCO".

loans.use: Purchase seasonal vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi is a single man who has been operating his motor vehicle business for the last year. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a public vehicle license and new tires.

He has no other source of income. Hamadi faces the major challenge of high competition in his business. His major goal is to own a big motor vehicle (matatu) company. He decided to work with Yehu so as to get income to boost his business. He lives at a rental house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a public service vehicle license and new tires.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Miguel, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 60 years old. Jocelyn is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sekoye Masayaton

texts.en:
Sekeyo has been farming in Naivasha town since 2003.  He is 48 years old, married to Senkoi Sayaton, and they have 14 children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the cash to plant potatoes and buy cattle which he will sell later at a profit.

Sekoye plans to own his own tractor in the future.

loans.use: To plant potatoes and buy cattle which he will sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay L., 27, is married with two young children living at home in the Kampong Chhnang province. She works in a grocery store in front of a garment factory, typicalL. making US $6 each day. Her husband helps her selling groceries. Chhay L. would like a loan of US $600 to purchase a sugar cane squeezer so she can generate more income by selling sugar products.

loans.use: To purchase a sugar cane squeezer

loans.name: Lady Chita

texts.en:
Lady Chita A. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin, Misamis Occidenta. She is 24 years old. Lady Chita is single. To make a living, Lady Chita owns & operates a business providing sewing services in the local community. Lady Chita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lady Chita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lady Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Lady Chita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the second loan taken out by Lady Chita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem C., 20, is a local teacher in Takeo province.  He is single and lives with his elderly mother and four brothers and sister. On average, he makes US$ 3 each day. His mother grows rice and makes US$ 1 per day. Khem C. is asking for a loan of US$ 900 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: El señor Justino tiene un taller de costura, desde hace seis años y medio realiza todo tipo de prendas de vestir, trabaja junto con su esposa tienen casa propia, tienen tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando, este crédito es para la compra de tela, tiene un pedido para hacer poleras para una institución.  Esta en su segundo ciclo en la institución, ha demostrado ser responsable con su crédito anterior, pagando puntualmente sus cuotas,con el dinero del credito comprara tela para realizar poleras es una persona muy amable y muy trabajador, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Justino has a sewing shop where for the last six and a half years he has been making all kinds of clothing. He works with his wife, and they own their own home and have three children in school. 

This loan is for the purchase of fabric. Justino has an order to make shirts for an institution. With the money from this loan he will buy the fabric that he needs to make them. Justino is in his second loan cycle with Emprender [the Kiva field partner] and he has shown himself to be a responsible borrower, making all his payments as indicated. He is very friendly and hard-working, and is thankful for the support that Kiva and Emprender have given him.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Gladys Isabel

texts.es:
Gladys de 51 años, tiene una tienda de víveres desde hace 20 años atrás. Vive con su esposo y su hija en una casa de ladrillos ubicada en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Para poder mantener a su hija él comenzó a vender verduras y golosinas en la ventana de la casa hace 20 años atrás. Poco a poco con esfuerzo alcanzo a tener suficiente dinero para comprar vitrinas y readecuar el loca, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. Su hija le ayuda después que llega de la escuela y le da tiempo a Gladys para hacer el almuerzo. Ahora en la tienda vende enlatados, arroz, lácteos, bebidas etc.  

Para seguir con su negocio y surtirlo mas él quiere con el préstamo comprar arroz, enlatados, aceite. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio para su hija y así ella pueda termina la universidad con los mejores honores.
texts.en: Gladys is 51 years old. She has had a general store for more than 20 years. She lives with her husband and her daughter in a brick home located in a canton called Playas that is one of the tourist destinations in Ecuador because of its wide variety of seafood. In order to provide for her daughter she started selling vegetables and snacks out of her home 20 years ago. Little by little with a lot of hard work she was able to have enough money to purchase display cases and rearrange the store. Now she works from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. every day. Her daughter helps her after she comes home from school and gives Gladys time to prepare lunch. Now the store sells canned goods, rice, dairy products, beverages, etc. To keep her business going forward and to better stock it, she wants to use the loan to purchase rice, canned goods and oil. In the future she wants to have another business for her daughter, so she can finish her university studies with the highest honors.

loans.use: Purchase rice, canned goods, sugar, oil

loans.name: Francisca Del Socorro

texts.es: Todos los días Francisca labora en su propio negocio, que es la venta de repostería. Así es como recibe mejores ingresos para subsistir diariamente y aportar a su hogar, pues tener  hijos implica una lucha constante para salir adelante. Desde hace 5años tomó la decisión de convertirse en microempresaria y aportar con su trabajo a los ingresos del hogar, pues cada vez se hacía más difícil la subsistencia. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra materia prima necesaria para su negocio. Francisca espera mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Every day Francisca works in her own business, where she sells baked items. This is how she makes an income for her daily subsistence and to support her household, since having children means a constant struggle to get ahead. Five years ago she made a decision to become a businesswoman to make an income for her household, since subsistence was getting more and more difficult. This loan will be used for basic materials that she needs for her business. Francisca hopes to increase her sales and increase her familial income.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
la señora Maria Guadalupe C. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada y vive en la aldea La Cuesta de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Maria se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia, la que tiene ubicada en su casa de habitacion.
Maria es muy popular entre sus vecinos y amigos de su localidad.
junto con su esposo cubren los gastos del hogar, su esposo se dedica a la ganaderia y al cultivo de granos como maiz y frijoles.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe C. is 52 years old, she is married, and she lives in the community of Cuesta, in the city of Nacaome. 

Maria sells groceries from her convenience store which is located in her house. 

Maria is very well known among her neighbors and friends in her community. 

Together with her husband they are able to cover the household expenses. Her husband is a cattle farmer and an agriculturist, planting grains such as corn and beans. 

The loan will be use to purchase merchandise to supply her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Rithy H., 19, is single and lives with her sisters and mother along National Road Number 1 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

She sells clothes in the Phnom Penh market and takes motor taxis very often. Taking a motor taxi to the market is expensive for the family. 

Hence she is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Virgen Maria Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed on January 27th, 2011.  With a lot of effort and hard work they are now on their 1st loan cycle.  Besides the independent activities each one of the members has, they also work together to built up investment capital so they can help their families.

Ms. Francisca R. who sells vegetables says that the loan helped her to improve her business, living conditions and income.  She says that her business helps her household economy (she is the only supporter of the household), and is enabling her to give an education to her kids.  Ms. Francisca says that the activities conducted with the Foundation are very important to the committee because they helped improve the committee's work skills and self-esteem.

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Sothorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothorng C. is 28 years old and her husband, Mr. Kunthea Chuy, is 34 years old.  They have been married since 2004 and have three children  – one son and two daughters, all of them are still young. The family lives about 16 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Sothorng C. is a garment factory worker. She is asking for first loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives (make new roof).

loans.use: To make new roof for house

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John B. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  Three of his children are currently in school.  John has a bar, which he has had for four years.         

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more beers, sodas, and wine for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, John hopes to improve the standard of living in his family.

loans.use: to purchase more beers, sodas, and wine for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with four children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock.

Josephine has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 16 years and also earns an income from livestock.

Josephine aspires to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif B. is 43 years old, married and has two children. For the past six years, he has been a welder. Depending on the season, Vasif has different orders. In cold seasons it is stoves, and in hot seasons, gates and iron barriers. He sells them at the market.

Vasif has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase the necessary materials to make his orders. With your help, he will be able to make his business succeed and provide his children with necessities.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make his stoves, gates and iron barriers

loans.name: Fabiana Melina

texts.es:
Fabiana  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una  hija.  La señora estudió educación secundaria (incompleto). 
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, con su primer  préstamo  solicitado que fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió  en su negocio de servicios de fotocopias y venta de títeres.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1800.00 nuevos soles, comprará 1 ciento de títeres, una caja de papeles en general y tóner para la máquina. En el negocio le ayuda su hija.
Su sueño es tener más capital y tener más mercadería en el negocio.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Fabiana is a member of the communal bank "The Untouchables", located in the district of Puno, in the province and Department of Puno. She is 45 years old and she is a single mother to her daughter. She has a high school education (incomplete). 

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past three years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles and she invested the funds in her photocopy business and on her puppet sales.

With this new loan in the amount of S/. 1800 nuevos soles, she will purchase 100 puppets, a box of paper and toner for her copy machine. Her daughter helps her with her business. 

Her dream is to earn more capital and to have more merchandise for her business. 

What she most enjoys about the communal bank is the easy loan process.

loans.use: to purchase 100 puppets, a box of paper and toner for the photocopy machine.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Elna works hard to support her family.

Elna has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.  Elna is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy dried fish for her business.

Elna has been sustaining her business activities through 13 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Leo Steven

texts.en: Leo Steven is 30 years old. He has two children who are ages 2 and 6 years. They are both in school. His wife is a teacher. Leo Steven owns a bar in which he sells different kinds  of beer, water and MTN communication company cards. He has done this business for six years and it has enabled him to pay school fees for his children and improve his standards of living. He is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of beer.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Baal

texts.es: Baal de 46 años de edad casado con Lucinda de 39 junto, ambos tienen tres menores hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia  en el centro poblado de Puerto Mayo del distrito de Pichari. Baal es un hombre entusiasta quien desde aún muy joven se dedicó a las labores agrícolas, pensando en el bienestar de su querida esposa e hijos. Baal cuenta que trabajan en el campo en compañía de sus vecinos, quienes son jornaleros. A él le encanta su actividad, pues ama la naturaleza y la vida del campo, además que le genera ingresos económicos familiares, debido a que sus productos tienen mucha demanda en el mercado nacional y en el exterior. El problema que él tiene radica en que aparecieron muchas plagas de insectos, y esto perjudica el bajo rendimiento de sus frutos y para poder contrarrestar este tipo de problema es necesario darle un manejo agronómico necesario. Los planes que tiene para el futuro próximo es seguir contando con el apoyo de MFP ya que este es su primer crédito obtenido y se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Este es su primer empréstito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otra parte esta agradecido con su grupo comunal ya que fueron ellos quienes lo animaron a trabajar con MFP. Con el dinero prestado invertirá en el mantenimiento de su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
Baal is 46 years old and married to Lucinda, age 39. They have three young children and live together in their own home in the central village of Puerto Mayo, which is in the District of Pichari. Baal is an enthusiastic gentleman who has been farming from a very young age so that he could provide for the welfare of his beloved wife and children. He works in the fields with his neighbors who are day laborers. Baal enjoys his work because he loves nature and experiencing life in the fields. He is able to generate income for his family because his products have great demand in the national markets as well as abroad. The problem he faces is the appearance of swarms of insects that negatively impact production. To counteract this problem, it is necessary that he perform proper crop management.

His plans for the future include continuing his work with support from MFP. This will be the first loan he has received and he promises to submit his payments on time. Baal hopes that everyone will support him as he seeks to accomplish his goals. He is also grateful for the others members of his Communal Bank who encouraged him to work with MFP. The proceeds from this loan will be invested in the maintenance of his cacao crop.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies to maintain his cacao crop.

loans.name: Mujeres De Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Ciudad de Caacupe. Cuenta actualmente con doce integrantes que participan de manera activa y responsable. La presidenta es la Sra. Mirtha, ella vive con su marido y pequeña hija.
Ella junto a sus compañeras trabajan como vendedora de ropas. Todas ya poseen una considerable cantidad de clientes. Desean poder llegar a tener una gran cantidad de posibles compradores y creen que la mejor manera de lograr eso es brindando a las personas una mayor variedad de productos que puedan llamar la atención, ya que en la variedad está la ganancia.
Solicitan el crédito para poder realizar un abastecimiento del stock de ropas que poseen. Quieren poder tener prendas de todas las estaciones del año, así podrán afrontar cualquier demanda.Todas ellas ven una gran oportunidad en este crédito.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from the city of Caacupe.  There are twelve members who participate actively and responsibly.  The president is Mirtha, who lives with her husband and young daughter.

She works together with her friends selling clothing.  They already have a considerable number of customers.  They want to get a large quantity of possible buyers, and they think the best way tot do that is to offer people a better variety of products so they can draw people's attention.  Variety will bring profits.

They are asking for this loan to create a supply of merchandise.  They want to have clothing for every season of the year, so they can meet any demand.  They all see a big opportunity in this loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for every season.

loans.name: Yvonne's Group

texts.en:
Yvonne‘s group is comprised of four hardworking women. Yvonne herself is twenty years old, single and has no children. She lives in the town of Nasana in the central region of Kampala in Uganda. For three years Yvonne has sold jewelry.

To help expand her business, Yvonne has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX, a portion of her group's loan, from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to purchase more jewelry to sell. Yvonne is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by investing in her enterprise.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yvonne hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself like buying new clothes. In the future, Yvonne hopes to own a small retail shop where she will sell sugar.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Baargul's Group

texts.en:
Baargul, 37, is the leader of this group. She has two daughters and two sons; the youngest daughter is preschool age (under seven) and the other children study at school. Baargul’s husband went to work in Russia: he works in construction. In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs Baargul breeds cattle. She started this activity ten years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms. At the moment Baargul keeps two cows and a calf. With the loan she wants to increase the number of cattle. The loan will be used to purchase a calf. In the future Baargul wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Bakyara Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Thrity-five-year-old Jesca runs a 7-year-old restaurant business in Ibanda district in Uganda. Jesca, a happily married mother of 3, is one woman who is running her own businesses to fight poverty.

As a result of of her hard work, Jesca deservedly earns 100,000 UGX per week as profits from the restaurant. She says the years she has spent in her restaurant business have been years of excellent service. Agriculture was her first business and Jesca still does it. She says she used savings from her agriculture business to begin her current business. This hardworking business lady says, with the will of God, she plans to educate her children to the high institutions of learning. And with the Kiva loan, she plans to buy more food for use at her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more food for use at her restaurant

loans.name: Shake Hand Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Shake Hand” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine On Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, also a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000.00 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. This 45-year-old is married to a trader and they have 6 children, 4 of whom are attending primary and secondary schools.  Fatmata sells cooked rice. She has been doing this business for 10 years now.  With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients – rice, palm-oil, fish, tomatoes, onions, etc., in large quantities, in order to cook a larger quantities of rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients – rice, palm-oil, fish, tomatoes, onions, etc., in large quantities, to cook a larger quantity of rice for sale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Elsa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Elsa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old married man who has worked in electronic repairs for 10 years. Ali is a talented person who is specialized in repairing TVs. He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles. His previous loans directly affected his career and family positively.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new tools and do the necessary decoration to his shop to attract new customers, as he states. Ali's business is highly requested in his region since most of the citizens can't afford new TVs or electronic machines at any time, so most of them seek to repair what they have before looking to buy new. He hopes to expand his business in the future to achieve a new sector for selling new electronic machines, in addition to doing the maintenance.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with six children, one of whom attends school while five are too old for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family. 

She has operated a cereals shop for the past five years, her potential clients are the neighboring locals. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase five bundles of maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase five bundles of maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 41 years old and is married with three children. For the past six years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Janet has sustained her business with 11 previous loans from NWTF.

Janet is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Bunly

texts.en:
Bunly (in the photo) is 38 years old and his wife, Kunthea, is 32 years old. They have been married since 1995 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two are in school and two are still young. The family is living in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His wife is a garment worker.

Bunly is a driver; he has his own pick-up truck and is hired by villagers to carry things from one place to another. He gets paid a fee. Bunly also raises cows at home. He sells calves when the cows give birth. 

Bunly is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional cows to raise.

loans.use: To buy additional cows to raise.

loans.name: Señor De La Caña - Chupuro Group

texts.es:
La Señora AIDEE, tiene 44 años de edad, tienes 02 hijos menores de edad, mujer muy trabajadora con entusiasmo. Es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal "SEÑOR DE LA CAÑA – CHUPURO”. 
  
Ella tiene una bodega que vende bebidas, azúcar, arroz, aceites, verduras,que queda ubicado en  la misma direccion de su casa. solicito este prestamo para abastecer con más productos e implementar con la compra de una refrigeradora para su bodega asi pueda generar mas ingresos y brindar una calidad de vida a sus hijos menores. En el futuro desea comprarse su propia casa. 

La socia  viste polo color blanco, chompa color rosada, ella está ubicada la sexta persona a lado del joven.
texts.en:
Aidee, 44, has two young children and is a very hardworking and enthusiastic woman.  She’s a member of the “Señor de la Caña-Chupuro” communal bank.

She has a store where she sells drinks, sugar, rice, oil, and vegetables. Her store is located in her home. She is asking for a loan to stock up on products and begin paying for a refrigerator for her store, so as to generate a higher income and bring a higher quality of life to her young children. In the future she wants to purchase her own house. 

She is wearing a while polo shirt, pink sweater and is the sixth person in the photo, next to the young man.

loans.use: to stock up on rinks, sugar, rice, oil, and vegetables for her store.

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
Marina, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, es casada, y dueña de una panadería, tiene experiencia en el negocio ya que hace cuatro años trabajo en él, dicho negocio surgio por iniciativa propia y con la ayuda de su esposo.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de harina, huevos, azucar y demás ingredientes para la elaboración del pan, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar su inventario de mercadería y que sus ventas serán mejores.
La aspiracion de Mrina es mejorar económicamente para vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Marina is married, and lives with her husband and three children. She owns a bakery. She has experience in the business, as she has been working in it for four years. The business came about through her own initiative, and with her husband's help.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy flour, eggs, sugar and the other ingredients for making bread. This purchase will help her to increase her inventory of merchandise, and improve her sales. Marina's ambition is to improve her financial situation, so that she and her family can live better.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is a 31 years old farmer.  He is married and blessed with four children.  This business is their primary source of income, hence he cares a lot to generate a high crop yield.

For this reason, he is asking a loan of P10,000 to buy insecticides, seeds and fertilizers inputs needed in his farm.  Hopefully, his farming efforts will provide a greater profit.  Juanito hopes to save for the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, seeds and fertilizers inputs needed in his farm.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy, 46, resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Chanthy and her husband buy cows and buffalo to resell. Chanthy is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to travel to buy cows and buffalo to resell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en: Manvel is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. Manvel has been engaged in agriculture for many years, through which he has managed to expand his farm. Now Manvel would like to develop cattle-breeding. With the help of this loan Manvel will increase the number of the livestock. This will allow Manvel to increase his income and savings to renovate his house. House renovation means improved living conditions for Manvel and his family. Manvel lives together with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandchild.

loans.use: to pay for livestock

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 36 years old.  He is married to Mary and they have three children.

He has been in the farming business growing food crops for the last 10 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 8,000.He is applying for his first loan of Kes 20,000.He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He plans to use the funds to buy more fertilizers, seeds. In future he hopes is to diversify into carpentry   workshop.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, seeds for farming.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en:
Tinh is 56 years old and married. He lives with six children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City.

He and his wife earn a living operating a store from their house that sells basic household necessities to the people in their community. They have done this for the past eight years.

Tinh would like to take out a loan to invest in his store by buying a greater variety and quantity of basic goods. This will enable him to provide more products for his customers, generate more income to cover his family's living expenses, and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy basic household necessities to stock his general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Martha would like to buy 2 sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
"Toñita" owns a grocery store that is her only source of income. Children from the area go to her store to buy candy. She is very respected and loved by old and young alike. "I am lucky to be surrounded by wonderful people who appreciate me. This motivates me to continue. I want all of these people to be able to find what they need in my store. That's why I want to buy more products and more variety, and why I need a loan of $800.00. I would be forever grateful."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña "Toñita" cuenta con su tienda de abarrotes, es su única entrada de ingresos, los niños de las colonias acuden muy seguido a comprar golosinas, es muy respetada y querida por los grandes y chicos. "Tengo la fortuna de estar rodeada de gente bonita que me aprecia y eso me motiva a seguir, me gustaría que toda esta gente encontrara en mi tiendita lo que necesitan, por eso quiero surtirla con mas variedad y cantidad de productos para esto necesito que me proporcionen un crédito de $800.00 dlls. Se los voy a agradecer infinitamente".

loans.use:
To buy more goods and a greater variety of these goods.
Comprar variedad y cantidad de mercancia.

loans.name: Amah Mawusse

texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 34 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has been in rice agriculture since 2002 as a hired hand, and hopes to be able to purchase her own plot of land. As a side business, she also prepares “gari” (a food derived from the cassava root that is often eaten with beans) in order to sell in the markets or to women who come from the city to purchase it at low prices.

Even though Mrs. A. has her certificate in accounting, she is currently forced to work for very low wages as a hired hand in the rice fields. Receiving this loan would allow Mrs. A. to work for herself and to take better care of her family. Her two eldest children are in school and the 3 youngest have not yet begun. Since her husband pays little attention to her and the family’s needs, she has moved into her father’s home with the children. She is almost solely responsible for their needs since her husband only helps to pay the school fees for the children. She is not able to feed her family more than twice a day, and the meals are not very substantial. She also cannot afford to go to the hospital, so she relies on herbal remedies and unregulated medicine when there is an illness.

Mrs. A. is currently asking for her first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase 5 square plots of land as part of a larger plot of land to be purchased by her solidarity group. She will use the land to plant rice and will repay her loan in 12 months.

Mrs. A. is a very hard working woman who knows how to cultivate rice and this loan will be a great source of joy and allow her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Mrs. Akpom would like to buy a plot of land to grow and harvest rice to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca L., 33, is married and mother of two children. Her business includes making cubrecamas, a handcrafted bedspread that is very typical of Carapegua, and also a retailer of cubrecamas. She purchases cubrecamas from artisans in Carapegua and then she travels to Luque by bus in order to resell the cubrecamas to other clients. She travels to Luque every Saturday on a 2 hour bus ride from Carapegua.

Francisca started her business over 20 years ago. Besides acting as a retailer, Francisca's husband also makes on average about 10 cubrecamas per week and he only makes them per order. They works from home on a homemade loom that they have behind their house.

The couple is in need of a loan to purchase thread to complete their orders and also to use as capital to buy cubrecamas from other people to resell.

loans.use: Purchase thread and cubrecamas.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia P. makes woolen caps and her husband works at a spectacles shop as a sales person. Together they make around $80 a month. Their  income is not enough to support themselves and their four children. Winter is right around the corner, and the demand in woolen caps is set to rise. She is requesting a loan of $425 to buy and stock a large quantity of wool as it is cheaper this season and will allow her to make good profits when winter comes.

loans.use: To purchase wool

loans.name: Abdalah

texts.en:
ABDALAH, age 42, is the father of 3 boys. He and his wife have started businesses within the past two years to support their family. In February 2006, Abdalah opened a shop where he sells vegetables, sodas, ice pops, and general-needs items. His shop has around 45 customers each day, and from them, he makes a profit of around $9. In the past, Abdalah has taken out two successful loans and hopes to take out a third loan, which will also be used to build up his shop’s inventory.

In January of this year, Abdalah’s wife was able to open her own breakfast café, which brings a profit of about $2.50 a day. Because of starting these businesses, Abdalah and his wife say that they no longer have problems paying general expenses such as school fees and hospital bills.

Abdalah belongs to the group Songambele (Swahili for “going forward”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 22 years old. He lives in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. Mohamad owns a fruit and vegetable store. This is the third time he is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. This time he needs $1200 to assist him in purchasing a pickup truck for the transportation of provisions. Mohamad is constantly striving to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a pickup truck to transport provisions

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Định, 31 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children at Tự Lập village of Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc. She’s been a member of the TYM Fund for 12 years. After 2 rounds of loan she realizes that taking out big loan and weekly repayments fit her family’s business very well. Her decision of changing from raising pigs to poultry has prospered the business. She also built 2 incubators to provide ducklings to others poultry farms in the area. The income is about 300USD a month. She is well deserved the achievement award from the Fund. This time she would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to buy feed for her ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Định, 31 tuổi, đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại xã Tự Lập, Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc là thành viên năm thứ 12 của Quỹ. Sau hai vòng vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi chị Định nhận thấy việc vay vốn lớn hoàn trả tuần rất phù hợp với gia đình. Nằm trên địa bàn thuần nông và chăn nuôi, lại gần chợ là nơi trao đổi hàng hoá rất thuận lợi, nắm bắt được thị hiếu người tiêu dùng, gia đình chị mạnh dạn chuyển từ chăn nuôi lợn sang chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và vịt thịt (1200 con) mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Không dừng lại ở đó gia đình chị còn xây thêm 2 lò ấp trứng, ngoài việc cung cấp con giống cho địa bàn xã, huyện, gia đình chị còn làm thêm trứng vịt lộn cung cấp cho khách hàng. Thu nhập từ dự án mang lại hàng tháng là 300USD. Chị Định và gia đình xứng đáng là gương điển hình làm kinh tế giỏi mà chi nhánh và xã trao tặng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn vịt.

loans.use: Buy feed for ducks

loans.name: Nancy Magaly

texts.en:
Nancy has been a member of the community bank “Suni” for four years. In that time she has learned to be responsible, disciplined, and to save. Nancy works in the country and attends meetings monthly instead of weekly. She likes this arrangement and is happy that the community bank was able to work with her to find a plan that worked

When Nancy first joined the community bank she sold the vegetables that her in-laws grow in their garden. Now she and her husband have been able to buy a motorcycle taxi and start a business selling motor oils and candies at a gas station. Nancy needs a loan of 2500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying a greater variety of motor oils.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earnings savings account each associate has. Nancy plans use her savings to build a house. Her dream is to be able to have a farm and raise animals.

loans.use: Nancy needs a loan of 2500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying a greater variety of motor oils.

loans.name: Sheha's Mji Mwema Group

texts.en:
Sheha is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 11, and 4 years old. Sheha is a tailor, a business she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business.

In the past, Sheha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth selling, pharmacy, and soft drink selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
Nemecia works all day, every day, in a small space outside her home which she established with the goal of selling vegetables in the morning and sandwiches in the evening. With the income that she receives daily from her work, she can fully maintain her beloved children. She wishes to increase her capital in order to make a greater quantity of meals and to make her facilities more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Nemecia, labora todo el día y todos los días en un pequeño espacio fuera de su hogar que estableció con el propósito de comercializar vegetales por las mañanas y diversos bocadillos por las tardes. Con el ingreso que percibe a diario por su labor puede mantener plenamente a sus queridos hijos.Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para elaborar mayor cantidad de alimentos y para hacer más cómoda sus instalaciones de servicio.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her products and service.

loans.name: Adabus

texts.id:
After paying his first loan, Adabus' mineral water selling business is increasing. He has many customers. Adabus usually sells 50 gallons of mineral water each day, and after receiving loan from DINARI, he is able to sell 100 gallons a day. His customers are not only those who live near him, but also those who live away from him. Adabus charges various delivery cost for various distance of delivery. he plans to use the proposed loan to increase his capital to enlarge his business.

Now Adabus is living with his wife and children. They rent a land and built a semi-permanent house on it.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Sejak melunasi pinjaman periode pertama, usaha Adabus mengalami perkembangan sampai saat ini. Usaha jual air mineral kelilingnya cukup banyak memiliki pelanggan. Biasanya dia berjualan air mineral sampai 50 galon per hari. Tapi sejak mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI dia bisa mendapatkan pelanggan sampai 100 galon air mineral per hari. Konsumennya bukan hanya penduduk sekitar rumahnya tetapi juga berada di tempat yang jauh. Untuk ongkos mengantar bervariasi tergantung jarak pelanggan. Recananya, pinjaman kali ini akan dijadikan modal tambahan sehingga nantinya usahanya bisa lebih besar dan maju. Saat ini Adabus S. tinggal bersama istri dan anaknya. Mereka menyewa tanah per tahunda membangun rumah semi permanen diatasnya. Keadaan keluarganya sehat.

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Magda Victoria

texts.es:
Magda Gonzáles dedicates herself arduously to her seamstress business in the Sandino City neighborhood of Managua, where she tends to clients out of her home. Magda is a single mother of two whom she cares for as a mother and father at the same time. Her main goal is to expand her business and thus improve the economic conditions of her humble household. Today she looks for financial support from Kiva partner Ceprodel with the hope of purchasing sewing supplies such as fabrics, thread, needles, etc. The loan will benefit her children as much as her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua la señora Magda Gonzáles se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de costurería donde atiende a sus clientes en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende su negocio.

Actualmente es madre soltera y con dos hijos que mantener por lo que lleva a cabo el papel de padre y madre a la vez. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su costurería para así mejorar las condiciones económicas de su humilde hogar. Hoy en día busca un apoyo financiero en Ceprodel con el propósito de comprar los materiales de trabajo para la costurería como lo es la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, etc. Con el crédito se beneficia tanto ella como sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies (fabrics, thread, needles, etc.) / Compra de materiales para el trabajo

loans.name: Chhoeum

texts.en: Chhoeum K., 42, makes wine and raises pigs with her husband, Kleng Phal in Siem Reap. They support their two children as well, one is a student and the other is a sculptor. They typically make US$5 each day together.  They have asked for a loan of US$350 to purchase more piglets to breed. The way that pigs are raised in Cambodia is that they are fed a wine that most pig breeders also make to help them sleep and become very large, very fast. So most pig breeders are also making wine and the family believes that their income can be increased through this investment. Chhoeum and her husband look forward to the opportunity to improve their standard of living and see the fruits of their investment.

loans.use: Purchase more piglets to breed

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn S., 38, works together with her husband, Khim Bora, running a small grocery store in their home. They have three children, and they would like to see their US$3 per day income increased.

Yorn S. has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase more grocery products and expand her current family business. She believes that by offering a wider variety of products, she can expand her customer base and increase her income. She looks forward to seeing how this investment will impact her business and is optimistic about improving her family's standard of living and quality of life.

loans.use: Increase grocery inventory

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs Chea D. was born in 1969 and she now lives in Sampan Kraom Village in Kandal Province. She is a port seller in the local market and her husband, Mr Khoeng Chhoeurn, is a cow breeder who raises two cows. Mrs Chea D. has two children who are attending the local school.

Although Mrs Chea D. and her husband have two businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve this standard of living, Mrs Chea D. decided to ask for a loan to start pig breeding business. She will buy five pigs and the rest of the loan she will use to buy pig food.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Раджабова Замира жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 24 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка более 5 лет занимается куплей продажей женской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке .Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью,так как муж клиентки находится в России.В данный момент Замира хочет закупить товар  у оптовых поставщиков.планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Раджабова Замира жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 24 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка более 5 лет занимается куплей продажей женской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке .Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью,так как муж клиентки находится в России.В данный момент Замира хочет закупить товар у оптовых поставщиков.планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: закуп товара

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
El Sr. Milciades Giménez está casado hace 7 años con Mabel con quien tiene un hijo de 7 años por quien trabaja todos los días para brindarle una buena educación.

Comenta que sus padres se separaron cuando era un niño lo que le obligó a buscar trabajo desde muy joven para poder solventar sus estudios y ayudar a su madre también con los gastos del hogar.

Trabajó como chofer de ómnibus por muchos años y renunció para comprarse un vehiculo que hoy día utiliza como taxi, dicha actividad viene desarrollando hace 1 año con muy buenos resultados.

Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa debido a que trabaja a la par de él vendiendo ropas casa por casa, ayudando así a obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sustento familiar.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una parada de taxi, ya que en Paraguay, existen varios proveedores de este servicio que están ubicados en esquinas de distintos puntos, y Milciades en la actualidad está alquilando una y eso le genera un costo adicional.
texts.en:
Mr. Milciades Giménez has been married to Mabel for 7 years. They have a seven-year-old son, for whom they work every day so that they can offer him a good education.

His parents separated when he was a child. Because of this, he was obligated to work from a very young age to pay for school and also to help his mother with the household expenses.

He worked as a bus driver for many years and gave it up to buy a vehicle that he now uses as a taxi. He has been pursuing this activity for a year with very good results.

He counts on the unconditional support of his wife, because she sells clothes door to door. In this way, she helps to earn the income necessary for the family’s sustenance.

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy a taxi stand. In Paraguay there are many providers of this service that are located on corners at different points, and Milciades, at present, is renting one, which costs him more.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a taxi stand

loans.name: Shahali

texts.en: Shahali is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the town of Fuzuli, and he settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Dilagarda village. Ten years ago he started his business selling souvenirs and glassware, tea things, and other things. Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 (970 AZN) to buy souvenirs and other items to sell.

loans.use: Buy souvenirs and other items to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is 35 years old. She is married with five kids and lives with her family in New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Esi sells eggs in her neighborhood. She balances her stock of eggs on her head and moves around to sell. She says the price of eggs has almost doubled over the last few months--an increase in bird attacks in some of the poultry farms where she gets her daily supply have forced her to travel very far at additional cost to purchase eggs. With the loan, she wants to buy more crates of eggs to avoid the constant price hikes. She hopes to save more income to support her kids in school.

Esi is a member of the Kingdom Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to obtain loans and support one another in repaying the loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs

loans.name: Bashiran Ahmad Din Group

texts.en:
Bashiran Baji is a 40-year-old married lady and has resided in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan is famous for its shrines and people come to see them. She is an uneducated lady because her school was far away from the house and no one was available to take her to school, which is why she quit her studies. Her husband's name is A. D. and he runs a grocery shop in the community. People come to him to buy groceries for their houses. He has a good reputation among the people.

She is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. Her elder son is involved in a fruit selling business. The next goes to school. Her other kids are free and don’t do anything. Bashiran Baji has a talent for sewing clothes. She polishes her quality and adopted this work as a profession. Now she sews clothes by taking orders from her neighbors and earns a profit. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Momna Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Waziran Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Motian Baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Zainab Baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Shazia Baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Kosim

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1970, N. Kosim now lives with his wife and their three children. They are also responsible for caring of his aged mother. A teacher by profession, Kosim is also a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Kosim would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of $1000 USD to buy fertilizer. This income will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and educate all his children with higher education. Kosim is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to tmhe 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel sells palm oil to his customers. He started this business in the year 2000. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell to his customers. He is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Nyanial

texts.en:
Nyanial Y. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice and cabbages and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Nyanial is 22 years old and is married to a soldier. She has one child and her child does not yet go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: Twenty-nine people living in Kampong Svay village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Bunthin S. is forty-one years old and the village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small store. Since her business is doing well, she has a lot of customers and their needs are many. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for her customers, and that will help her to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Hong Meng, is a construction worker. This couple has four childR., three of whom are enrolled in the local school. The youngest child is still too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Matata

texts.en:
Matata A., 52, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the villagers and the public three days per week. She has four previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about $187).

SPBD loans are Matata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The entirety of the loan will be used to maintain her business needs. Specifically, she would like to purchase goggles, a fishing net, and a flashlight.

loans.use: To purchase goggles, a fishing net, and a flashlight.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa, 65 years old, is married and has given birth to nine children: four sons and five daughters. According to Yaa, all her children have completed school and are currently working. Some are married. She lives with her husband and some of her grandchildren in a rented apartment in a a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Yaa is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, the district capital, and sells them in the local market on a tabletop. She also journeys to other towns to sell. She has been in this business for two years and hopes to obtain a loan to procure fish in bulk. 

She hopes to expand her business and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish for sale.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.es: Nemesia tiene 59 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida, recientemente, hace 3 meses, alquiló un local donde atiende todos los días por las mañanas, ya que por las tardes se dedica a preparar todo lo necesario para el día siguiente. Debido a su buena sazón ha logrado incrementar su clientela regular, lo cual es muy importante porque sabe la cantidad de porciones seguras que vende diariamente, con las que obtiene las ganancias para sustentar las necesidades de su casa y el capital para su negocio al día siguiente. Sus planes a corto tiempo son de decorar su local e implementar mejor su cocina. Es la primera vez que Nemesia tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene grandes deseos de ser una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de mesas y una pequeña cocina a gas.
texts.en:
Nemesia is 59 years old and lives with her 4 children in her own home. She has been selling food for 4 years and recently, about 3 months ago, she rented a location from which she works during the morning since during the afternoon she works preparing food for the following day. Due to her flavorful food she has managed to increase the number of regular clients that she has, which is very important because she know the quantity of servings that she'll sell daily through which she obtains the income to cover the household expenses and the business capital for the following day.
