Her short-term plans are to decorate her business location and improve her kitchen. This is the first time that Nemesia has had a loan with MFP and she has a great desire to be one of the most active members of her communal bank. The requested money will be used to purchase tables and a small gas stove.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and improvments to restaurant kitchen

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 50 years old. She is a widow and has three children. She trades in assorted washing soaps and kerosene in the local market of Kasoa, a town in the Central Region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She requests for a loan to enable her to buy cartons of soap and barrels of kerosene to expand her business and to scale up sales. She hopes to increase her savings enough to support her last child’s education. She belongs to the community group called Abigail Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of soap and barrels of kerosene.

loans.name: Desak Putu Sarini

texts.en: Desak Putu Sarini (DNR.M-0578) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children. Desak Putu Sarini owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Desak Putu Sarini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 4th from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Desak Putu Sarini - (DNR.M-0578) merupakan 43 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Desak Putu Sarini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Desak Putu Sarini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Desak Putu Sarini menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Desak Putu Sarini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Desak Putu Sarini telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Desak Putu Sarini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun O., 65, is a widow living in Battambong province with her four children. She is a cleaner in a hotel in the town and makes about $5 USD a day, but it is not enough to support her family so two of her children send money every month from their work in garment factories. The global financial crisis has had unfavorable consequences for Khun O.'s family's standard of living, and inflation has been high. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, O. included.

In light of these difficulties, Khun O. is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase new sewing machines for members of her family. She sees these new sewing machines as a great economic opportunity for her. She believes that the machines will help to both increase her income and improve her standard of living. (One of her daughters is shown in the picture.)

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines

loans.name: Jocelie

texts.en:
Jocelie B., age 40, is from the town of Aloran. Jocelie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelie raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Jocelie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Karim S. est un célibataire sans enfant de 24 ans qui vit à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur S. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au  commerce d’articles divers et  dispose aujourd’hui  d’une boutique devant sa maison d’habitation où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers tels les cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, chewing-gum,  laits en poudre, thés, mayonnaises, sucre, savons etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre il y a environ une année, l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  après une anticipation du précédent.
Monsieur S. vend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de jeunes et de voisins.
Avec ce deuxième  prêt, il compte acheter,  5 cartouches de cigarettes différentes, 7 cartons de thés, 5 cartons de mayonnaise CALVE, 10 sacs du sucre, 3 cartons de savon,  5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de chewing gum, 20 paquets d’allumette et 10 sacs de riz. 
Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Monsieur Karim S. is a 24 year old bachelor who lives in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the République of Mali). After trying other enterprises,Monsieur S. opened a shop in front of his house where he sells miscellaneous merchandise, ranging from cigarettes, candy, matches and chewing-gum to powdered milk, tea, mayonnaise, sugar and soap, etc. His shop is very popular because of the quality of his merchandise. Monsieur S. sells to both cash and credit clients, most of whom are youth and neighbors. To satisfy increased demand, a year ago he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This will be his second loan. With the proceeds, he plans to buy 5 cases of different cigarettes, 7 cases of tea, 5 cases of CALVE mayonnaise, 10 bags of sugar, 3 cases of soap, 5 boxes of candies, 10 cases of chewing gum, 20 packages of matches, and 10 bags of rice. He purchases his merchandise from wholesalers. He expects to realize a monthly benefit of 125 000 FCFA which he will use to build his inventory, contribute to his family's expenses, and repay his loan.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Veronica Jerotich

texts.en:
Veronica is a 55 years old widow. She is a mother of ten children who solely depend on her. Her residential place is Levegeya in Eldoret.

Veronica B. was introduced to KADET by a member. She has applied for a school loan to pay her children's school fees. She has a small scale business which she believes will be able to 

She wants to be able to educate her children to the highest level of education in order for them to acquire the best education which she believes will be her biggest investment.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en: Yawa A.  is currently in the business of selling various items such as: bags of salt, biscuits etc and is requesting a loan to purchase 2 bags of sugar to sell.  Yawa is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is an engineer. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to keep on stocking more items in her shop for sale BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase 2 bags of sugar to sell

loans.name: Fansi

texts.en: Fansi sells jewelry to make a living. She is 44 years old and married with one child. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina M. sells bags of charcoal, rice, sugar and so on at Elmina near the seashore, which she has been doing since 2001. She is married and has four children. Her husband works with electronics. She has been through junior high school. Augustina uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase bags of charcoal and bags of rice to sell. Augustina plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to reinvest in it.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal and bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Ndata

texts.fr: Ndata G. est mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle est âgée de 52 ans. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH depuis 7 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts qu'elle a bien remboursé. Elle vend de l'arachide et du mil ce qui lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permet de participer aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndata G. is married and the mother of seven children.  She is 52 years old.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH for 7½ year where she benefited from 15 loans, which she has repaid.  Ndata sells peanuts and millet, which brings in the profits enabling her to help cover various family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her commercial work

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene una imprenta donde realiza trabajos de impresión de folletos, libros, menbretados, y otros.
Su domicilio y su taller de imprenta se encuentran ubicados  la calle comercio de la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada, tiene dos empleados y requiere el crédito para la compra de papel cola y tintas
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Wilson has a printing press where he produces brochures, books, engraved stationary, and other items. His home and his printing workshop are located in a rented house in a commercial street in the central part of the city of La Paz. He has 2 employees and he needs a loan to buy paper, glue and inks. This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO. The desire to work and improve his quality of life has motivated him to pursue this credit opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy paper, glue and inks for his printing business

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a businessman from Novaya Kahovka. He owns a small business selling office appliances, related components and expendable materials in one of the local malls called “Central”. He launched this business about 12 years ago. Currently, his business has grown up to 15,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His monthly net profit is little over 4,000 Grivnyas.

Andrei is seeking a loan of 7,400 Grivnyas to expand his business. His venture has seen considerable growth since he received his first loan. Andrei is hoping to witness further consistent growth of his trade after using this loan. A portion of profits generated will be invested in his business while some of it will be used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, gravel, sand and ceramic tile.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock yams, rice and beans, buy oil and flour for her restaurant

loans.name: Fhang

texts.en:
Mr. Fhang P. is 53 years old and lives in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Ra Noun, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops to support their family living.

In the rice field they have a problem because it is time to harvest the rice but they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mr. Fhang P. decided to apply for a loan to hire laborers to harvest his rice.

Mr. Fhang P. is the father of five children, two of whom help with the farming while the others are attending the local public school. His wife is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest his rice

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en: Diosa J. is from the village of Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Diosa is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Diosa makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Diosa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2005, Diosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Diosa is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Diosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Siem Chor Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eight members, all of whom live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Siem C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. Each of tH. will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Vuth Neang, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family. Their rice field has problems in that its soil is infertile and it is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Siem C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to increase their rice yield. The couple has five children. One of tH. is a policeman, another is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline to increase rice yield

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 70 años, es viuda, tiene dos hijos ya adultos, de los cuales vive con uno de ellos, Alejandro, a quien le cedió parte de su casa, ubicado en un barrio, al sur de la ciudad de Lima.Desde 1980, trabaja en el comedor popular del estado, con su socia y vecina, de lunes a viernes, de 10:00am de la mañana hasta las 2:00pm de la tarde, en un local alquilado, a dos cuadras de su casa. Pero en vista que sus clientes buscaban otros gustos culinarios, se vio en la necesidad de preparar otros platillos en su casa, es así que desde las 6:00am de la mañana hasta las 8:00am cocina, para ofrecer estos nuevos platos, para aquellos que desee algo extra en la lista de menú, que normalmente ofrece, siendo al final recompensados en las ganancias. También vende queques y otras dulces, de esa manera obtienen un ingreso adicional. A ella le agrada la cocina y esta muy contenta el ritmo en que trabaja, por ser además rentable. Su anhelo es ser reconocida por su trabajo en el arte culinario, por que piensa hacer de ella su profesión y su único recurso de vida. Este será su diecinueve crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Además reconoce que se lleva bien con sus compañeras de su grupo comunal. El crédito que solicita, será para que pueda comprar productos e insumos para la preparación sus platillos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 70 years old. She is a widow with two adult children. One of them, Alejandro, lives with her. She let him have a part of her house, which is located in a neighborhood in the south of Lima. Since 1980, she has worked in a popular restaurant with her neighbor and partner. She works Monday through Fridays from 10:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon in a rented locale two blocks from her house. Seeing that her customers were looking for different culinary tastes, it became necessary to prepare different dishes at home. So, from 6:00 until 8:00 in the morning she cooks in order to offer these new dishes to those who wish for something different on the menu than what she normally offers. Later it is paid for with the earnings. She also sells cakes and other sweets and in this way obtains additional income. She likes to cook and she is very happy with the rythym of her work, besides the fact that it is profitable. Her wish is to be recognized for her work in culinary arts, because she plans on making it her profession and her only means of support. This will be her nineteenth loan with MFP and this whole time she has shown herself to be a very responsible person in making her payments. In addition, she acknowledges that she gets along well with the other members of her communal group. The loan that she is asking for will be for her to purchase products and ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products and ingredients to continue preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Nkeiruka

texts.en:
Nkeiruka sells foodstuffs like garri (cassava flakes), rice, beans and yam flour. She buys in large quantities and sells retail. She is very hardworking as she has to leave home as early as 5 a.m. to be able get goods to buy.

Nkeiruka has been in business for three years and with this supports her husband in providing for the family. She is 23 years old, is married, and has two children. She makes sure she has food on the table every day through her hard work.

Nkeiruka is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase foodstuffs in bulk at a discount. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Martha Osiris

texts.es: La señora Martha Osiris García Z. , labora para LOTERIA NACIONAL desempeñándose como glosador tiene un hijo a su cargo madre soltera, solicito crédito a CEPRODEL , para cubrir gastos de salud ya que tuvo un accidente y se fracturo un brazo,y algunos gastos de deudas pendientes ,y gastos escolare.he trabajado con 3 financiamientos con CEPRODEL , me siento agradecida ya que me han atendido bien con los créditos los he utilizado para pagar deudas y otros gastos escolares
texts.en:
La señora Martha Osiris García Z. , labora para LOTERIA NACIONAL desempeñándose como glosador tiene un hijo a su cargo madre soltera, solicito crédito a CEPRODEL , para cubrir gastos de salud ya que tuvo un accidente y se fracturo un brazo,y algunos gastos de deudas pendientes ,y gastos escolare.he trabajado con 3 financiamientos con CEPRODEL , me siento agradecida ya que me han atendido bien con los créditos los he utilizado para pagar deudas y otros gastos escolares

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cubrir gastos de medicamentos

loans.name: Edelira

texts.es:
La solicitante es la señora  Edelira M. quien se dedica a la  venta de ropas y calzados por toda la zona de Santani, y también vende en su propio domicilio donde tiene un pequeño salón comercial.
Es una persona responsable, muy trabajadora y posee buenas referencias comerciales  y personales.
La señora empezó a trabajar  hace aproximadamente 4 años en esta actividad.
Su deseo es tener un  local mas amplio para poder  atender mejor a sus clientes y satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de ellos.
Actualmente llega la temporada fría al país  y quiere comprar
ropas  para invierno como poleras, busos, camperas,      sueter, pantalones,  y otras prendas.
Para la compra de los artículos mencionados solicita el crédito, y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya  y Kiva por la ayuda crediticia que obtienen.
texts.en:
The person requesting the loan is Mrs. Edelira M. who sells clothing and shoes for a living all over the neighborhood of Santani. She also sells from her own home where she has a small store. She is a hard working, responsible person who has good business and personal references. The señora started this business about four years ago. She would like to have a bigger place to be able to take care of her customers better and satisfy each of their needs. The cold season is starting in her country and she wants to buy winter clothing like t-shirts, jackets, sweaters, pants, and other items. She is taking out a loan to buy the articles mentioned and thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their help with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, jackets, sweaters, and other things.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
For a time span of ten years, N. Edgar from Kitongore, Ibanda, has been running a multipurpose business that includes stationery, agriculture, and the sale of matooke (plantain). With his good management and customer care skills, these businesses generate him a profit of 200,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.

Edgar looks forward to improving his banana plantation through mulching and spraying the pests that are currently disorganizing his returns. This will definitely give his ventures a new lease of life for some time. This loan will contribute to the purchase of pesticides and mulches and also enable him to restock his stationery store with more reams of paper and toner for printing.

Edgar’s motive is to earn money to pay his children’s school fees and also to expand his businesses for more income.

loans.use: To buy mulches and pesticides for his plantation and reams of paper and toner for his store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married man from Lebanon. In 2002 he opened his own grocery store but mainly sold gas tanks for houses. He is now requesting a loan of $1,500 to increase his purchases.

loans.use: To increase his purchases

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 30 yrs old. He's married and has one child. He finished primary school. 

He sells women's clothing in his shop. He was able to buy garments in bulk. He has lots of customers because the clothing that he sells is inexpensive and of good quality. He has a good reputation in the market. He intends to enlarge his shop in the coming days and display more clothes in different styles and fashions.

loans.use: To buy ready-made garments to sell

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla P., who lives in Trapeang Chhuk village in Takeo province, is 51-year-old. She is a floor mat seller door-to-door where she can earn some money to support her family. She is widow with four children, one of whom is a shoes seller, while the other one is a shoemaker, and the others are attending in local public school. Her problem is that her children have work place far away from her home. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Phalla P. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Siren

texts.en:
Mrs. Siren K., is 27 years old and her husband, Ms. Sophearak Keo, is 28 years old, and they have been married since 2005. They have two children: one son and one daughter. All of them are still young. They live with their parents about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Siren and her husband are farmers. They grow cauliflowers and beans on their farmland in the village. The family depends on their farming business, which is the main source of income. They do not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm and pay for plowing fees. 

Therefore, Siren is asking for her first loan of $1,000 help her capital. 

In the photo Siren is at home, not on the farm.

loans.use: To use for growing cauliflowers.

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr:
Madame Thioro D. est une femme de 42 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier  Tonghor a Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants âgés  respectivement de 12 et 18 ans. 
Madame D. exerce l’activité de commerce  qu’elle a choisi par passion depuis 25 ans car elle ne voulait pas être  marginalisée compte tenu de son handicap. Ainsi depuis lors elle s’adonne à la vente de  glace et de jus mais aussi elle pratique la coiffure chez elle depuis plus de 30ans. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est  le fait qu’elle parvienne a assurer son insertion dans le milieu social et a éviter  l’oisiveté. 
Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2005 et a déjà  bénéficié de 2 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs montant  avec lequel elle envisage d’acheter un deuxième frigo. Le reste du financement lui permettra de faire une petite opération Tabaski.
Madame D. souhaite améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille par l’accroissement de son chiffre d’affaire et de ses bénéfices surtout durant la  période  des fêtes. Son objectif est de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thioro D. is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the neighborhood of Tonghor, in Yoff. She is married with two children, aged 12 and 18. Mrs. D. is engaged in a commercial activity chosen out of a 25-year passion to avoid being marginalized due to her disability. Therefore, she has been selling ice and juice ever since, but she has also been working as a hairdresser from her home for over 30 years. What motivates her most about her work is being included in the social environment and avoiding idleness. She has been a member of the Yoff credit union since June 2005 and has been granted two previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs, which she will use to buy a second refrigerator. The remainder of the loan will allow her to hold a small Tabaski ceremony. Mrs. D. wishes to improve her family’s living conditions by increasing her sales and profits, especially during the holiday season. Her goal is to satisfy the increasing demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla C. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Precilla owns a transportation business providing motorcycle transport to local members of the community. Precilla has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Precilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to maintain the vehicle used in the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Precilla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to maintain a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Djamila's Group

texts.en:
Djamila O. is the leader of this group. She is 36 and is married. Her husband supports the family by working as a driver in “Mol Bulak Finance” company in Tokmok. The couple are bringing up two children (a son and a daughter); both of them are pupils. Ten years ago she inherited five animals. Since then, the family has been engaged in cattle breeding. Djamila also works as a warehouse manager in “Arvin” company. During their years of hard work, the couple have managed to increase their cattle stock. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more cattle to further incresae livestock numbers. In the future, Djamila intends to continue increasing cattle stock. 

Ainagul I., 50, is married and has five sons (30, 28, 25, 23, 14). The eldest one lives separately, but is temporarily living with his parents; the second one is married; the next 2 work in Russia, and the youngest one is a schoolboy. The head of the family makes a living by working as an “Interglass” glass-works laborer. The primary family business is cattle breeding. Twenty years ago the couple bought three sheep. They have already managed to increase cattle stock and to buy a car. The loan purpose is to buy 5 sheep to further increase cattle stock. In the future Ainagul is planning to arrange her sons’ weddings and also to purchase a private house.

Upel K., 50, is married to a worker in “Kyrgyz Temir Joldoru” company. The couple have two children; their son contributes to the family income by working as a security guard in a petrol station “Petroleum” while their daughter is a schoolgirl. As well as the individual family members' professions, they have a common business: cattle breeding. In 4 years they have managed to increase cattle stock and to make house repairs. Upel, together with her family, wants to expand further by purchasing 5 sheep. For this purpose they need a loan. 

Elmira K., 33, is married. She is the treasurer of the group. Two years ago her father presented a sheep to his granddaughter (she is a schoolgirl). Since then the family has been engaged in cattle breeding. Elmira’s spouse also earns money by repairing automobiles. He has a service center at home. From their income, the couple have managed to increase cattle stock. They need a loan to obtain 5 sheep. In the future Elmira is planning to open her own shop. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Zephania

texts.en:
Zephania, 22 years old, has been farming in Naivasha town since 2000.  He sells his products in the local market and also to middle men who take them to the capital city Nairobi, where they sell for a profit.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crop in the field.

Zephania hopes to own his own farming equipment in future. This will save him the cash he uses to rent the equipment when planting and harvesting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix B. is from the village of Mercy Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 39 years old. Felix is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Felix provides motorela or motorized tricycle transportation services to local community members. Felix has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Felix joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the motorela. This will be the first loan taken out by Felix from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his motorela or tricycle

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma S. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 43 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2002, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the 15th loan that Elma has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Mohon, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Anita owns a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food to sell

loans.name: Odili

texts.es: La señora Odili tiene 27 años está casada y tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo.  Es un ama de casa que para tener sus propios ingresos y ayudar con los gastos familiares decidió iniciar hace 2 años dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos. Trabaja todos días a la semana recorriendo con su mercadería, la misma que ofrece a sus conocidos o clientes nuevos que tengan referencia de los clientes que ya tiene, hace esto porque ella deja a crédito y no quiere inconvenientes con los cobros. Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería ya que la que tiene es muy poca y necesita para los pedidos que tiene. Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en: Señora Odili is 27 years old. She is married and has 1 young son in her care. Odili is a housewife but she also has her own earnings and helps with the household costs - 2 years ago, she decided to start selling cosmetics. She works every day of the week travelling around with her merchandise, which she offers to acquaintances or new customers, namely those who come referred to her by her existing customers. She does this (only taking referrals) because she sells her products on credit and doesn't want problems with the charges. This loan is to purchase more merchandise as she has very little left and she needs more for the orders that she has. Odili's dream is to finish her house.

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Francisca Emperatriz

texts.es:
Francisca de 65 años, empezó la venta de los pollos con la ayuda de su esposo para tener unos ingresos de dinero estables.  Viviendo en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales). 

Trabaja desde muy temprano repartiendo pollos listos para cocinar en la camioneta a distintas tiendas. Según sea las libras del pollo ella las vende en un promedio de $5.00 a $ 8.00 cada pollo. Una de las dificultades que en estos tiempos tiene de repartir los pollos es que se le ha presentado dificultades en la movilización por las calles que están dañadas. 

Para seguir con su negocio y tener esa lista de clientes que tiene hasta ahora ella quiere comprar con el préstamo un congelador. En el futuro quiere expandir su negocio y así obtener ingresos para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Francisca is 65 years old.  She sells chickens with the help of her husband.  She started in this business in order to make a stable income.  Francisca lives in an urban area in Guasmo de Guayaquil (an urban area whose residents are mostly informal salespeople).

Francisca works from very early in the morning, delivering chickens which are ready to cook to different stores, in her truck.  Depending on the weight of each chicken, she sells them for, on average, $5.00 to $8.00 a chicken.  One of the difficulties that she has right now in delivering her chickens is that the roads in her area are in a bad state of repair.

To continue in her business, and to keep her customers, Francisca would like to use her loan to buy a freezer.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and thereby make more income with which she can guarantee her old age.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Six years ago, David R. was a contractor building a fourplex apartment building. The laws had recently changed, requiring fourplexes to have sprinkler systems installed.  “There were only five companies that did that between San Antonio, Laredo, and La Isla.  Only one company wanted to come look at my project.” Due to the high demand of this sprinkler installation service and the low supply, companies could get away with overcharging. David decided that he would get certified to install sprinkler systems and charge this service for a more reasonable price. 

David says he charges about a third of what that company charged him for a comparable job. David and his 10 employees now install sprinkler systems and fire protection in private, commercial, and government buildings.

The biggest challenges in this industry are finding credit and funding everything up-front.  “Right now my dream is just to survive.  …It’s very difficult to get credit, so you have to fund everything yourself.”  David’s clients do not pay him until the job is done, or up to 90 days later.  In the past, the people who sold the raw materials would take some of this risk by offering credit. “But now they don’t have inventory… now you go to them and say “I need this and this” and they say ‘good.  Pay me now, and I’ll go get it for you.’ So you become the financier for your clients.  Because you have to go buy the materials and then wait to be paid at the end of the job. You have to start with your money.”

That is not the only reason the industry is so difficult, David says.  “None of the other companies want to help you.  …They never tell you where to start if you want to get certified… and if anyone starts charging a cheaper rate, they start badmouthing them.  That way no one will contract them and the price never lowers.”

David is proud of his work.  “We’ve done about 200 installations. About 99% of our clients are very happy and use us again or recommend us to others.”

This loan will go to buy tubing and other raw materials in order to install sprinkler systems in a 12-story building in La Isla.  David needs to buy the materials up front, “So I’m looking for credit anywhere I can.”
 
Without this loan, David would have to hire fewer workers and take on smaller jobs.  David originally went to a bank, but they said they do not lend for this kind of loan. “A loan to buy a house, yes.  But to buy raw materials?  Not one cent.” 

David hopes that eventually he can get a larger loan or a revolving line of credit.  

David supports his wife and two children with this company. He is from Mexico, but moved to the U.S. 20 years ago.  David describes himself as “a person who wants to help the community but every day it’s more difficult.”  He advises other business owners “don’t spend effort on superfluous things.”

loans.use: To purchase tubing and other raw materials

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: El señor Hermenegildo vive en casa propia quien  compro este con prestamos del banco, vive con su esposa que se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas tienen cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando, el se dedica al transporte como taxista ya bastante tiempo quien sostiene a su familia ya que con la venta de hamburguesas de su esposa no abastece. El préstamo que saco lo utilizara para el mantenimiento y reparación de su movilidad ya que cada año lo hace porque este le da el pan de cada día comento y lo tiene que cuidar, esta feliz porque le dimos el monto que necesita esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Hermenegildo lives in a house that he owns and bought with loans from the bank.  He lives with his wife who works selling hamburgers and they have four children who are students.  He has worked in transportation as a taxi driver for quite some time and is the one to support his family, as his wife’s hamburger sales aren’t sufficient.  He will use the loan that he is taking out for the maintenance and repair of his car because he does so each year as it provides the daily sustenance and he has to take care of it, he comments.  He is pleased because we gave him the amount that he needs and is grateful for the lending institution for the support provided.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of his vehicle

loans.name: Korb

texts.en: Mrs. Korb A. lives in Svay Thum village in Takeo province, where she was born in 1979. She is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land where she supports her family by growing rice. It is time for her to plow her fields and plant a new crop, but she does not have enough oxen to complete the work. That is why she is applying for a loan to buy a new ox to help with plowing. Her husband, Mr. Tor Pork, is a construction worker and a fisherman, and the couple has four children, three of whom are in local public schools. Their youngest child, who is six years old, has not yet begun school. In the photo, we see Mrs. Korb A. with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a new ox

loans.name: Noemy Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Noemy Esperanza Z. tiene 53 años de edad, vive en la colonia Morazan.
Tiene casa propia y se dedica a la venta de golosinas, desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de alimentos para la preparacion de sus sabrosas comidas y tambien necesita comprar platos, vasos y mesas plasticas para reemplazar algunas que ya estan quebradas.
gracias a su negocio a logrado darles los estudios a sus hijas y su mayor deseo es tener a sus dos hijas graduadas de la universidad, nos comento que una vez que logre su meta con sus hijas podra invertir mas en su negocio y hacerlo mas grande y mas bonito para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
53-year old Señora Noemy Esperanza Z. lives in the Morazan neighbourhood. She owns a house and earns her living by selling candy, breakfasts, lunches, and dinners from her home. She is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for her delicious food, and she also needs to buy plates, glasses, and plastic tables to replace her old broken ones. 

With the income from her business she has managed to educate her daughters, and her greatest wish is to see them graduate from university. Noemy explains that once this goal has been achieved, she will be able to invest more money in her business. Her plan is to expand and renovate it, and thus provide her customers with better service.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients, dishes etc.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a single woman who lives in the municipality of Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  motorcycle transport and farming. Avelina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Avelina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000 to buy new tools and equipment to maintain her motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Avelina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Monic

texts.en:
Monic B. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Monic has a small retail shop, which she has had for five years.  She also has a second business: a restaurant.  

To help expand her businesses, Monic has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Monic hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child.  In the future, Monic hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Koem An

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem An was born in 1977.  She is married to Mr. Ret and they have three children --  two are attending the local public school and one is still too young to work or study.  

Mrs. Koem An and her husband are farmers who own a 1.50-hectare plot of land where they cultivate rice to sell as well as to eat.  Mr. Ret is a also construction worker. 

Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a small income.  To improve this condition, Mrs. Koem An is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak H. lives in Talin with his brother and pensioner parents. Together with his mother, he is engaged in agriculture. Sevak’s brother, Gevorg, and father, Tigran, are engaged in construction, trying to help to improve the family’s living conditions. 

Sevak keeps a farm, but he doesn’t have his own land.  With the requested loan, Sevak plans to buy 0.820 land and grow forage for livestock.

loans.use: to pay for land

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  La señora estudió educación superior. 
Se dedica a la venta de celulares, cámaras digitales y rollos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió  en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles comprará veinte unidades de celulares y cámaras, la señora trabaja sola en su negocio, su esposo trabaja elaborando joyas en Platería.
Su sueño es tener solvencia económica y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the "Las Intocables" ("The Untouchables") community bank, located in the Puno district, province and department of Puno. She is 25 years old, married with a son. She has a higher education. 

She sells mobile phones, digital cameras and film. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years. Her first loan was for 3,000 soles, which she invested in her business. With this new loan of 3,000 soles she will buy twenty mobile phones and cameras. 

She works on her own in her business. Her husband makes silver jewellery. Her dream is to have enough money and meet the needs of her family. What she likes about the community bank is the punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy twenty mobile phones and cameras.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie, a 38-year-old married mother of nine children, five of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a personal products business in the Philippines for 14 years, Margie is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en: Gombo is 57 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His older daughter is unemployed and his younger son is a student. He manages a meat and dairy products trading business with the help his wife. His wife is responsible for selling dairy products and Gombo, himself, is responsible selling meat and meat products. He started his business in 1995 and is planning to continue it in the future. Their business was quite successful, which allowed them to buy a ger for their children and have 100 more husbandry animals for their business. He is a polite and kind man who says, "I am planning to have horses in the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase 40 sheep for his business.

loans.use: To purchase 40 sheep

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo es casado  y a su responsabilidad tiene  un hijo de dos años  de nombre José Alfredo  quien es su razón de trabajar con la elaboración de bordados de manta.

    El es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y esta vez es para invertirlo en la compra  de mantas por kilo y así bordarlo para luego venderlo en la ciudad de san Cristóbal de las casas, en dónde comenta que panes lleva un año y comenta que si le está yendo  bien.

    Se esta inspirando en esta actividad para poder tener ingresos así poyar a su esposa quien también se dedica a la misma actividad y así juntos tener ingresos para poder salir adelante con su pequeña familia.

     Lo que  más desea es que con esta su actividad tener más ingresos para poder trabajar  más adelante y tener sus propio a horros.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is married and responsible for a two-year-old son named José Alfredo. For this reason, he earns his livelihood by embroidering blankets.

This is the first time he is requesting a loan. He will invest in the purchase of blankets by the kilo that he will embroider. Reynaldo will sell his finished products in the city of San Cristóbal de Las Casas. He says that he has been in business for one year and is doing well.

Reynaldo was inspired to pursue this business so that he could have income to support his wife, who also performs the same line of work. The income they earn together allows their small family to get ahead.

What he wants most is for his business to earn more income. This will enable him to succeed in his job and build up his own savings.

loans.use: to purchase blankets to embroider.

loans.name: Eliseo Ramon

texts.es:
Eliseo pequeño comerciante, se dedica a la venta y compra de chatarra, con mas de seis años en las ventas, iniciando como mecanico, luego compra la camioneta con el objetivo de ponerla a trabajar en acarrero lo que hizo por varios años, y hoy en dia vende chatarra.
Don Eliseo ha venido invertiendo en su negocio y en su pequeña casa a un parte de zinc, lo que hira avanzando poco a poco, atraves de Afodenic logrando ya mejoras con cinco ciclos de prestamo. Con este nuevo financiamiento comprara el inodororo, y embaldosara. 
Logrando mejor higiene y el bienestar comun de su familia.
texts.en:
Eliseo is a small merchant selling scrap metal.  He’s been in sales for over six years.  He started out as a mechanic and later bought a pickup truck to put it to work in hauling which he did for several years.  Today, he sells scrap metal.

Eliseo has been investing both in his business and in his small house advancing little by little installing zinc metal sheeting.  He’s managed improvements through five cycles of Afodenic loans.  He will use the new loan to buy a toilet and to install tile flooring attaining better hygiene and the common wellbeing of this family.

loans.use: to buy a toilet and tile flooring.

loans.name: Olivia's Group

texts.en:
Olivia’s group is comprised of three hardworking women. Olivia herself is twenty years old, single and has no children. She lives in the town of Kasubi in the central Kampala region of Uganda. 

For a year Olivia has sold clothes. To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. Olivia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

Olivia’s loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Olivia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself by buying new clothes. In the future, Olivia hopes to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Liendhelou

texts.en:
Liendhelou is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Liendhelou has a pigpen and sells grown pigs. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for pigs.
Liendhelou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Liendhelou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita considers the education of her children the best treasure she can give to them because it will not fade away. She is 48 years old and married with four children. Two of them are married; one is working; and one is a college student. 

Estrelita is grateful because her husband helps her in raising their children. She has managed her community-based sari-sari (variety) store for almost 17 years and she earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos monthly. Her husband is a farmer and, at the same time, he operates his transport motorcycle.

In order to increase the volume of stocks in her community-based sari-sari store, Estrelita would like a loan amounting to 35,000 pesos. This will be used to buy different kinds of groceries such as soft drinks, Nescafe, sugar, ingredients and canned goods. She hopes that through this additional capital she requested, she could be able to increase the income she generates and save money for the schooling of her college student.

loans.use: to buy different kind of groceries such as soft drinks, Nescafe, sugar, ingredients and canned goods

loans.name: Alimamy's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Allen Town, near Freetown. This school was established in 2004/2005 academic year. The school is staffed with 17 teachers and has an enrollment of over 600 pupils. 

Alimamy is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Freetown, the 33 year old is married to a secretary and the couple has 1 child. Alimamy has requested for a loan of 1,000,000.00 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to invest it in a business. He will use it to buy rice, palm-oil, etc. in large quantity for resale.  

This will be the first loan that teachers of this school are requesting from SMT/Kiva lenders. This loan will certainly be of immense help to these teachers. Since salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone; especially so for people in the teaching profession, they could not use such salaries to buy or do anything great. But with a loan, they can now buy or do something big and then repay over a period of time. Some of them will use it to begin or continue building a house; others to pay either for themselves pursue further studies or pay for their children’s education. Some will use it to invest in businesses in order to complement their monthly salaries. And still, others will use theirs to buy pieces of furniture.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, etc. in large quantity for resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been operating a car wash for the past three years. He is 35 years old and married with two children. He has applied for his first loan of KES.40,000. He plans to employ two casual workers to work in the car wash and expand his business.

With the anticipated profit he plans to re-invest in the business. 

He dreams of becoming a leading business man.

loans.use: to employ two casual workers to work in the car wash and expand his business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a proud owner of a car repair shop. He has been working in the car mechanics field for more than 40 years. He is a married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He works hard to support his family and be able to pay mainly the school fees. Today, he is asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a specific mechanical machine which will allow him to better serve his customers. In the future, he is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell car spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase a specific mechanical machine

loans.name: Lilian Jeaneth

texts.es:
Lilian Jeaneth tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija, Lilian se dedica desde hace un año a elaborar tamales y golosinas, sus comidas las prepara todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes sale a vender junto con su esposo a los caseríos y comunidades aledañas, sus ventas son ambulantes y trabaja de lunes a domingo, Lilian utilizara el credito para la compra de alimentos para preparar sus deliciosas golosinas y sus sabrosos tamales.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lilian Jeaneth is 22 years old and lives with her husband and daughter.  She has been making tamales and sweet treats for one year.  She prepares her products every morning and, in the afternoons, she goes out with her husband to sell them in the neighboring villages and communities.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and works from Monday to Sunday.

Lilian will use this loan to buy food with which to prepare her delicious sweet treats and her tasty tamales.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy corn, fat, oil, vegetables, beef, pork, chicken, beans, butter, tortillas, cheese, eggs and seasonings

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda is 40 years old and lives in the town of Talibon with husband and three children. She is married to a fisherman and is responsible for operating their boat and selling her husband's catch in the town's market. They both work hard to improve their business and sustain their family. She is applying for this loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other gear. Her goal is to expand their business and provide her children with a good life.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other gear.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos dos quais 4 ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois netos que vivem com ele. 
Saiu da sua terra natal Inhambane para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida, é comerciante ha mais de 15 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, peixe, arroz, sumos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 8.000.00mt, para o negocio.
Pretende solicitar mais valor no futuro para ampliar a sua actividade comercial comprando uma viatura, para tal  irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. He is married and has six children, four of whom are still in school. He went to school through the sixth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports two grandchildren who live with them.
He left Inhambane for Maputo in search of a better life. He's had a shop for more than 15 years and earns 5,000 meticals a month. He uses his earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account.
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (peanuts, fish, rice, juices, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise he carries. His first loan was in the amount of 8,000 meticals, which he also invested in his business.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand his business by purchasing a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy products (peanuts, fish, rice, juices, etc.).

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Unidas es de la ciudad de Luque, se forma gracias a la unión de señoras de otro comité, las que decidieron seguir trabajando con el programa. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra Gloria es peluquera, tiene 39 años  está casada con el Sr Gustavo, quien es auxiliar aduanero. Tienen tres hijas una de 16 años quien está en el 2do año de la media, la otra tiene 14 años, ella está en el 8vo grado y la ultima hija tiene 12 años ella está en el 6to grado. Dice que sus hijas son su razón de lucha, que por ellas trabajaría todo el día, ya que desea darles todo lo mejor, para que no pasen privaciones.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva para la compra de tintes, gel, shampoo, maquillajes, y los otros insumos necesarios para su local. Sabe que esta ayuda la vendrá muy bien a su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas is located in the city of Luque.  The members used to be in another group but decided to continue working in the program through a new group.  They are very hard-working women who want to help their families get ahead.

Mrs. Gloria is a hairdresser.  She is 39 and married to Gustavo who is a Customs assistant.  They have three daughters, a 16-year-old who is in the second year of middle school, another, 14, who is in the 8th grade and the youngest, a 12-year-old who is in 6th grade.  She says her daughters are what motivate her to work hard since she wants to give them all she can and not deprive them of anything.

She is requesting a loan through the foundation and Kiva to buy hair color, gel, shampoo, make-up and other necessary supplies for her salon.  She knows that this support will help her business greatly.

loans.use: To buy hair color, gel, shampoo, make-up and other supplies.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 59 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo con su cónyuge y  sus 3 hijos en las edades de 24 a 31 años. Allí mismo tiene varios negocios: pues  ella vende en su tienda ranchos, víveres, refrescos, licores y bebidas, y también fábrica hielo y preparar  alimentos para comercializar.  Su vida de negocio la comenzó por iniciativa propia, cuando desde hace 30 años ,oriunda de un municipio del departamento de Antioquia, llegó a Barranquilla se dedicó al comercio de mercancías variadas y luego   agregó la oferta de estos productos mediante guías especializadas, luego se mudó a Malambo donde comenzó haciendo hielo, bolis y fabricando frituras. Aprovechando que su cónyuge es técnico de refrigeración y por eso logró comprar los equipos de congelamiento y también se dedicó a la venta al detalle de ranchos, víveres, licores, bebidas, refrescos, y en general artículos de la canasta familiar. Su vinculación a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  lo hace con el interés de obtener financiamiento pero especialmente capacitación y asesoría. En la actualidad cuenta con todos estos negocios, tiene 9 congeladores, 1 freidora y todas las herramientas y equipos característicos de una tienda de barrio. Su credikiva lo planea para provisionarse  de víveres refrescos y licores, que son los productos de mayor salida en épocas de fiestas, como las del final de año que se avecinan.
texts.en: Luz Marina, 59, lives in the municipality of Malambo with her husband and three children, ages 24 through 31.  She has several businesses: a store where she sells groceries, softdrinks, and liquor; an ice-making business; and a food business.  She arrived in Barranquilla 30 years ago from Antioquia and began selling general merchandise.  Then she added other products and moved to Malambo where she began making ice, frozen drinks and fried foods.  Since her husband is a refrigeration technician she was able to buy freezing equipment and began selling groceries, liquor, softdrinks and general items.  She joined the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because of the loans, but mainly for training and counseling.  She runs all of these businesses and has nine freezers, one deep fryer and all the tools and equipment that a neighborhood store should have.  She plans to use the Credikiva loan to buy groceries, softdrinks and liquors for the upcoming holiday season.

loans.use: To buy groceries, softdrinks and liquors for the holiday season.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya. He is 32 years old and has 10 straight years in the farming business. His farm currently produces maize, milk, and beans for the local market. He is still single.

Charles has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for his poultry business venture. He says this will help him spread his farming risk associated with pests and dairy animal diseases. He is optimistic the business will grow and enable him to build a good financial foundation for his family.

He mentions crop failure and animal diseases as the major challenges in the business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman, age 23. She has been selling herbal medicine for the last year to make a living. She also runs a retail shop business to supplement her income. Esther has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy herbal medicine for resale. In the next 5 years, she plans to become the distributor of herbal medicine in her region.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicine

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Ngasapisa Mhekela Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 34-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is attending primary education. She has done well growing maize and beans for over twelve years. However, she has failed to improve her farming activities due to lack of fertilizers and insecticides.

Mary is working hard to find capital for buying fertilizers and insecticides. She also dreams to expend her scale of production from three to nine acres within the next five years. She wishes to have a good house and private transport, such as a motorbike.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en:
Mrs. Choem, age 31 years-old, is a local farmer in Prey Chor district.  She is married and her husband works in the same type of business in Prey Chor district. She is also skilled in making bamboo baskets. This couple spends most of their time for work because they don’t have a child yet. Together, they typically earn an average of 2.5 per day from farming.

Presently they have had some difficulties in travelling as they don’t own a motorcycle for use. So now Choem decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to purchase a used motorcycle for her family and work. She hopes that she’ll be able to build and expand her farming business and pursue a better standard of living one day.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mrs. Mean is 46 years old and a mother of three single children living in Prey Chor district. Agriculture is the sole source of her income because this couple is extremely dependant on the output of the rice they produce.  As shown, the photo of Mean was taken with her husband in their new house, which she just bought from a local villager. Due to the lack of capital, Mean still is in debt to the previous house owner. Thus, she has applied for a loan from HKL to pay off her debt to the owner. Mean is very happy for the loan given to her. She said that she’ll pay her loan back to our MFI regularly on time as she did with her previous loans.

loans.use: to pay off her debt to the previous house owner.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
La señora María Elisa es casada vive en unión libre con el señor  Raúl y con quien procreo tres  hijos que un están a su responsabilidad y vive en un localidad pequeña.
 
     El préstamo que ella solito es para invertirlo en la compra y venta de pollo para luego venderlo destazado en  donde lleva trabajando ocho años  y comenta que le va bien.
 
     Inicio por si solo ya que  también quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  y así sacar adelante a su familia y no les haga falta lo necesario. 

      Lo que ella desea es que con el préstamo ella pueda seguir trabajando y  mejorando cada día sus ingresos de  su  hogar y salir adelante con su pequeña familia.

     Las personas  que integran en  el grupo son: Zoraida  invertirá el préstamo en la compra  de productos agrícolas y don  Òscar Alberto invertirá en la compra de mercancía para su negocio  de abarrotes.
texts.en:
María Elisa is in a common law marriage with Raúl. They have three children and live in a small town.
 
The loan she asked for is to invest in buying chickens to butcher and sell. She has been doing this for eight years and says that it is going well.
 
She started on her own since she wants to help her husband with the household expenses and thus get their family ahead so they won't lack anything they need. 

What she wants with the loan is to keep working and improving every day with her household income and to get ahead with her small family.

The people who make up the group are: Zoraida, who will invest in buying agricultural products and Oscar Alberto, who will invest in buying merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Lucy N.

texts.en: Lucy is a lady, thirty-two years old, married to John, and the mother of two children. She operates a mobile money transfer service (M-PESA) and also sells CDs in her retail shop. She has been in this business for five years and receives a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). This will be Lucy’s second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to add to the M-PESA float (working capital) of her money transfer service. In the future she wants to open another shop.

loans.use: to add to the float (working capital) of her M-PESA money transfer service.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 53 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlita has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tamina

texts.en:
Tamina B. is  42 year-old married woman and a mother of 2 school-children. The family income is rather limited. Since 2001 Tamina has been engaged in selling cups, tea pots, glasses and plates.

Now she applies for a loan of $500 for the first time to further develop her business, to increase her incomes, to improve her family\\\'s living condition. In her belief this will enable her to cover the education expenses of her children.

She plans to buy a variety of tea-pots,cups,glasses and saucers. She is sure that her good business skills will be very helpful to her in repaying the loan back.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of tea-pots,cups, glasses,plates and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce Nyambura intends to purchase 60 banana bunches

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
"Two months ago my house was robbed, and the truth is I don't care what they took. What I am worried about is my family's security.
