I started to build a fence in the front of the house, but I haven't been able to finish it. I would also like to put up bars on the windows for better security." I'm requesting $1,000 to finish the fence and put up the bars.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

“Hace dos meses se metieron a robar en mi casa y la verdad no me importa mucho lo que se llevaron, lo que me preocupa es la seguridad de mi familia, empecé a construir una barda al frente de mi casa pero no la he podido terminar, también me gustaría poner las rejas al frente para mayor seguridad”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para terminar la barda y poner las rejas.

loans.use: Finish building a fence and putting bars on his home's windows

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesús is from Cadereyta, Nuevo León. She is married and is the mother of three children. She began her own business three years ago by selling groceries; her husband’s salary for working as a chauffeur is very low and not enough to cover all the home expenses. She began selling a small amount of merchandise, but little by little and with great perseverance, she has supplied her store with a greater variety of products and has made it grow.

In this hot season, Maria de Jesús wishes to offer her clients ice cream and water ice products, high in demand these days. She is asking for a $ 250 dollar loan which she is committed to return in only 3 months. Maria and her family thank you for the trust and support you give them.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Jesús es originaria de la localidad de Cadereyta, Nuevo León, es casada y madre de tres pequeños. Desde hace tres años inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes ya que el salario que su esposo recibe como chofer es muy poco y no cubría todos gastos de su hogar. Comenzó vendiendo muy poca mercancía, pero poco a poco, con base en su perseverancia, ha surtido mejor su negocio y lo ha hecho crecer.

En esta temporada de calor Maria de Jesús desea poder ofrecer sus clientes helados y paletas de hielo que son productos muy demandados, para lo que está solicitando un crédito por $ 250 dólares, mismos que se compromete a retornar en solo 3 meses. Maria y su familia agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur I. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. He is 25 and lives with his parents in Saatli town located in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Seymur rents a barber shop and has one employee. They serve clients and at the end of each month they have to pay the rent to the shop owner. The school term is beginning and as a rule all school children get their hair cut before going to school. Seymur's barber shop isn't in good condition and needs to be renovated immediately. Seymur applied for a $500 loan from Normicro's Saatli branch. After getting the loan and renovating the shop, he hopes to attract more customers and increase his daily income.

loans.use: To renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Nawi

texts.en: Nawi is a 33 years old and married. She sells clothes and fabric on credit. She travels door to door to visit customers and collects the payment at the end of each month. She can earn $10 per week. Her husband has no fixed income. Nawi is a member of MBK and would like a loan of $125 (IDR 1,000,000) to expand her business and earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and fabric to expand her business

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 31 year old man who lives with his wife and child in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. Bilal owns a bakery. He is planning to develop his business. He therefore needs to buy an electrical oven, tables and merchandise to be able to sustain and improve his bakery. Bilal is asking for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: to buy an electrical oven, tables and merchandise

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang S. had two children with her first husband--one son and one daughter. In 2006, she married her second husband and they have one daughter. Her family lives along National Road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of selling vegetables in her village since 1990. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1000. She will use this money for purchasing vegetables for reselling and for repairing her house.

loans.use: For buying vegetables for reselling and to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kiwalazi East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane A.. She is currently in the business of selling maize and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Jane is 45 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 11 to 26 and her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to finish her house, which is under construction.

Jane is joined in her small group by Norah A., Gladys N., Jane K., and Jane A.. Norah A. has a business selling matooke and wants to boost business. Gladys N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase in bulk. Jane K. operates a business selling clothes and wants to re-invest in her business. Jane A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to put up a stall.

loans.use: To expand maize business

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina has belonged to the Communal Bank of Love and Truth for five years.

Karina is 24 years old and lives with her partner and her two sons. She sells clothes in a store in the “12th of April” Market, and she acquires her merchandise in Lima. Besides this, she sells “chicha” (a corn-based liquor) and ice creams typical of the area called “Muyuchi” (made of sesame, milk, sugar and ice.) She carries out her sales in the main park of Ayacucho and also in the Santa Clara market.

Karina needs a loan of 2000 soles ($750 US) that she will invest in the purchase of jerseys, jeans, lingerie, robes and diapers.

Karina dreams of having a large car for city transportation, her own house, and that her sons will be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Gladfelter, Alex Christoff and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

Karina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad hace 5 años.

Karina es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Karina vende ropa de bebe en un puesto del mercado 12 de abril, su mercadería es adquirida en la ciudad de Lima. Además Karina vende chicha y helados típico de la zona llamado “Muyuchi” (elaborado en base a ajonjolí, leche, azúcar, hielo) sus ventas lo realiza en el parque principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también en el mercado Santa Clara.

Karina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, jeans, ajuares, ropones, pañales.

Los sueños de Karina son tener un carro grande para transporte urbano, casa propia y sus hijos sean buenas personas.

loans.use: Karina needs a loan of 2000 soles ($750 US) that she will invest in the purchase of jerseys, jeans, lingerie, robes and diapers.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Mrs. Lam M. and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Thorn, were married in 1990 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. Their daughter weaves silk at home and the other two children are in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for eighteen years.

Mrs. Lam has been selling Khmer noodles and desserts in front of her home for three years. Now, she wants to start a new business raising pigs. She is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for raising.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, a native of the province of Azángaro, decided to emigrate to the city of Juliaca when she married Vicente, her inseparable and hardworking husband. They moved in search of better opportunities for their family. Since then, with perseverance and dedication they have succeeded in building a small home to shelter their two adorable children with warmth and love.

After getting settled in her home, Julia was finally able to set aside a space in their home and opened a small grocery store. She began to work with just a small amount of merchandise, but that didn’t stop her customers from visiting her store daily. With the earnings she made, she was able to increase the variety of products, making her store one of the most popular in the area, all thanks to her diligence.

The hope of this determined woman is to obtain a loan that will allow her to increase her products, improve service, and complete every order of her customers. Your generous heart will allow her to carry out her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy, a Kiva volunteer.

Julia, es natural de la provincia de Azángaro, desde que formó su hogar junto a Vicente, su inseparable y trabajador esposo, decidió emigrar hacia la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia. Desde entonces con constancia y dedicación han podido construir su pequeña casita para cobijar a sus dos adorables niños bajo el calor y amor de su hogar.Doña Julia, luego de estabilizarse pudo finalmente adecuar un espacio de su vivienda para abrir una tiendita de abarrotes e inició su labor con poca mercadería pero eso no fue razón para que sus clientes dejaran de visitarla a diario con las ganancias que obtuvo pudo aumentar la variedad de sus productos convirtiéndose en una de las bodeguitas más populares de su localidad, todo esto gracias a la buena atención que en todo momento brindó.El deseo de esta perseverante dama es obtener un préstamo que le permita incrementar sus productos, mejorar la atención y cumplir con cada solicitud de sus clientes.Tu generoso corazón permitirá concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba J. is a doctor and works in a nearby hospital. In addition to working at the hospital, she operates a small farm. She works very hard in order to sustain her family. Her husband went to Russia for work and left her alone with their two children. Matluba decided to apply for a loan and buy a calf. This would be a small investment. After the calf grows up, Matluba will be able to sell it. She plans on repaying the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Джобирова Матлюба – врач . Работает в районной больнице. Живет в районе Рудаки. Кроме того , что она работает в больнице , она еще и имеет небольшое хозяйство. Ей приходится много работать для того , чтобы обеспечить семью. Она замужем . Но муж ее уехал в Россию на заработки и она осталась одна с двумя детьми. Матлюба решила получить кредит и купить молодую корову. Это будет небольшим вложением. После того как корова вырастет , Матлюба сможет продать ее.Погасить кредит она планирует за 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy a calf

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mrs. Lach S. and her husband, Mr. Chheng Koy, are fishermen in Domrey Chhlang Village in Kandal Province. Aside from this business, they are pig breeders and they can make a small income on their two businesses. They have seven children, one who is employed in a garment factory, while five others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or attend school.  Mrs. Lach S.'s family now lives in poor conditions and her house does not have a kitchen for cooking. Thus, Mrs. Lach S. decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a kitchen in order to cook a delicious food for her family. Mrs. Lach S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a kitchen in order to cook a delicious food for her family.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., 35, is a widow who sells porridge for breakfast in Siem Reap where she lives with her five children. She typically makes US$ 15 each day in revenue and is aided in supporting the family by one of her children who works as a cleaner in a hotel. Another works as a vendor making US$ 5 per day.

Bun S. has asked CREDIT for a loan to help her increase her income and better support her family. She has asked for US$ 300 to purchase a stand at a local food market to sell porridge, rice, pork, beef, and other breakfast dishes. She believes that the market will be much more profitable than her home business and looks forward to expanding her customer base.

loans.use: Purchase a stand in the market

loans.name: Flaura

texts.en:
Greetings from Flaura in Byumba, in the north of Rwanda! Flaura is a young single entrepreneur of 22. She runs her own "cantine" (small shop) and sells drinks and food in a Catholic center.

She has been in a credit association and employs 2 people to help her run the business. She is requesting a loan worth 519,175 Frws to expand her business by buying more soft drinks, food, etc. The loan repayment period is 8 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pasca Juan Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Paska J.. She is currently in the business of selling sweets at her shop and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Paska is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 2 children aged between 20 and 25.

Each week, Paska makes approximately 300 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Paska is joined in her small group by Nura P., Sarah J., Locia Emmanuel, and Justina S.. Nura P. has a business selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Sarah J. is currently operating a business selling bread and charcoal and wants a loan to expand her business. Locia Emmanuel operates a business selling bread and wants to expand the business. Justina S. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand their small businesses

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en:
Sleiman is a 56-year-old married man who lives with his wife in Borj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Sleiman has owned and operated a grocery store since 2006. When Sleiman first started his business, he faced some difficulties because of a lack of cash. However, now that his business is well-established, he knows how to make his business successful and how to treat his clients because he is a good manager.

He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 in order to purchase more merchandise for his store as well as a washing machine for his wife. This is the first time that he has requested a loan, so he greatly appreciates your support.

loans.use: To expand his inventory and to purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Hojalateria Group

texts.es:
El g/s HOJALATERIA viene de la comarca guanacastillo jurisdicción de Nindiri, pertenece a la zona rural del departamento de masaya, la actividad principal del g/s es la elaboración de ropa tales como: chores, pantalones y camisas de niño esta actividad es típica de la zona, la mayoría de pobladores saben este oficio.
Doña Dania es jefe de familia ya que su esposo la abandono con 3 hijos a raíz de ese fracaso ella asumió el negocio costura, el que lo comercializa en el mercado de masaya y en las zonas francas  mas importantes de la ciudad con esto ella pretende mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia
Sus integrantes son del mismo sector de la  comarca y entre todos se apoyan mutuamente tanto en la producción como en la comercialización de sus productos.
Doña Ruth y Doña Petrona  iniciaron su negocio a temprana edad pues es herencia de su padres, en la actualidad los créditos de adim los han invertidos en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos, piensan en un futuro ampliar y poner un taller en la ciudad de Masaya, para lograrlo saben que tiene que manejar bien sus créditos para optar a uno más grande y poder cumplir su sueños, y  ser siempre una buena clienta de ADIM
texts.en:
The Hojalateria lending group is from Guanacastillo, in the Nindiri region, a rural area of the Masaya district. The group works mostly with clothing, making shorts, pants, children's shirts etc. The region is known for it's tailoring and the majority of its population knows the trade. Doña Dania began making clothes when her husband left her with three children. She overcame her loss and has been selling her clothes in the markets of Masaya and the surrounding region in order to improve her family's quality of life. Doña Ruth and Doña Petrona began making clothing at an early age, inheriting the business from their parents. They have, so far, invested the loans they have received from ADIM into the purchase of raw materials for their clothing. In the future, they hope to expand their business and open a shop in Masaya. In order to achieve this dream, they know that they have to manage their loan repayment well so that they become eligible for a larger one. The group's members are from the same neighborhood and they support one another's work, helping each other out both with the production and the marketing of their clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Mumtaz Ali Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a 38 years old married woman. She owns a two room brick house in the city of Pakpattan and has been living in it for the past 16 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and, for the past 16 years, he has been in the business of selling cooking oil. Parveen akhtar baji is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The others are enrolled in a school and are receiving an education. Parveen baji helps her husband sell cooking oil. She sells in the community and her husband sells in the shops. She is applying for a loan to buy cooking oil to expand the business.

Parveen akhtar baji is a group leader of more women in her locality. Nazia baji is requesting a loan to buy books of different subjects (religious, Syllabus and fiction books) for her book stall. Riffat sultana baji is requesting a loan to buy wood for her furniture making and selling business. Haleema baji is requesting a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. Hamidan baji is requesting a loan to contract for land to grow seasonal vegetables to sell. Sharifan baji is requesting a loan to buy chick peas, flour, cooking oil and spices for her food selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Raqya Group

texts.en:
Rona is the group leader of Raqya group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for his/her own business.

Rona and Raqya want a loan for her her beading business so she can buy necessary materials for her business. Shafeqa wants a loan for her son’s general store as he wants to enlarge his business. Sakhy Dad wants a loan for his general store to increase his inventory. With this loan they are can improve their businesses and support their families, thus making a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To purchase more stock and enlarge their businesses

loans.name: Sylvana

texts.en: Sylvana is a 30-year-old married woman with four children and she lives in the Katarmaya municipality in Mount Lebanon Governate.  She runs a bakery that she first opened in 1998.  Her last micro loan with Ameen was taken to increase her bakery's inventory.  Today, Sylvana wants to borrow $1,200 to purchase additional flour for the bakery.

loans.use: Buy flour inventory

loans.name: Modinotu

texts.en: Modinotu is an advanced woman, 52 years old, a widow with five children.  Modinotu sells clothes, shoes and bags and she learned this business from her mother from childhood.  She has been in the business for the past 20 years. Modinotu needs a loan of N140, 000 to purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa M. is from Buenavista, Pagadian City and has two children. She is married to a businessman and they work together at a hog-buying and hog-raising business. She and her husband manage their little business, which they started from a small capital. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing.

She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 7,000 for the expansion of their hog-raising business. As much as possible, they have to have all the needed capital to maximize the return. She wants to buy the pigs so she can resell them at the market, where they will fetch higher prices.

In the future, she dreams of saving from the daily sales and wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: To expand her hog-raising business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Victoria es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Victoria viaja una vez por semana a la costa como Ica, en donde vende cereales, y de allá compra maíz de gallina, pallar que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, haba y trigo.
Los sueños de Victoria son tener capital propio para su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Señor de Huanca (Our Lord of Huanca) Village Bank. She is 39, married, and has 4 children. She travels weekly to the coast of Ica to sell cereals and buy Gallina (Hen) corn and butter beans to sell in the Ayacucho markets. Victoria is seeking a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of barley, broad beans, and wheat. She dreams of having her own capital for her business, and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barley, broad beans, and wheat.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 35 years old. He is unmarried and has no children. Tony lives on his own in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Tony says he wants to be prepared financially before he gets married. He is a trader. He runs a cold store at the market square in his community. Here he sells fresh fish and fresh meats such as beef, chicken, and turkey. He would like to obtain a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock. Tony has been in business for two years. He hopes to expand his business and improve upon his standard of living.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and meat for sale

loans.name: Jo-An

texts.en:
Jo-An H. raises pigs. She is 24 years old and has one child. She started her business with two piglets. Now she has one sow and seven piglets. Her business is doing so well. Her husband, Thelmo H., a farmer, has been very supportive of her in her business.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase pig feed. The loan will really give her a chance to expand her business more.

Through CEVI, she has been able to sustain her livelihood for a long time. CEVI provided her not just loans but training and insurance coverage, as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Clementina Joaquim

texts.pt:
Clementina Joaquim X. de 35 anos de idade, natural de boane, mãe de 2 filhos, vive em boane desde que nasceu. Vive com seu marido a mais de 10 anos com mais um sobrinho na casa dos pais. frenquenta 10 classe na Escola Secundaria de Boane. 

Trabalha como secretaria da Direção distrital de Educação de Boane, local de residência, e aufere um salário mensal de 2.100,00MT. Beneficiou se de uma formação especifica sobre a tarefa que exerce a mais de 5 anos.

Este é o seu quinto empréstimo e no valor de 20.000,00MT com os quais pretende dar continuidade na construção da casa de material convencional que vem fazendo desde os primeiros empréstimos. (6.500,00MT; 10.000,00MT; 11.000,00MT e 11.000,00MT).
  
Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de informações obtidas na sua instituição logo no dia da inauguração da sucursal de boane.

Sonha ter uma casa própria concluída para acomodar a sua família em melhores condiçoes e solicitar outros empréstimos para iniciar com pequenos negócios.
texts.en:
Clementina Joaquim X. is 35 years old. She is from Boane and has lived there since she was born. She has two children and lives with them and her husband of more than 10 years, as well as a nephew, in her parents' house. She attended school through the 10th grade at the Escola Secundaria de Boane. She works as a secretary in Boane's district education office and earns a monthly salary of 2100 MT. She received special training in her job responsibilities, and has held the position for more than five years. This is her fifth loan, in the amount of 20,000 MT, and she intends to use it to continue construction on her house, which she began building using the first loans (6500 MT; 10,000 MT; 11,000 MT e 11,000 MT). She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through information provided by her agency after the opening of the Boane branch. She dreams of having a house of her own so her family can enjoy a better quality of life, and of requesting additional loans so she can start other small business.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonita

texts.en: Anonita S. is from the village of Delapaz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, widowed, and has two adult children. Anonita owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 12,525 PHP a month. In 2005, Anonita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anonita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Amani West Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a member of the Amani west borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 32-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of two children aged 8 and 2 years.
 
Sophia started her own business selling sugar, rice and wheat two years ago. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 80,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Sophia’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more soap, rice and wheat. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sophia hopes to save money and expand her business.

Valelia, the other member of the Amani west borrower group, has also requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to sell

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
At the foot of a big mountain is a small village of about two hundred families. L., age 36, lives in a house in this village. He has worked for many years as a statue decorator, working on statues of animals or the likenesses of such figures as Apsara, Hanuman, and Buddha.

Once he has finished decorating a statue, he needs a way of delivering it to his customers. He would like to buy a pair of buffalo as his method of delivery. To purchase these, he is hoping to obtain a loan in the amount of $1,000.

In the future, he dreams of having enough money to afford a bigger house.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffaloes for his peaceful delivering service.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 5 meses de nacido en el caserío La Zaranda, distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace año y medio se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes de raza criolla (animales domésticos  típicos de ciertos países sudamericanos), ella los alimenta con corteza de plátano y con chala (una variedad de sembrío de maíz utilizado como forraje para animales), su esposo trabaja eventualmente como peón agrícola y entre ambos tratan de sacar adelante su hogar.

Su negocio ha ido creciendo y ahora tienen mas de un centenar de cuyes, pero lo que percibe por la venta no le alcanza para alimentarlos, por lo que está solicitando por tercera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permita invertir en la alimentación y sanidad de sus animales, por otro lado el creciente número de ejemplares amerita el mantenimiento de las javas en las que viven.

Su más grande anhelo es llegar a tener a largo plazo una granja de cuyes y también poder construir una casa propia.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos, por lo que es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
María is 21 years old, married, and has a 5 month old child. She and her family live in the village of La Zaranda in the district of Pitipo, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For a year and a half, she has been breeding and selling native guinea pigs (traditional domesticated animals in certain South American countries). She feeds them banana tree bark and corn husks (from a variety of corn commonly used for animal fodder). Her husband works as a farmhand. They both try to succeed in their home life.

Her business has grown and now she has more than 100 guinea pigs. However, her revenue is not enough to continue feeding them. She is requesting her third loan from our Institution in the amount of 1500 soles so that she can invest in the nutrition and health of her animals. Since the number of animals continues to increase, María has paid more attention to maintaining the cages in which they live.

Her greatest dream is to continue her guinea pig farm for the long term and build her own house. María has worked with us previously and demonstrated her punctuality and responsibility with her payments. She is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
This is Abdul M. K., Mabinty C., Kadiatu J. and Adama T.. They named their group Tamensu, a Temne phrase meaning “Give us a try”. They are small scale businesspeople in Waterloo small town, about twenty-two miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses. 

Abdul M. K. (right) is the leader of this group. Abdul is fifty years of age. He was born in Masorie village, about thirteen miles from Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone.  He is married with six children. Five of his children are attending secondary and primary schools, the last is not of school going age. Abdul owns a pharmacy in Waterloo. He has been selling medicines for the five years now. Before now, he was working for an N.G.O.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy de ocupación albañil y además es  pequeño agricultor y productor lechero mismo que lo comercializa con Pil Andina, para su posterior transformación en productos derivados del mismo (queso, yogurt, etc.), la esposa le ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa, tiene 3 hijos  2 en colegio y 1 en el Cuartel, viven en casa propia ubicado en la comunidad Tipampa Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para poder aumentar la producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, los créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Eloy.
texts.en:
Eloy is a bricklayer. He is also a small farmer and milk producer. He sells his milk to Pil Andina to be made later into dairy products (cheese, yogurt, etc.). His wife helps him with the household chores. They have three children. Two are in school, and one is in the barracks. They live in their own house in the Tipampa Achacachi community in the Omasuyos province (three hours from the city of La Paz). The loan is to buy a dairy cow of medium quality to be able to increase milk production and increase family income. This is his third loan with IMPRO. His previous loans were repaid punctually. The completed evaluation qualifies Eloy for the loan he is soliciting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Damarce

texts.en:
Damarce N. is 53 years old and is married with six children aged between 3 to 21 years. Damarce lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda where, since 1994, she has had a successful shop selling general goods; 2009 is the fifteenth anniversary of her business! She employs four people in her shop, which is open from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day.

Damarce requested her loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her shop through purchasing more foodstuffs and other goods. This will provide her with goods which she doesn’t currently have in her shop and which she believes her customers will appreciate.

By receiving this loan, Damarce hopes that her business prospects will improve. And, with the extra profits received, she will be able to pay school fees for her six children.

loans.use: To buy more inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Tepetlapa Group

texts.es:
La comunidad de San Antonio Tepetlapa se encuentra ubicada en una zona montañosa al norte de Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca., a 70 KM aproximadamente, los habitantes hablan dialecto mixteco 100%, digenas alli se encuentra formado el grupo solidario TEPETLAPA, integrado por cinco personas la representante es la sra. Josefina T. López,tambien es la traductora del grupo todos originarios del mismo lugar, se dedican a la venta de tamales de carne y de dulce,la sra. Tomasa vende pollo fresco destazado, la sra Josefina ademas de vender tamales en ocaciones se traslada a Pinotepa para adquirir pescado fresco y camaron estos productos se comercializan muy facilmente en el pueblo comenta ya que consideran que es bastante la distancia de tepetlapa a pinotepa y por esa razon muchas personas prefieren comprar el marisco que ella lleva para vender.
estas personas solicitan credito a la fundacion par poder comprar la materia prima para preparar tamales como son:chiles seco, azucar, aceite vegetal, canela en rajas, maíz, manteca, hoja verde de platano, sal, leña, carne fresca de puerco, carne fresca de pollo, y carne de chivo, pollo en pie, pimienta, en el caso de la persona  que vende marisco fresco invierte una cantidad considerable de dinero, ademas de que  paga transporte y flete para llevarlo al pueblo y vender.
nos comentó la cliente Tomasa G. G. y Catalina López López.-que ellas tienen la necesidad de trabajar ya que son viudas y con el dinero que le proporcionan sus hijos no le es sufieciente para cubrir sus gastos y mas cuando tienen que comprar medicamentos que luego tienen precios muy alto, las demas integrantes del grupo trabajan para apoyar a sus esposos en los gastos de sus hijos soveltan gastos escolares que son execivos en muchos de los casos.
Agregó la sra Josefina que todos estan a gusto trabajando con el credito que la institución les otorga ya que tienen considerado continuar solicitand mucho mas financiamiento que le sea posible porque de esa manera podran ayudar cada día mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The community of San Antonio Tepetlapa is located in a mountainous area 70km north of Pinotepa Nacional in the State of Oaxaca. One hundred percent of the inhabitants speak the Mixtec dialect. Here we find the Tepetlapa Solidarity Group, which consists of five people and is led by Sra. Josefina T. López. She also serves as the translator for the group.

All of the members are originally from San Antonio Tepetlapa and sell beef tamales and sweets. Sra. Tomasa also sells freshly butchered chickens. In addition to selling tamales, Sra. Josefina sometimes travels to Pinotepa to buy fresh fish and shrimp because those products are more readily available there. It is quite a distance between Tepetlapa and Pinotepa, so the locals prefer to buy any seafood that she has available to sell.

Sras. Tomasa G. G. and Catalina López López told us that they need to work because they are widows and the money they set aside for their children is not enough to cover their expenses. It is even more difficult when they have to buy medicines because the prices are too high. The other group members work in order to help their spouses with their children’s expenses, such as their education, which can be excessive in most cases.

Sra. Josefina says they all enjoy working with the loans they receive from Fundación Realidad because it provides them with as much additional financing as possible to help them improve their families each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for making tamales

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela C. is now 48 years old. She is married to Mariano, 48 year old, who is an electrician in their village. They are blessed with seven children, three of whom are already graduated from college and are now working at private companies, while the others are still studying.

Despite their economic situation, they aim to give their children a better future by providing the best education as much as possible. They have helped each other to earn a living and finance the education of their children.

Farming is the common source of their living; they plant rice and vegetables twice a year. Aside from this, Angela is engaged in rice retailing to earn additional income since harvesting takes a long time. She wants to sell more rice, but she has inadequate capital to do so.

Angela would like to borrow Php 6,000 from Kiva lenders to acquire more rice to sell in their village since it is one of the basic commodities. She hopes that she can improve her small business and continue to support the schooling of their children.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Comite Las Amigas Group

texts.en: The Women Entrepreneurs Committee “Las Amigas” is made up of 18 women, all from the same neighborhood. They are currently in their 13th loan cycle as part of the Fundacion Paraguaya Women’s Entrepreneuship Program. With each loan cycle, they all participate in training workshops where they learn how to save, budget and market their businesses. They use their loans to expand their businesses, which involve selling clothing and furniture, and running manicure salons and food stands where they sell “chipas," a traditional Paraguayan cheese bread.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to their customers

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El Señor Ignacio es soltero pero tiene un hijo que vive con la abuela materna a quien ayuda constantemente de acuerdo alos ingresos que el mismo alcanza, el tiene su domicilio en la ciudad de Piribebuy en la Compañía Capilla Cué.                                                                                              Ignacio es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en las ciudades del Departamento de Paraguari, posee aproximadamente  800 clientes a quienes les deja sus mercaderías recibiendo a cambio una entrega mínima, el saldo les cobra en forma semanal o a dependiendo de la venta que los mismos realicen al día.
 Empezó en la actividad hace un poco mas de 3 años con un pequeño capital que tenia ahorrado de los trabajos que realizaba como jornalero. Gracias a la buena administración de su negocio, el buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes y a la calidad de sus productos hoy día tiene un negocio firme en cual puede apoyarse económicamente, que con el cual cubre todos sus gastos personales y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio is single, and has one son who lives with his maternal grandmother whom he helps constantly as part of this living agreement. He resides in Piribebuy in the Capilla Cué Company. Ignancio is a businessman, who sells articles of clothing in cities in the Paraguari State. He has approximately 800 clients he serves, and from whom he receives in return a minimum order. His salary is paid weekly, or depending on the sales he achieves on a given day. He began selling clothes slightly more than three years ago with his savings from working as a day laborer. Thanks to his smooth-running business, the good deals he offers his clients, and the quality of the products he sells, he currently has a solid business that enables him to support himself economically and cover all his personal expenses and those of his son.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase capri pants, mens' and womens' jeans

loans.name: Saijirmaa

texts.en: Saijirmaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Her sons, 14 and 12, both attend a local high school while her husband helps with the family business when he isn't driving his taxi. Saijirmaa operates a dairy products retail business out of a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 2001 with working capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD). Since then she has stabilized her business and bought a car with her earnings in order to help her husband to start a taxi service. Now her working capital reached 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). She is quite an energetic lady who works hard to achieve her goals. She says, "I want to continue to maintain my business in the future." She is requesting a 1,800,000-tugrug loan to purchase variety of dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of dairy products

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: Don Domingo tiene la edad de 34 años, casado, vive en el bario Batahola Norte, su esposa  tiene un hijo de 9 días nacido. El trabaja para la empresa serví pro, como guarda de seguridad, antes trabajaba como policía, y tenia un cargo en antifraude. Pero por motivo de peligro decidió salirse, por falta de dinero no ha logrado construir su propia casa y vive junto con sus padres es por eso la necesidad de ampliar su cuarto con el nacimiento de su primer hijo ya que esta contento y desea dar las mejores condiciones para su pequeña familia. Este es su primer financiamiento el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, hierro, cemento, arena, zinc para poder comenzar la obra y gozar de privacidad. a futuro es lograr poder tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo is 34 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of North Batahola. His wife had a son nine days ago. He works for the business Servípro as a security guard. Before that he was a policeman working in antifraud. However, because of danger he decided to leave that job. Because of his lack of money, he has not been able to build his own house, so he lives with his parents. Because of the birth of his first son, he needs to widen his room in the house since he is content and wants to give the best possible conditions to his small family. This is his first loan, with which he will buy construction materials such as: stone, iron, cement, sand, and zinc in order to start his work and enjoy privacy. His goal is to be able to have his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, and zinc to begin working

loans.name: Charity Faith's Group

texts.en:
Charity Faith T. is from the village of Bryg. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old. Charity Faith is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Charity Faith T. Group.

Charity Faith is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Charity Faith owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Charity Faith has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Charity Faith joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charity Faith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charity Faith is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Charity Faith from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Evangelene

texts.en:
Evangelene B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 51 years old. Evangelene is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evangelene owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food in the local community. Evangelene has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evangelene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangelene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangelene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mutungo South Nabuuma Marriam Group

texts.en:
N. Marriam is a businesswoman, thirty-one years old, who is married with three children schooling. She deals with a restaurant business which she has been operating so far for four years.

Marriam is using the loan to add capital to her business by buying more restaurant items like food (bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice, maize flour, Irish potatoes, and so forth), sauces (beef, chicken, vegetables, and so on), drinks (sodas, Splash, milk, water, and so forth), and so forth to meet her customers’ demands.

Marriam is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To add capital to her restaurant business

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora M. V.  realiza venta de tortilla en su casa desde las 5 am inicia preparando el producto para la fabricación de tortilla que es realizada en dos  turnos de 10 am  - 12pm, y por la tarde 4:00 am – 6pm.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra por mayor de los productos a utilizar en la elaboración de tortilla aprovechando que se encuentra con precios accesible. De esta manera obtener mayor ganancia para una mejor situación económica.

 La Señora M. V. está  muy satisfecha con el apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por que ha logrado el crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. M. V. sells tortillas from her home. She starts preparing the ingredients at 5am and then makes the tortillas in two shifts – from 10am to 12pm, and in the afternoon from 4pm to 6pm.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products in bulk that she uses for making tortillas. She wants to take advantage of discounted prices so that she can generate better earnings and improve her financial situation.

Sra. M. V. is very satisfied with the support CEPRODEL has provided by helping her grow her business and improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, and lime

loans.name: Avanzando Contigo Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Avanzando Contigo” y se conforma por 16 socias pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de ropa usada, ropa interior, comida según la época del año (por ejemplo humitas), repostería y coctelería, atención de centro de Internet, zapatería y bordados.
La socia entrevistada fue Esperanza, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en 1º fila, agachada, tiene el pelo hasta los hombros. Ella tiene una rotisería (donde se venden alimentos perecibles y no perecibles) en su casa. Con el crédito quiere ampliar su negocio, ya que su sueño es tener un minimarket, que cuente con una gran variedad de productos, no solo alimentos, sino que también artículos de librería. Para lograrlo quiere ir incorporando de a poco productos nuevos, por ejemplo su próxima meta es comprar una fotocopiadora. 
Además tiene otras metas personales como sacar su 4º año de educación media, lo cual está realizando este año en jornada vespertina, para así más adelante estudiar una carrera. Su mayor sueño es ser fuente de trabajo para otras personas como ella, con ganas de superarse. Su gran motivación es su familia, sus dos hijas, de 11 y 2 años y su esposo que la apoya en todo.
Esperanza siente que Fondo Esperanza significa un pilar muy importante para su desarrollo personal y estabilidad económica y está muy agradecida de la facilidad con la cual ha obtenido sus créditos.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Avanzando Contigo" is made up of 16 members from the city of Temuco. They work mainly in the area of retail sales, including sales of used clothing, underwear, food according to the season of the year (for example, tamales), and catering. Other members also attend to an internet cafe, make and repair shoes, and do embroidery. The member interviewed was Esperanza, who is the president of this group. In the photograph she is found in the first row, crouching, with shoulder-length hair. She has a deli (where she sells perishable and non-perishable food) in her house. With the loan she wants to expand her business, since her dream is eventually have a mini-market where she can sell a large variety of products, including not only food but also office supplies. To achieve this she wants to start gradually incorporating new products into her business. For example, her next goal is to buy a photocopier. In addition, she has other personal goals such as completing her last year of high school, which she is doing this year in the evenings, so that later on she can begin to study for an advanced degree. Her main dream is to be a source of work for others like her who want to succeed. Her greatest motivation is her family: her 2 daughters, aged 11 and 2, and her husband who supports her in everything. Esperanza feels that the Fondo Esperanza supports her personal development and economic stability, and she is very grateful for the easy terms at which she has been able to access credit. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile), and has number of lake resorts and colorful vegetation and wildlife. It is worth highlighting that this region is where 50 percent of Chile's Mapuches (indigenous people) live.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand her business (construction)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. SONIA,  Nuestra socia tiene 34 años  es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia compra y vende productos agrícolas desde el año 2005 Nuestra socia vende productos secos como son maíz, quinua, trigo, cebada, habas, arvejas, papa. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para compra al por mayor la mercadería (productos secos).
 
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank “SACRO”. She is from the Cruz Pata community in the town of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba, department of Cuzco. Our member is SONIA. She is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. She alternates her activities between her home and her retail business. She has bought and sold agricultural products since 2005. Sonia sells dry products, such as corn, quinoa, wheat, barley, beans, peas and potatoes. She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (dry products). This member is grateful for and values the support offered in this way and she is committed to making the payments of her debt according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member is asking for the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (dry products).

loans.name: Primavera De Cachi Baja Group

texts.es:
Bertha, Alicia y Eulalia son 3 socias D. las 22 que tienen el Bancomunal Primavera D. Cachi Baja, ubicado en el departamenteo D. Huancavelica.

Bertha es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Bertha se dedica a L. venta D. sal y granos a granel los cuales traslada hasta L. capital para su venta. Bertha necesita un préstamo para poder comprar más granos y  venderlos. Quiere empezar a ahorrar para poder tener una pequeña empresa D. crianza D. cuyes.

Alicia es casada y tiene 02 hijos pequeños, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. hierbas D. distintas variedades, las cuales recolecta D. madrugada, hace secar y las venD. por kilos. Alicia, requiere D. un préstamo, con el cual quiere comprar mas hierbas y así hacer crecer su negocio. Alicia quiere empezar a ahorrar, para así poder comprar un máquina para secar las hierbas

Eulalia es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Eulalia se dedica a L. venta D. sal, granos y hierbas. Las cuales recolecta en su comunidad y traslada a L. capital para su venta. Eulalia, requiere D. un préstamo con el cual aumentara L. cantidad D. sus productos y le generará mayores ingresos. Eulalia tiene como primera meta el ahorrar para comprarse un auto y así trasladar su mercadería hasta L. capital.
texts.en:
Bertha, Alicia, and Eulalia are three of the twenty-two members of the Primavera D. Cachi Baja Community Bank which is located in Huancavelica department. Bertha is married and has five children. Her job is selling salt and grains in bulk which she takes to the capital city to sell. Bertha needs a loan to buy more grains to sell. She wants to begin saving money so she can start a small business raising guinea pigs. Alicia is married and has two small children. She sells herbs which she gathers at dawn, dries them, and sells them by the kilo. Alicia needs a loan to buy more herbs and expand her business. She wants to begin saving for a machine that dries herbs. Eulalia is married and has five children. She sells salt, grains, and herbs. She gathers the herbs in her community and takes them to the capital to sell. Eulalia needs a loan so she can increase the number of products she sells and thus earn more money. Her primary goal is to save enough money to buy a vehicle to use for transporting her merchandise to the capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her grain-selling business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 61-year old married man from Lebanon. For 40 years, he has been running his own business in the construction industry. He is extremely proud of his experience and reputation. He says that his honesty and ability to interact well with people are some of his strengths. In his work, he completes all components of a construction project including installing the electrical wires and working on the pipes. 

He is requesting a loan of US $3000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to purchase rock and other materials for his construction projects. This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua. In the future he hopes to buy a plot of land so he can construct a building.

loans.use: To purchase rock and other materials for his construction projects

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 50 year old borrower from Lebanon. He is married and is a father of three children. Bassam has been working in bee keeping and agriculture.

Today, for the first time, Bassam is requesting a loan to plant a new orchard. He decided to start his businesses because of his experience. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, and hopes to expand his agriculture business.

loans.use: To plant a new orchard.

loans.name: Pheary

texts.en: Mrs. Pheary S., 40 years old and living in Kantuot Thum village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Yar Moeung, is a chicken breeder and seller who earns a small income to help support his family. In order to help her husband's business, Pheary is requesting a loan to buy more chickens and some bamboo to build a chicken house. This couple has three children; two are students in the local school, while the youngest is 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and some bamboo to build a chicken house.

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en: In Prey Lvea Lech village in Takeo province has four members whom all are made up a group loan. Mrs. Ty H. is a group leader who is 45 years old, selected by the other members will use portion of their loan for varied ways. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Kea Khlork, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Ty H. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and rest of the loan she hires plow machine to plow her field. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others are attending in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena J. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Rowena is married and has 5 school-age children. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Malick Sémou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malick Sémou  D. est un habitant du village de Yoff. Il est marié et père de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 16 ans. Il est âgé d 36 ans. 
Monsieur D. est boulanger de métier. Il a choisi cette activité par passion. Mais parallèlement  il s’est  adonne à l’élevage  et au commerce de moutons. L’élevage  de moutons, il l’a hérité de sa grand-mère qui lui avait légué quelques  moutons. Ainsi il en a fait une activité secondaire.
Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff  depuis mai 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 250000 frs en vue d’acheter des moutons destinés a la vente. Il a aussi prévu d’étendre  son enclos  avec une partie du financement. La réalisation de profits supplémentaires lui permettra de mieux assister sa famille dans leurs besoins vitaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Malick Sémou D. is an inhabitant of the village of Yoff. He is married and the father of seven children aged between 2 and 16. He himself is 36 years old. Mr. D. is a baker. He chose this trade because he loves it. In addition, however, he raises and sells sheep. His sheep-raising is something he inherited from his grandmother who left him several sheep. So he made that his secondary business. He has been a member of the Yoff branch since May 2010. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy sheep that he intends to re-sell. He also intends to expand his sheep pen with part of the loan. Any supplementary profit he makes will allow him to better support his family and provide for their basic needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sheep for resale

loans.name: Serah Muthoni

texts.en:
Serah Muthoni K. is 52 years old. She is married to Philip Munyua and she is the mother of two children. 

She has been farming her own piece of land for the last seven years.

She learned about KADET through an awareness program done by KADET staff in the area where she lives. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend thirty thousand Kenyan shillings to prepare the land and plant wheat. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she can do commercial farming. 

She is a hard-working woman and very determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: preparing a farm for and planting wheat

loans.name: So's Group

texts.en:
Nine people make up this village bank loan; they live in Kampong Pou village, Kandal province. Mrs. So P., 49 and married, is the village bank president having been selected by the members of this village bank loan. The members of this village loan hope to increase their income so as to better support their families in the future.   

Mrs. So P. earns her living by selling groceries. With this business, she still earns only a little income to improve the family's living conditions. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activity. Her husband, Mr. Saem Phall, 48 years old, works as a laborer, receiving a small salary to support his family. This couple has six children: three are laborers while the others are students and also help in their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to enlarge her business

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick T. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is not in school. Fred runs a lodge, which he has had for over 10 years. He also has a retail shop.

To help expand his business, Fredick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase items that were not there in the lodge, like more bed sheets and beds. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Fredick hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Fred hopes to turn the lodge into a modern hotel with better facilities.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets and beds for a lodge

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn F. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 38 years old. Marilyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from breeding pigs. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be Marilyn's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en: This group loan has four members who live in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chum C., 32 years old, is the group leader who was selected by the other members. They are going to buy something that relates to their businesses. She rents a general store and sells groceries near the garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Phorlla Nhem, works in the garment factory. In order to improve the family, she wants to start a new business. Thus, Mrs. Chum C. is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to sell. She has a child who is helping her in her business.

loans.use: To buy more coffee to make coffee for sell

loans.name: Daryl

texts.en:
Daryl M. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old. Daryl is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Daryl owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, bread, junk foods, detergents & beverages in the local community. Daryl has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Daryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daryl is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Daryl from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN” el banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol; La socia tiene 25 años de edad, La socia es soltera; la socia trabaja alternando dos trabajos. Ella tiene una pequeña joyería, ella vende joyas en plata, en sus ratos libres, a su vez la socia alterna su trabajo en el seguro social como empleada contratada temporalmente, la socia entro a trabajar por un services (terceros) y esta solo por unos meses trabajando en el seguro social, lo que a ella le queda de tiempo libre lo dedica para alternar con la joyería,  la socia desea el préstamo para hacer de este un pequeño capital de negocio y d este modo poder aumentar sus mercadería en plata y vender. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y comprar mercadería.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank “Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastián”; the community bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member’s name is Mrs. Marisol; she is 25 years old and single. She alternates between two jobs; she has a small jewelry store where she sells silver jewelry in her free time. At the same time, she works with Social Security as a temporary employee through an agency; she has only been there for a few months. For this reason, she has free time that she dedicates to sell jewelry. Mrs. Marisol would like to use the loan as working capital to increase her silver merchandise and her sales. The member is requesting the loan to invest in her business and buy merchandise.

Mrs. Marisol is grateful and values the loan received through this channel; in the same manner, she commits herself to fulfill her payments in the established period.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to invest in her business and buy merchandise.

loans.name: Edgar David

texts.es:
el joven Edgar M. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el barrio las colinas, Edgar es un hombre trabajador y muy dedicado a su familia, a pesar de su corta edad es una persona de admirar por su dedicacion al hogar y al trabajo. Edgar es tornero industrial.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para construccion, esta construyendo su casa.
Todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para ir a trabajar.
Edgar esta casado pero no tiene hijos toda via, espera terminar su casa para poder tener hijos.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar a su familia.
texts.en: The young man, Edgar M., of 22 years old, lives in the Las Colinas neighbourhood.  Edgar is hard working and very dedicated to his family.  Despite his young age, he is a person to be admired for his dedication to his household and his work.  Edgar is an industrial metal machinery handler.  He would use this credit to purchase construction materials as he is building his house.  Every day he wakes up at 5am in the morning to go to work.  Edgar is married but doesn't have any children on the way.  He hopes to complete his house so that he can have children.  In his free time, he visits his family.

loans.use: Purchase cement, rocks, sand, and steel.

loans.name: Abraham Josue

texts.es: Abraham tiene 25 años es soltero no tiene carga familiar vive en casa alquilada hace mas de 3 años , tiene una movilidad que  trabaja manejando  tiene buenas referencias personales, no tiene experiencia crediticia gozan de buenas referencias personales , tiene aspiraciones a seguir trabajando con la entidad para luego poder acceder a mas crédito solicita dicho crédito para mantenimiento de dicha movilidad  se propone dicho crédito por contar  con capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Abraham is 25, single and does not have a family burden. He has lived in a rented home for over 3 years. He has a car and works driving it. He has good personal references, and has no credit history. He hopes to continue working with the company in order to be able to access more credit later. He is requesting this loan for the maintenance of his car. He has the ability to repay it.

loans.use: for maintenance for his car

loans.name: Karina Marisol

texts.es:
Karina Marisol Z. B. tiene 27 años de edad. Es soltera vive con el hijo  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos, Tiene 1 hija.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Karina Marisol se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir en la agricultura.

Le gusta pasar en la casa.
texts.en:
Karina Marisol Z. B. is 27 years old. She is single and she lives with her daughter in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has 1 daughter. 

The communal bank named "Jesus Loves Us" is located in the community of Los Amarillos in the city of Ventanas. This group is dedicated to short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, and rice. This is a business they have practiced for a long time. 

Karina Marisol is an agriculturist who has been harvesting corn, rice, and cocoa for the past 5 years. She purchases her products from Agripac Eicopa and she carries out her sales in the fair at Ventanas. 

She requests a loan to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers to cultivate corn and rice. The support from this loan will be a financial help for her to provide for her needs. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases, and the changing weather. Her dream is to continue working as an agriculturist.

She enjoys spending time at home.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan S. is 49 years old and her husband, Mr. Sochea Hout, is 50 years old (pictured together), and they have been married since 1980 and have five daughters. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Kan and her husband are lotus farmers. They are requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase seed and fertilizer to maintain their lotus farm.

loans.use: To use for growing lotus.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
el grupo la Amistad esta integrado por 3 mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas, todas residen en el barrio Abajo de la ciudad de Danli,  a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Karla Judith A. es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de joyas elaboradas de plata, actividad que tiene (3) tres años de haber iniciado.
Doña Karla vende su producto de manera ambulante en diferentes empresas como ser: fábricas de puros y en algunas oficinas publicas y privadas,  la mayor parte de las ventas son al crédito por lo que destina un día a la semana para cobrar.
Doña Karla cuenta con una gran clientela y esto es debido a que sus joyas son de muy buena calidad, ofrece un gran surtido y varias facilidades de pagos a sus clientes.
Doña Karla es madre soltera de una hermosa niña, la que en la actualidad es pasante de educación primaria en una escuela de la localidad,  todo esto debido al esfuerzo de doña Karla para salir adelante con su hija.

la sra. Dominga Ceneno P. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría tiene una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “La Bendición”,  cuenta con mas de un año de experiencia en la administración del mismo y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, su negocio luce muy bien surtido, sus condiciones de vida se ven favorables.
doña Minga como es mas conocida en su barrio cuenta con una gran clientela ya que su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una zona de talleres y otros negocios, por lo que hay mucho movimiento de personas.
Doña Minga convive en unión libre y han procreado 2 hijos de los cuales el mayor es totalmente independiente y el menor esta en una escuela primaria de la localidad.

la sra. Delfina Antonia C. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría, actividad en la que cuenta con mas de 5 cinco años de experiencia en la administración del mismo y su negocio opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “Roció”.
Doña Delfina cuenta con una gran clientela y esto es debido a la ubicación estratégica de su negocio.
Doña Delfina es viuda y madre de tres hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad y todos son completamente independientes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
