The “La Amistad” (Friendship) group is composed of three united, very hard working women living in the city of Danli’s Abajo neighborhood.  Following are details of each of their activities:

Mrs. Karla Judith A. is a merchant selling silver Jewelry, an activity she’s been in for three years.  She sells her items door to door in various firms like cigar factories and some private and public offices.  Most of the sales are on credit so she dedicates one day a week to collection of payments. Karla has a large customer base because her jewels are of very good quality, she has a wide selection and payment plans for her customers.  Karla is a single mother of a beautiful girl who is currently a student teacher at a local elementary school; all this thanks to Karla’s efforts to get ahead with her daughter.

Mrs. Dominga C. P. is a merchant selling primarily groceries in a grocery store she operates called “La Bendición.”  She’s been in business for over a year and it’s noteworthy that during this time she’s known how to run it well; her store is well stocked and her living conditions look promising.  Mrs. Minga, as she’s better known in the neighborhood, has a large customer base because her business is located in an area with workshops and other businesses so there is a lot of foot traffic.   She is in a common law relationship and has two children the oldest of whom is totally independent and the younger is in a local elementary school.

Mrs. Delfina Antonia C. is a merchant selling groceries in a store she runs called “Rocío.”  She has five years experience running it.  Delfina has a large customer base because of the strategic location of her store. Delfina is a widow and mother of three children who are adults and completely independent.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry, rice, beans, sugar, lard, oil, coffee, bread, cookies, snacks, soft drinks, pasta, soup, spaghetti, cereal, oatmeal, soap, sweets, candles, batteries, matches.

loans.name: Servillana

texts.en:
Servillana is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a firewood sales business. She lives in Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,500. Servillana is borrowing PHP 10,000 to so that she could stock up on more firewood to sell.  This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Servillana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

The accompanying photo shows Servillana posing beside a stack of firewood that she sells.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a married woman who lives in the island of Palawan. She earns her living by selling dried fish and providing tricycle transport service. Her husband Martin, who is 60 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 12 children who are between 13 and 39 years old. 

Demetria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Demetria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to buy more stock of dried fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and expansion of her business. Demetria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon is married to Mr. Chhem. They have three children, all of whom study at a local public school and assist with their parents’ businesses. She is a Khmer cake seller and a chicken breeder, while her husband is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land. On his land, he grows rice, some of which he sells to local customers, and the rest of which is used to feed their family.

Mrs. Mon would like to start a new business, but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, Mrs. Mon is applying for a loan in the amount of $325 to buy five piglets and pig feed, and the remaining balance of the loan proceeds would be used to build a pigpen.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed and to build a pigpen

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman, with one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She has operated a clothes-selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are the neighboring community members. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she is requesting, Joan wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans so she can improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Alicia  es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Azucenas” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Alicia  trabaja desD. hace  10 años en la venta D. Locería es decir platos D. material D. loza, tasas, también venD. tinas  D.  plástico, este negocio surge con la necesidad D. obtener mejores ingresos ya que ella deseaba darle una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos y sobretodo una buena educación, y que sus hijos tengan lo que ella nunca pudo tener, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos van a colegios privado,  ha construido su casa hasta el segundo piso, se ha comprado muebles, escritorio, y sobre todo su familia tiene una mejor calidad D. vida. Alicia  nos cuenta que en el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda propia y no pagar alquiler. Sabemos que Alicia cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Alicia has a live-in partner and 4 children. She is currently a member of the communal bank “Las Azucenas” ["The Lilies"], which consists of 10 members who dedicate themselves to various business activities. Alicia has worked for 10 years selling chinaware, that is, ceramic plates and cups. She also sells plastic basins. This business arose from the need to obtain a better income, since she wanted to proviD. a better quality of life for her children, and above all, a good education. She also wanted her children to have what she was never able to have. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has achieved a better income level, and her children go to private schools. She has built her house up to the second floor, and she has bought furniture and a desk. Above all, her family has a better quality of life. Alicia reports that in the future she would like to have her own store and not pay rent. It seems clear that Alicia will achieve her goals with hard work and effort, and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Marie Gay Rose

texts.en:
Marie Gay Rose Reyes is married and 43 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells different products. She has been managing this business for almost six years now and generates an income per month of 3,500 PHP. She utilizes her income for their daily expenditures.

Marie Gay Rose Reyes is requesting a loan of 18,000 to purchase stock of products such as soft drinks, toothpaste and condiments.

In the future, Marie Gay Rose Reyes hopes that her business will expand in order to earn a bigger income.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, toothpaste and condiments

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 48 years old, married and has two children. She lives with ten family members, who four of them work.
Since 2000, Nidal has had a shop where she sells women’s clothing, accessories and cosmetics. She has long experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in her area. She is requesting a $2900 loan to renovate and to have a larger store. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate and  to have a larger store.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
El señor Policárpico, vive en Estado de Chiapas, el es casado y a su responsabilidad y tiene  cuatro hijos que a un está  su responsabilidad  y son: pascual  de y trece años, Manuel de nueve años, Julio Cesar de  siete años y la más pequeña es Mercedes Alejandra de un año y seis meses.

    El  se dedica a la compra de mantas para luego bordarla y venderlas  en las comunidades  cercas  de su localidad y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de hijos y mas mantas ya que comenta que en unos meses el precio a aumenta y el necesita tener lo suficiente dinero para seguir con su trabajo.

   Lo que él lo motivo es que él desde muy joven aprendió con su mama pero por falta de economía no podía tener  su propia mantas para elabóralo el propio y por ese  motivo dejo de hacerlo y hace unos años fue que comenzó de nuevo y comenta que le va bien.

    Lo que él desea  es tener   un ingresos  más grande para así tener su actividad más grande así poder agrandar su actividad que es con lo que se apoya para solventar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Mr. Policarpio lives in the state of Chiapas.  He is married and responsible for four children: Pascual, 13, Manuel, 9, Julio Cesar, 7 and the youngest, Mercedes Alejandra, 18 months.

He buys blanks which he later embroiders and sells in nearby communities.  He is requesting a loan to buy thread and blankets since prices will be going up in a few months.  He needs the money to continue working.

When he was young his mother taught him how to embroider, but he could not afford to buy the blankets and establish himself independently so had to quit.  A few years ago he started up again and says it is going well for him.

His desire is to expand business and make more income to help cover expenses.

loans.use: To buy blankets for embroidery.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La señora Irma cuenta con su negocio de renta de equipo de computo en su propio domicilio denominado “Cyber La Neta Net” desde hace 4 años, ofreciendo el servicio a Estudiantes, Trabajadores, y como centro de entretenimiento a jóvenes y mas, aparte de la renta tiene internet, escáner, copias, impresiones de blanco-negro y a color. Este servicio de renta que ella ofrece  lo mantiene a un bajo precio de acuerdo a la economía de la clientela, por lo que ella solicita un préstamo para comprar otro equipo de computo ya que con los que tiene alguna gente se queda esperado hasta que se desocupado por tal motivo no quiere perder clientes.
texts.en: Irma runs an internet cafe called "Cyber La Neta Net" from her home, and has been doing this for 4 years. She offers her service to students, workers, and to young people as an entertainment center. In addition to renting time on her computers, she has internet, a scanner, copiers, black and white and color printers. She offers this service at a low price because of the economic status of her customers, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy more computer equipment as she has had some customers who've had to wait to use her equipment and she doesn't want to loose potential customers.

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es: Olga Isabel tiene 43 años, sus propósitos son superarse en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio ya que es lo que mas importante para seguir generando a su familia el sustento diario. Su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de costura, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para limpiar, realizar las compras y empezar las diferentes prendas de vestir que tiene pendiente. Hace más de  8 años, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo es que decide establecer un pequeño negocio al principio no poseía la experiencia necesaria para con este negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo la habilidad para hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento es para hilos, tijeras, telas, botones, encajes, bordados, zipper y aceite para engrasar su máquina.
texts.en: Olga Isabel is 43 years old.  Her goal is to do well in life in order to get ahead in her business as it is extremely important in enabling her to continue supporting her family.  Olga's business is providing a dressmaking service.  She has to get up early in order to clean, do her shopping and start making the different clothes that she has pending.  She started this business more than eight years ago because she needed work.  She decided to set up a small business.  At first, she didn't have the experience she needed to run this business but, over time, she acquired the skill of talking to her customers.  She will use this loan to buy threads, scissors, fabric, buttons, lace, embroidered fabric, zippers and oil for oiling her sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors, fabric, buttons, lace, embroidered fabric, zippers and oil for her sewing machine

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 48 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. The oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is 12. Julita's husband is a fisherman.

Julita has had a sari sari store business for 10 years. She sells items like canned sardines and tuna, chips, soft drinks and eggs to people in her community. Julita also bakes bread that she sells at her store. Each month, Julita earns about 9000 PHP from her business.

Julita is requesting a loan of 30000 PHP to buy flour, sugar and more items to sell such as eggs, canned goods and soap. Julita hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and more items like eggs, canned goods and soap to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more electronics to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has two children, aged 11 and 8 years; they are in school. He has two dependents who live with him because they are in school. 

In 2004, Mohamed established his used shoe business. He began his business because he saw it to be lucrative and a way to actualize his dream of independence. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leone leone (LE) every month from this business. 

Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more used shoes. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 LE. In the future, Mohamed plans to establish a larger shop and to become a supplier. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes.

loans.name: Nemanyara

texts.en:
Nemanyara is 33 years old and married with two children. She is a farmer and has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years. Her farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for growing wheat and maize.

She learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by the KADET staff. She has been loaned KES 30,000. This is her second loan, which she is planning to use to buy farm supplies like wheat seeds, maize seeds and fertilizer. 

With the anticipated profit from this loan, she plans to build a new house and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to see her business grow and her children prosper in life.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds, maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Fatou Barro

texts.fr: Commercante depuis plus de 5 ans, elle vend des tissus, draps et maillots.. Habitant dans une région proche de la capitale du Sénégal, cette commercante a besoin de ce crédit pour augmenter son chiffre d'affaires afin d'acheter des marchandises destinée a la revente. Lutilité de ce crédit lui permettrait aussi d'avoir du profits pour subvenir a ces besoins et la réalition de son projet d'ouverture d'une cantine pour étre fixe et avoir plus de confort dans la vente et étre visible.
texts.en: Fatou has been a storekeeper for the last five years, selling cloth, sheets and bathing suits. She lives in a region near the capital of Senegal, and is asking for a loan in order to increase the number of transactions she undertakes and thus purchase more merchandise to sell. This loan will also allow her to receive profits that, in addition to covering her daily expenses, will allow her to realize her dream: opening a fixed cafeteria that would also be a place from which she could sell her products with greater visibility and comfort.

loans.use: sell cloth, sheets and bathing suits

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia D. banco comunal San Fernando II, D. Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos.
Son cuatro años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de verduras de estación.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles  comprará: 2 sacos de choclos,  2 bandejas de plásticos, 2 paquetes de bolsas, 2 metros de plásticos.
Estos días está comprando choclos en mazorcas y lo está vendiendo desgranado para hacer humitas (dulce peruano), este negocio lo realiza hasta el mediodía, por las tardes sale a comprar las verduras para el siguiente día, ella se ubica en un mercado de la zona.
Su esposo también trabaja en forma independiente, todavía tiene en su casa a sus tres hijos solteros, pero que ya no dependen de ellos, todos trabajan, espera seguir trabajando con los prestamos de Manuela Ramos y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank San Fernando II, in the district of Calleria, department of Vcayali. She is 56 yeras old, married and has 6 children.

She has been a member of the communal bank Manuela Ramos for 4 years. She sells seasonal vegetables. With this new loan of 1700 soles she will buy: 2 bags of corn, 2 plastic trays, 2 packages of bags, and 2 meters of plastic.

These days she buys corn on the cob and she removes the husks in order to make humitas (humitas are smaller than tamales and are made with sweet ingredients instead of meat and are wrapped in corn husks.)

She takes care of this business until noon, and she spends the afternoon buying vegetables for the next day in a market place.

Her husband is also an independent worker. She has three single adult age children living with her who no longer depend on her. They all work. She is looking forward to obtaining a loan from Manuela Ramos and increasing her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of corn, 2 plastic trays, and other items

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a seamstress who uses her sewing and embroidery skills for the benefit of her family. She earns a reasonable income every month that allows her to pay the school fees of her three children who are studying in different classes. Her youngest daughter is only one year old. 

Her husband operates a grocery store in the market. He offers his customers different grocery items like spices, soaps, and lentils at reasonable rates. Abida has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva partner, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more groceries for his store, which will enable him to offer multiple products to his clients and fulfill their needs on time. 

Abida is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and that he will be able to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Julio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos onde todos frequentam a Escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Vive no Distrito de Boane provincia de Maputo ha mais de 10 anos, é militar ha 27 anos e recebe uma pensão de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a obra da sua casa (cimento, barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.600.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, todos para a sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Julio was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of three children, all of whom are in school. He completed school through the 6th grade himself, but wasn't able to continue out of financial constraints. He lives in his own home with his family, which he supports.

He has lived in the Boane district of Maputo Province for more than 10 years and has been in the military for 27 years, receiving a monthly salary of 7,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais], which goes to his household expenses and also some savings in his personal bank account.    

He has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be his sixth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which he plans to buy construction materials for his house (bricks, metal, cement, etc.). His prior loans were in the amount of 5,600, 8,000, 10,000, 15,000, and 20,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais], all of which were for this work. He plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to finish his home and provide a more comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house (bricks, metal, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is widowed and has three children. She is 66 years old, residing in Poblacion Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. 

Florita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting vegetables like squash for sale. She has had this type of business for more than five years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. Florita has been a member of GDMPC for almost two years and it's her third loan. Florita is hoping that her business will help provide for her family's daily needs and for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del centro poblado de Chinumani, distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  35  años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  La señora estudio educación primaria.

Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, venta de cosméticos, también vende animales menores como chanchos y gallinas, trabaja desde  hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará una docena de  ropones para niños, cubre camas, polares, sabanas y cosméticos.  Nos cuenta que su mercadería la vende en la ciudad de Arequipa.  Su esposo trabaja como albañil.

La señora desea mejorar y engrandar su negocio para conseguir más ingresos.
texts.en: Marisol is an associate of the Communal Bank "Santa Barbara" located in the village of Chinumani, in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno.  She is 35 years old, married, and has four children.  She studied elementary education.  She works selling clothes and cosmetics.  She also sells small animals like pigs and hens.  She has worked for four years with the Manuela Ramos movement.  With this new loan of S/. 2,000.00 (Peruvian Soles), she will buy a dozen christening gowns for kids, bed spreads, jackets, sheets and cosmetics.  She tells us that she sells her products in the city of Arequipa.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  She hopes to improve and to grow her business to get more income.

loans.use: to buy a dozen christening gowns for kids, bed spreads, jackets, sheets and cosmetics.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with three children. Two of her children are enrolled in school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a mason who contributes to the family's basic needs. Khadija owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Khadija has operated a poultry selling business for the past three years. Her potential clients are café and butcher owners. She faces a major challenge which is competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase chicken feed for her chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed for her chicks.

loans.name: Idibek

texts.ru: Более 25 лет Идибек занимается купле- продажей бычков и имеет богатый опыт. Он покупает скот на центральном рынке, а потом продает на местном рынке. Данный бизнес он начал для того чтобы создать своим детям хорошие условия. Идибек хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль для улучшения благосостояния семьи. Идибек запрашивает займ для покупки скота и корма для них. Он надеется на вашу помощь, который позволит ему осуществить его мечту.
texts.en: Idibek has been involved in buying and selling bulls for over 25 years and has a rich experience in this field.  He buys livestock at the central market and then sells it at a local market.  He started this business so that he could provide good conditions for his children.  Idibek wants to expand his business and make a good profit to improve his family's welfare.  Idibek is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock and fodder for it.  He hopes to get your help, which will allow him to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder for it

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel is a 40-year-old, married woman with six children; all of them attend school. For 4 years, Nyiel has run a hotel in Bor, South Sudan.

Nyiel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
La señora Lucina tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Luciano, tienen hijos pequeños y viven en su propia casa que esta situada en de la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Lucina se dedica desde hace tiempo a realizar trabajos de jardinería, tiene mucha clientela de su barrio y de los demás barrios de la ciudad, siempre se le contrata porque realiza buen trabajo y es conocida en la zona. Comenta que su esposo es asalariado, trabaja en la Municipalidad de Encarnacion por lo tanto también aporta ingresos al hogar, además que en su tiempo libre ayuda a su esposa en el trabajo de jardinería. Gracias a que ambos son personas trabajadoras ellos pueden mantener su hogar, educar a sus hijos y cubrir todos los gastos que requiere la casa.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de fertilizantes, corta pastos y demás insumos necesarios de jardinería.
texts.en:
Lucina, 37, has been married to Luciano for a long time and they have two small children; they live in their own home located in the city of Encarnación.

Lucina has been providing gardening services for quite some time.  She has quite a few customers in her neighborhood and in other neighborhoods in the city.  She gets hired always because she does good work and is well known in the zone.  She comments that her husband is a salaried employee working for the City of Encarnación so he too contributes to household income.  Besides, in his free time he helps his wife with the gardening.  Thanks to their both being workers, they are able to support their household, provide schooling for their children and cover all the required household expenses.

She asks the Fundación and Kiva for help to buy fertilizer, lawn mowers and other needed gardening supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and lawn mowers.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en: Harun is a 45 year old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be quiet and likes sharing ideas. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, blue band (margarine), stationery etc. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a commercial area within a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sodas and paper bags. Harun's business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and paper bags.

loans.name: Hervert Martin

texts.es:
Hevert tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo un paisaje muy bello y flora y fauna muy hermosas,  tiene una gastronomía muy variada y por ello es una ciudad muy visitada por los turistas en todo el año. Hevert es muy trabajador, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho hacer deporte, en especial le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Cau Cau de Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial.

Día a día Hevert trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de artefactos, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable en atención a los clientes y porque es responsable en su trabajo.

Hevert está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como planchas, ollas arroceras, licuadoras, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así el seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y tener un local propio para su negocio”.

loans.use: Para compra de mercaderia (planchas, ollas arroceras, licuadoras, entre otros)

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia Irene pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Irene tiene 26 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fábrica  de ladrillos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Irene's a member of Las Hormiguitas Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Irene, 26, lives with her companion and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her brick-factory business.  She has had the business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to her daily effort.  Irene's a responsible and persevering person, which is how she gets her family ahead.

Irene's requesting the loan to buy bricks for her business.

She's grateful for the loan granted and promises to make the agreed-upon payments.

loans.use: to buy bricks

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam's living standards have improved a lot since her previous loan. She is making greater profits from her business, which she appreciates a lot. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 15,000 KES, Mariam will purchase khangas (women's wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.use: to purchase khangas (women's wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Domnic

texts.en:
When you hear Domnic referring to the different breeds of dairy cows one would mistake him for a dairy animal expert. Domnic, from Nandihills, a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer in his locality. He has a wife and together they live on a small piece of land. Traditionally, his primary source of income has been eggs, crops, a personal business, and he has been practicing farming for the past 42 years. 

Having done farming for such a long time he has gained so much experience that he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. Domnic is respectfully seeking for a loan to buy a quality breed dairy cow. He has planted so many trees on his farm that food for the cattle will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge, because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. 

Through the loan, Domnic will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of his farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer. Domnic has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, are there to make his dream come true. 

Domnic chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Domnic underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season he learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Through accumulated profits Domnic plans to permanently improve his living conditions, and to secure the future of his school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. 

He plans that through increased income, he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester in the future, and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed dairy cow

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Mothercare Hair Salon is a beauty care centre in the community of Christian Village. The village is unique as it is located by the largest University in Ghana, Legon. Therefore most of the clients to Mothercare are students who avoid mediocrity when getting their hair done. To this effect the owner of the shop have kept faith with the training program of Kraban's TEACH lending program. She has her unique business plan which includes services of pedicure and manicure for the clients. She requires a loan of $1,150 to purchase 4 hairdryers to expand her operations.

loans.use: Working Capital to purchase 4 Hairdyers

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Mr. César V. works making sheepskin jackets, vests and jackets, according to the season (winter or summer). Like many Bolivian microentrepreneurs he markets his products in various cities and rural zones outside La Paz. His clothes-making workshop is located on Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz Avenue in the city of La Paz, where he lives. He is 52 years old and has been self-employed for more than 20 years. He has 3 sons. His wife assists him in the manufacture, distribution and sale of his products. With this work César creates employment directly and indirectly, that is to say, he has 2 employees he pays by the piece, and his children work in cutting the cloth and making clothing. His sells his products by the dozen; they reach the public through small distributors (indirect employment).

This is the tenth time that César has come to Impro for a loan. His case history in the institution describes him as "client 1": excellent fulfillment of his obligation and the repayment of his loan. The loan for which he is currently applying would be used in the purchase of cloth, closures, thread and other raw materials for the tailoring business. His work and previous credit history with Impro allows him access to this loan, since he has work experience which will generate the earnings with which to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Cesar V., se dedica a la confección de chamarras, chalecos, parcas de acuerdo a la estación que se tenga (Verano – Invierno), como muchos pequeños microempresarios bolivianos comercializa su producto en varias otras ciudades y zonas rurales fuera de La Paz. Su taller de confección se halla ubicado en la Avenida Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz de la ciudad de La Paz, lugar donde también vive. El tiene 52 años y trabaja por cuenta propia hace mas de 20 años, tiene 3 hijas y su esposa es ayudante de confección y distribución y ventas.

Cesar con esta actividad genera fuentes de empleo directo e indirecto, es decir tiene 2 trabajadores a destajo y además sus hijas también trabajan en corte y confección. Sus ventas son por docena y llegan al público a través de comerciantes minoristas (empleo indirecto). Esta es la 10ma vez que recurre a Impro para obtener un crédito.Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado a la compra de tela, cierres, hilo y otros insumos propios de su actividad. Su trabajo, y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito, ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo

loans.use: Working capital to buy materials with which to make clothing

loans.name: Gulam Farooq

texts.en: G. Farooq lives in district seven of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has 20 years of experience as a tinsmith. All of the material that he has in his shop is expired. He wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines for his shop and improve his shop to attract more clients. He wants to have a good source of income to support his family, especially his son because he is in university. Now he is very happy that he can help his family and his son.

loans.use: To buy new machines and materials for his work as a tinsmith.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Diamano Plateau association, led by Madame Fatou N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Objective: The purposes of Diamano Plateau group include the following:

to supply the market with local products to ensure adequate consumption;

to strengthen the financial power of the women who are members of the group;

to improve the living conditions of our members

to increase the income of the women; and

to participate in the development of the local community.

Activities: The group plans the following activities:

Retail trading: this consists of buying diverse products that are scarce in the local market, and reselling them in Fatick [where Ndiaye Ndiaye is located] and in the surrounding area.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

«Contexte : Le es GIE Diamano Plateau t un groupement de femmes de l’éco village de Ndiaye Ndiaye vivant dans le quartier de plateau à Ndiaye ndiaye enregistré à la date du Fevrier 2002 à la chambre de commerce de la région de Fatick sous le numéro RCN° 086/C

Objectif : Le GIE Diamano Plateau s’est fixé entre autre objectif :

de mettre sur le marché des produits locaux pour une consommation suffisante ;

Renforcer le pouvoir financier des femmes, membres du groupement ;

Améliorer les conditions de vie de ces membres,

Augmenter le revenu des femmes, et participer au développement de la localité.

Activités : Le groupement se propose des activités suivantes :

Petit commerce : il s’agit d’acheter des produits divers qui se font rares dans le marché local et les revendre à Fatick et dans les localités environnantes.»

loans.use: Bulk purchase of local products for household consumption and furnishing of a store area for retail sale

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego is 51 years old and is married to Leandra, who emigrated to Spain a few months ago in search of better employment opportunities. She is now working as a domestic maid and is sending money to her husband to help him financially. They have no children.

Diego opened his shop seventeen years ago. He himself works from his home in a well-known company in the town of Luque. From here he provides his neighbours and occasional clients with products like rice, noodles, sugar, bread, meat, milk and other staples.

He tell us that thanks to his shop’s early opening hours and the good service he offers his customers, he has been able to move forward with the business. He wants the loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise, such as tinned products, noodles, snacks, sweets, drinks etc.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Diego tiene 51 años está casado con Leandra, quien emigró hace unos meses a España en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, ella está trabajando actualmente como empleada doméstica y envía dinero a su marido para ayudarlo económicamente. No tienen hijos.

Diego abrió su despensa hace 17 años. El mismo funciona en su domicilio en una compañía muy conocida de la ciudad de Luque. De él se surten sus vecinos y ocasionales clientes de productos como arroz, fideo, azúcar, panificados, carne, leche y otros víveres.

Nos cuenta que gracias a que abre su negocio desde tempranas horas, la buena atención que el brinda a sus clientes, ha podido salir adelante. Desea el crédito para invertirlos en la compra de más mercaderías como productos enlatados, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise like tinned products, noodles, snacks, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Erni

texts.en: Erni is 22 years old and is married with a 2-year-old child. She sells clothes on credit and usually earns $20 per month. She also sells soap and cosmetics, and goes door to door to sell her products. Her husband, Manan, has no fixed income at the moment and does odd jobs. She is a member of MBK and would like a loan of $75 (IDR 500,000) to expand her business and sell a wider variety of goods. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth I. is 58 years old, married, with 7 children. She is a member of LAPO and needs a loan of US$525 to buy more oil and other provisions for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of more oil and other provisions for sale

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Roda S.. She is married with five children ages 1, 10, 12, 15, and 18. In 2002 Roda established a kiosk selling snacks and fast food, and now requires a loan of $350 in order to purchase ingredients and equipment. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and stock for her snacks and fast food kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing business

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette has a dairy farm and piggery and employs five full time workers. Rosette has run the business for five years and currently owns five Friesian cows and 20 pigs.

She is 38 years old and a single mother with six children ranging in age from 8 to 17. All her children are in school and her eldest child hopes to become a lawyer.

Rosette’s hope for her business is to increase the number of cows in order to reduce costs so that everyone in her community can have more affordable milk.

loans.use: Rosette is seeking a loan to purchase another cow as well as some additional feed for her cows and pigs.

loans.name: Ni Putu Karyawati

texts.id:
Every 9 am Karyawati feeds the 2 pigs being raised. This work has become daily routine after completing cooking in the kitchen. The bamboo pen owned behind the house has become a place for the pigs being raised. This effort greatly assists in meeting the family’s expenses. Karyawati has 2 children under her responsibility. Her enthusiasm for this effort eases her husband because it lightens his burden as the head of the household. Income, which was realized, is very satisfying, in 6 months 2 piglets will generate Rp. 800.000.- (about USD90) net. This income is used for paying the children’s education and is very supportive of their life.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap pukul 09:00 wita Karyawati memberi makan 2 ekor babi peliharaannya.Pekerjaan ini tentunya sudah menjadi rutinitas kesehariaannya setelah selesai memasak didapur. Kandang bambu yang dimiliki dibelakang rumah,sebagai tempat untuk menampung babi yang dipelihara. Usaha ini sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Karyawati memiliki dua orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungan. Semangat untuk berusaha yang dimilki membuat suaminya sangat senang karena sangat meringankan beban sebagai bapak kepala rumah tangga. Keuntungan yang sudah dirasakan sangat memuaskan.dalam 6 bulan 2 bibit babi ini bisa menghasilkan Rp.800.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya dan sangat menunjang kehidupannya.

loans.use: Purchase breeding supplies (Membeli pakan ternak)

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Adesuwa I.is 46 years of age, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells frozen foods such as chicken and turkey. She has been in business since 2005. Due to the increase in demand of products, she is requesting $875 to buy more frozen food for sales. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods for sales

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the village of Boyuk Bahmanli. Elchin is married and has 3 children. He was born in 1968. He has 5 years of experience in the taxi business. He needs a loan of $975 to buy spare parts for his tax business.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for his tax business

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.ru:
Nafisa S. lives in the Gissar district. She sells portiere fabric and has a retail outlet in the Gissar market. Her business is growing, but Nafisa wants to increase the goods turnover. She decided to obtain a loan of $600 for this purpose. The money will help her bring in new goods and attract new clients. Because Nafisa has been working in this business for 27 years, her extensive experience helps grow and lead the enterprise in the right direction. Nafisa is married and has seven children. Although, her family is large, it is very harmonious. Nafisa plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Собирчонова Нафиса жительница района Гиссар . Занимается торговлей партьерной ткани . Имеет торговую точку на рынке гиссара. Бизнес развивается , но Нафиса хочет увеличить товарооборот. Для этого она решила получить кредит в размере 2000 сомони. Это поможет завести новый товар и привлечь новых клиентов. Занимается она этим видом бизнеса уже 27 лет. Поэтому ее опыт помогает развивть деятельность в правильном направлении. Нафиса замужем и имеет семерых детей. Семья большая , но жвут они все очень дружно.Погасит кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima K. is 45  years old and married with six children. She began selling clothing in 2008. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.
Patima now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge) for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: This will be the second loan for Mrs. Sam M., who is using the funds to improve her business. She lives in Preak Daung Village in Kandal Province. She is a 68 year old widow with two children who both work as construction workers. Mrs. Sam M. is a farmer who harvests twice a year; during the rainy season she cultivates rice, and during the dry season she grows vegetables. Mrs. Sam M. now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with oxen to plow her rice field. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she will also use it to buy more rice seeds.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen to plow her rice field, and buy rice seeds

loans.name: Bolajoko

texts.en: Bolajoko is 65 years old and married to Mr. G.; together they have four children. They also have two of their grandchildren living with them. Bolajoko runs a cybercafé. She has been in this business for a long time and loves it. Bolajoko is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more computer accessories for the cybercafé. She says thank you!

loans.use: To buy computer accessories for a cybercafé

loans.name: Housni

texts.en:
Housni is a 30 year-old man who lives with his parents in the rurA. village of Rashaia in the Bekaa Valley. 

Housni is a barber and owns a salon near his home. He wishes to purchase new salon supplies such as scissors and hair care products, and also wants to paint his store. Housni has requested a loan of 1000 US Dollars from A. Majmoua for this purpose. This will be Housni’s first loan with A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new hair cutting tools and redecorate his salon

loans.name: Nusrat Maqsood Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji is a 29-year-old woman who resides in Walton in Lahore, Pakistan, where she has been living for the past 20 years. Her husband, M. A., is a butcher who runs a butcher shop in the community. He sells chicken meat. 

Nusrat baji has seven children: five daughters and two sons. Her eldest son works with his father in his butcher shop. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nusrat baji embroiders dresses on orders. She takes orders from her neighborhood and charges a fee of $4 per dress. She makes four dresses in a month. She invests part of her income in her husband’s business and uses some to meet household expenses. She has successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more chickens to expand her husband’s business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Maryam baji and Suraiya baji each want a loan to buy a digital camera for their photo studios. Majeedan baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her vegetable business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for butcher shop

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo A. Gaitán tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa particular, para poder apoyarle con los gastos del hogar; ellos tienen a su cargo una hija la cual estudia su primaria, los planes para su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la casa para brindarle mayor seguridad a su hogar ya que él por falta de financiamiento todavía no a terminado de construir. Este señor trabaja como técnico en servicios de gasolinera desde hace siete años, con la solicitud de préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y otras pequeñas reparaciones, para no mojarse en el invierno, con este préstamo será de gran beneficio lo cual lograra darles una vivienda digna y con seguridad a su familia
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo A. Gaitán is 35 years old and lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife who works as a maid in a private residence to help with the household expenses. They have a little girl in primary school. His plans for his family include improving their house to provide a secure home environment, but he is lacking funds to complete the construction. Mr. Gaitán has worked as a services technician at a gas station for seven years. With this loan he will buy construction materials to build a new roof for his house, because the current one is in bad shape, and for other small repairs, in order to stay dry through the winter. The loan will help him greatly by allowing him to provide a dignified and secure home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a new roof

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun T., 56, pictured with her husband and her children, is married and lives with her husband and four of her children in Bati district, Takeo province. She typically makes $2 a day by raising ducks and making baskets. Her husband, Meas Pich, 58, is a tractor driver and makes $5 a day. Two of their children are children and two others are employed as workers. 

Mrs. Chhoeun T. is asking for a loan of $1000 to make two investments. First, raise more ducks and second purchase bamboo to make baskets for sale.

loans.use: Raise ducks and purchase bamboo to make baskets.

loans.name: Protea Group

texts.en:
Alawi H., age 48, is married with five children, ages 21, 19, 16, 14 and 10. He also cares for his mother who is a widow. He has a fruit business and also works as a watchman in a private company. He started his business in 2007 and works daily from 10am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 30.

This will be Alawi’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy more fruit for sale. Alawi will share this loan with his loan group, Protea, which totals 20 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Alawi is 1st from right, front row.

loans.use: Increase the inventory for his fruit business

loans.name: Unidos Podemos 10 Group

texts.en:
Group 10 from the Unidos Podemos Bank of Hope is asking for their 2nd loan from Esperanza International. This group from El Seybo consists of men only.

Eusebio D. R. is their group coordinator. His small business consists of raising pigs. He has a nine-year-old child and is a single parent. He will use this loan to buy a few piglets, as well as vitamins, food, and serum to feed them and help them grow bigger. Some of the other group members also raise pigs, and others sell fruits or vegetables. Eusebio hopes his business will be profitable enough one day to allow him to repair his house. He works very hard and takes excellent care of the pigs he raises. He believes this loan will help him achieve his goal of making sure his family is healthy and living a good life.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting this group of hard working men!

loans.use: Purchase pigs, food, and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her eatery

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu has been a clothes, cosmetics and handbags seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 13 years. She belongs to Mwanzo mgumu group (group code 2026). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Each day she works at her business 12 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes, cosmetics items and handbags for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.

Tatu is 31 years old, married, and has a 14-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, cosmetics items and handbags for resale

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kim S., 55, has been selected to be leader by the other two members of the group; they are all people who live in Phnom Penh City. Mr. S. is married with two single children who are employed, and are garment workers in a factory. His wife earns a living selling fresh fish in the local market.

In the last three years, S. has become skilled in the business of building houses, and is earning approximately $3 per day. The family's living conditions are not so comfortable because their house often cracks during the rainy season. Because of the obstacle, Mr. S. would like a loan from Kiva in order to repair their old house. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

The other two borrowers are:

Mr. B., 34, who is a local building worker, and is looking for a loan to decorate his house.

Mrs. S., 39, who works as a construction worker and she applies for a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair their old house

loans.name: Mame Ndiaydiaw

texts.fr: MAME NDIAYDIAW G. EST PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES.ELLE OPERE DANS LA RESTAURATION ET CAPITALISE PLUS DE CINQ ANS D'ACTIVITE.ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET POUR AMELIORER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
MAME NDIAYDIAW G. has been recipient parent for several years. She operates a restaurant and capitalizes on her five years of work. She’s requesting this loan to improve her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant business

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee D. lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son is a student at the Mongolian University of Science and Technology and the youngest son goes to a local high school. Tsetsgee has a small business sewing. She opened her small shop in 2004 and now offers various sewing services, including alterations. Since the beginning, she has been quite successful and gained frequent loyal customers.

In the future, she would like to expand and leave a successful business for her children. She requests a loan to purchase more tailoring materials for her business and to fix the sewing shop.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and fix the sewing shop.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr: specialisee dans le domaine de la fripperie depuis 1990 ndeye F. est parent beneficiaire domiciliee a cambereneelle a toujour commercialise les habits de femmes.actuellements elle souhaiterait elargir ses ventes aux habits pour hommes.c'est ainsi que s'impose a elle la necessite d'augmenter ter son fond de roulement.elle emprunte le montant decent mille frs pour faire face a cette situation.
texts.en:
Specialized in the field of used clothing since 1990, Ndeye F. is a client parent living in Camberene. She has always been selling women’s clothing. She would like to expand her sales with men’s clothing, thus the need imposes itself upon her to augment her working capital. She is borrowing the amount of 100,000 francs to address this situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Omo

texts.en:
Omo B. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old. Omo is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Omo owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "malong" or tube skirts in the local community. Omo has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (about $62 US) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Omo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Omo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 pesos from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Omo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Omo from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Houn S. is a villager in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal province. She makes Khmer cake to sell. She is 58 years old, a widow with three children, two of whom are grocers and own a grocery store while the other is a worker in Korea.

Although Mrs. Houn S.'s family members have different careers, they still earn too little income to support their household. Thus, Mrs. Houn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding to earn more income.

loans.use: buy piglets for breeding to earn more income

loans.name: Karimberdi

texts.en:
M. Karimberdi is a hard-working 53-year-old man who has considerably improved his economic situation by growing onions and potatoes. Karimberdi grows a native variety of onion and potato and sells these at the market. Now Karimberdi’s onion crop has grown and he wants to keep the vegetables safe and fresh for some time and then sell them later when the prices for them increase. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 3,500 Somoni in order to buy nets and other necessary items in order to keep his crop safe and fresh.

Karimberdi feels happy and privileged to be the father of five children.

He is very grateful for all of your help.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy nets and other necessary items in order to keep his crop safe and fresh.

loans.name: Ramtoulaye

texts.fr: Ramatoulaye D. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 depuis l'an 2003 et y a bénéficié de 12 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle va développer un petit commerce d'arachide et de légumes, les bénéfices qu'elle réalisera lui permettront de prendre partiellement en charge la nourriture et la santé de ses enfants. Elle rembourse le prêt en une échéance de 6 mois

loans.use: Renforcer son activité

loans.name: Yoni Group

texts.en:
Here are Namina B. and Wara K.. They named their group Yoni group, named after their home village of Yoni Boma, in the Tonkolili district, northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of Le 1,300,000 to enable them increase the size and quality of their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Namina B. on the left. Namina is now age forty, married to a police officer and the two of them have five children, between the ages of eight and twenty-two. Manina sells market food – rice, palm-oil (the favorite cooking oil), “margi” (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper etc. She has been in this business for fifteen years now. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business, makes more sales and better profit, and consequently improving on her living standard.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Jekafo. Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Jekafo (cinq femmes mariées  et une célibataire) ont en moyenne  39 ans, 3 enfants et  vivent majoritairement dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles font la vente de tissus de draps, de bois de chauffe, de friperie, de cosmétique et de la restauration.
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Avec  ce prêt, elles comptent acheter,  50 kg de tissus de draps, des chaussures, 1sac de 100kg de riz,  5 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 120 sachets de caqueur, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 4 balles de friperie, et 3 cartons de cosmétiques. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. Elles vendent,  à domicile, dans les marchés  sur place  et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager ou avoir leur point de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a widow with three children aged 14, 7 and 4. Apart from her children, Zainab has one dependent.

Zainab rents a store at a strategic location in the eastern part of Freetown where ships berth. She sells rice and pillet (pig feed) and has built up her business for about eight years.

As Zainab is the one fending for the family, she is hoping to use the loan to buy more rice and pillet. She intends to use part of the proceeds to run the home and to rent a much bigger shop space.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and feed

loans.name: Augustus

texts.en:
Augustus is a 39 year old businessman. He runs a butchery in Miu area of Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. He has been operating this business for 2 years. He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 20,000, with which he will purchase goats for slaughter in his butchery. Augustus is the father of three children; consequently, hopes to grow his business into a big restaurant and have multiple outlets in order to be able to provide for them. He describes himself as faithful and driven.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing them with financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company. This will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: purchasing goats for slaughter

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Marilú, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos”, Distrito D. Zapatero, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre D. 03 hijos; 02 que aun dependen D. ella y están estudiando.

Marilú, lleva 08 años dedicándose a la venta D. Abarrotes, ya que ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar y por la falta D. trabajo, con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00, decidió implementar su pequeño negocio, obteniendo muy buenos resultados, desD. un inicio por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos, amigos y moradores D. la ciudad. En sus ratos libres, también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. las diferentes líneas como: Avon, Esika, CyZone y nos cuenta, que también le va muy bien, en este tipo D. actividad.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra, D. productos D. belleza, así complementar mas su negocio.

Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marilú belongs to the Manuela Ramos Community Bank in the District of Zapatero, Lamas Province, San Martín Department. She is married, 37 years old and the mother of 3 children, two of whom still depend on her and are students.

Marilú has been selling groceries for 8 years, due to the necessity of increasing family income and the lack of work. With her first loan of 300 new sols she decided to start her small business, obtaining very good results from the beginning, due to the quality of her products, her comfortable prices, and good customer service.

At present, she continues the same business, located in her own house. Her principal customers are her neighbors, friends, and residents of the city. Also, in her free time, she sells cosmetics of different lines, such as Avon, Esika, or CyZone, and she tells us that this business is also doing very well.

With this loan of 800 new sols she will buy more products to add to her business; including rice, sugar in kilos, crates of eggs, items for personal hygiene and home cleaning, drinks in packets, sweets and other products to satisfy her customers. Part of the money will be invested in purchasing beauty products, thus complementing her business.

Today she feels very happy about the work and service she offers and she thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping people like her who wish to work and get ahead. And she hopes that they will continue for a long time and aid many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES IN ORDER TO AUGMENT HER PRODUCTS FOR SALE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Locks of Hair

loans.name: God Provides Group

texts.en:
These are a group of small-scale entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They formed themselves into a group they named 'God Provides' in order to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, sales and level of income will improve so that they can better support themselves and their children.

On the left in the photo is Fatmata S., the leader of this group of four. Fatmata was born in Freetown thirty years ago. She is married to a gold miner and they have two children plus one foster child. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School I, another is in JSS II, and the other is in Primary School I.

Fatmata sells rice, groundnuts, fish, palm oil, and cigarettes. She has been doing business for seven years now. With her share of the loan, she will invest in a new business, selling slippers/flip-flops. Fatmata wants to invest in this business because of the high demand for shoes in this Christmas month of festivity.

loans.use: Buy dozens of slippers/flip-flops

loans.name: Maria Hermisa

texts.en:
Maria Hermisa J. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Maria is 43 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Hermisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maria Hermisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Hermisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maria Hermisa is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Maria Hermisa from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her sari-sari retail shop

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La Srta. Veronia tiene como actividad la elaboracion y venta de empanadas tucumanas, distribuyendo las mismas por mayor, surtiendo diferentes pedidos de sus clientes, realiza esta actividad conjuntamente con su mamá Sra. Filomena, elaboran  las empanadas tucumanas en su domicilio y luego realizan la entrega a sus clientes.

Esta actividad se constituyendose en su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su madre, que viven en casa de su hijo mayor. El destino del credito para la compra de un refrigerador, un meson de panaderia, una cocina industrial y menaje de cocina.

Esta agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Veronica makes and sells beef empanadas, and distributes them wholesale. She supplies different orders from her customers, carrying out this activity together with her mother, Senora Filomena. They make the beef empanadas in their home and then later deliver them to their customers. This activity constitutes the main source of income for Veronica and her mother, who live in the home of the family's oldest son. This loan will be used to buy a refrigerator, a bakery table, an industrial oven and kitchenware. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, a bakery table, an industrial oven and kitchenware

loans.name: Meu's Group

texts.en:
This small, three-member group loan is made up of residents of Phnom Penh. Mrs. Meu P. has been selected as the group leader by the other members. Meu P. is 41 years old and earns a living by cultivating crops with her husband, Chom Mao, 43, who is also a carpenter skilled I. making furniture by hand. They currently earn an income of approximately $7 USD per day. The couple has six children, two of whom are married while the others are single. One of their daughters provides her income as a garment worker to feed the family. Meu P. will use her loan to buy more fertilizers to sustaI. her crops.
The other two members of the group are:
Siek I., age 53, who farms a rice crop. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her crop.
Siek A., age 50, who is a local farmer. She is applying for a loan to buy more supplies for her farming business.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to sustain her crops

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor P. is from the village of Maigtang, Talakag Bukidnon. He is fifty-one years old. Nestor is married and has four grown children. To make a living, Nestor owns and operates a service-based business in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing "trisikad" or a pedicab as transport services to local community members. Nestor has been engaged in his business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.
