In 2010, Nestor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This loan will be Nestor's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide his service

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old engaged man who lives in the Bekaa. He owns a truck which allows him to transport merchandise, furniture or anything else in the Lebanese territory. He doesn’t have fixed working hours - he works whenever he can, knowing that he has to support his parents. Also, he plans on getting married soon so he has to save some money for his wedding expenses and for his house.

Mahmoud’s clients can be anyone, but mainly he works independently for either traders, or individuals. He decided on doing his job because, with this actuA. work, he has increased his income and is free and subject to his own timing. His clients like working with him because he is trustful and also because of his punctuality.

Mahmoud is capable of doing his work because of his self-confidence and his strong will. For the second time, Mahmoud plans on taking a loan in order to do some maintenance work on his truck.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his truck

loans.name: Marlin Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Marlin Del Socorro, por lo que su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa usada. Por lo que siempre busca la manera de mejorar sus ingresos,  pues es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ella ha enfrentado ciertos problemas como es de salud, por lo que ha salido adelante con este negocio. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. El sueño, siempre ha sido tener una tienda grande en su casa, que pueda ofertar todos sus productos al público. Piensa algún día tener hijos y poder mantenerlos con el sudor de su frente, a través de las ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlin Del Socorro buys and sells used clothes. She is always looking for a way to improve her earnings; it is her main source of income. She has encountered some problems like with her health, which is why she has moved forward in this business. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy raw materials. Her dream has always been to have a large store in her house where she could offer all of her products to the public. She plans to have children one day. She plans on being able to support them by the sweat on her brow via the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bernardo Renee

texts.es:
El señor Bernardo Renee D. Díaz es soltera, tiene dos hijos ninguno a su cargo vive en el barrio el calvario junto a su familia, es trabajador de la alcaldía hace 5 años desempeñándose como Jefe de Seguridad general.
El señor Bernardo D. tiene un año y medio de trabajar con créditos demostrando ser una persona honesta y responsable en cuanto a obligaciones. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar materiales personales y medicina.
texts.en:
Bernardo Renee Delgao Díaz is single and has two children, neither of whom is under his care. He lives with his family in the El Calvario neighborhood. He has been working at City Hall as Security Chief for five years. Bernardo has been receiving loans for a year and a half, showing himself to be a person of honesty and responsibility with respect to his payments. He plans to use this loan to buy personal items and medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy personal items for his home.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma F.'s main source of income comes from selling wood and wood-related products in her community. She owns and operates a coco lumber business. She is 40 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Matugas Bajo, Jimenez. Lerma has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Lerma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lerma has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Eliseo, él  tiene 35 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad, Nuestro socio trabaja sus terrenos de cultivo, el socio también hace trabajos de construcción, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su caja personal de trabajo.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Pacaha Illariy communal bank. He lives in the community of Llullucha, Ocongate district, in the Quispicanchis province of the department of Cusco. Our member's name is Mr. Eliseo. He is 35 years old and married with two children, who are ages 10 and 5. He works cultivating farmlands, and he also works in construction. He is requesting a loan to buy tools for his toolbox. Eliseo is thankful and appreciative of the support offered through this medium and he is committed to achieving timely repayment of his debt.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his toolbox.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 45 year-old box manufacturer. She makes boxes to sell to clients on a busy highway near a junction leading to the market place. She has been in this business for 16 years. Hellen is married and has 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls. The primary business challenge she faces is competition.

Hellen plans to use the 50,000 KES loan to purchase materials to make boxes. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

In the future, Hellen hopes to have a good family where all her children will be educated and also that she will have enough money to take care of her family. In 5 years, she dreams that she will own big stalls in several places where she will have many customers and boost her income.

Hellen describes herself as hardworking, industrious, generous, ambitious, God-fearing, and intelligent.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make boxes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year old married man. He started working in the agriculture business 15 years ago.
He is now requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase needed goods for his business.

loans.use: To purchase needed agricultural goods

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella F. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Stella is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Stella owns & operates a business venture butchering and selling meat in the market. The main source of income for the business comes from butchering & selling pork in the market. Stella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Stella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Stella is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Stella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 70 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 10 children who are all adults. His youngest child is still in college.

Michael has been operating his mixed farm for over 30 years and has employed two casual labourers. He sells his chickens, milk, and mangoes to the local market. He also depends on the income from his pension to cater for the family's needs.

His biggest challenge was when his incubating machine broke down due to power failure leading to the loss of eggs.

Michael has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.45,000 to expand his poultry project by purchasing eggs for incubation and chicken feed. He says that this will enable him increase his income from the sale of chickens and raise enough college fees without straining.

He is happy doing business with Juhudi, especially because the loan terms are favourabe.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun R. is an older woman and is the mother of three teenage children. She is a good housewife who arranges a daily routine and takes care of the kids. The family's livelihood is contributed to by Chhun R.’s husband who works in the MinistR. of the Interior. Another source of family income comes from Chhun R.’s daughter who works as a waitress in a restaurant located in the middle of Phnom Penh city. 

Chhun R. is taking out her first loan to repair/decorate her old house, where she plans to operate a small business in the future. (Mrs. Chhun R.’s daughter is pictured.)

loans.use: To repair/re-decorate her old house, where she plans to operate a small business in the future

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos dependientes. Vive ujunto a su familia en el caserío Lagunas, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, este distrito está conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre sí, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace cinco años, el cría aves de corral en diversos ambientes ubicados en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente trabaja como auxiliar de servicios en un centro educativo de su localidad. Con estas actividades Juan Carlos solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

Juan Carlos desea adquirir mas animales para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, asimismo planea acondicionar mas corrales y comprar alimento balanceado para garantizar un buen desarrollo de los mismos, como no tiene capital para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Juan Carlos es un padre trabajador y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos y amigos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 32 years old. He is married with two children. He lives with his family in the shanty town of Lagunas in the rural zone of Mórrope. The area is made of a lot of shanty towns with large distances between them. The area is part of the Lambayeque province and is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Juan Carlos has been raising and selling animals for five years. He raises farmyard birds in various areas behind his home. After the birds have reached a certain level of physical development, Juan Carlos sells them to businessmen who always visit the area where he lives. Additionally, he works as a service assistant in a local school. With these jobs, Juan Carlos supports his family's spending. Juan Carlos wants to get more animals to increase his business of raising and selling them, so he plans to build more corrals and buy animal food to guarantee the animals' proper development. Since he doesn't have the money to realize these plans, he has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will help him attain his goals. Juan Carlos is a hard-working responsible father. His biggest desire in life is to continue working so he can provide his family a better quality of live. He is very well known in the area where he lives and is well-liked among neighbors and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Kokoiyian Ene

texts.en:
Kokoiyian Ene K. is 54 years old and she supports seven members of her family.  She has raised cattle for the last eight years. Her target is to buy young heifers during dry season when they are not very costly, then place them on her farm, which she has fenced purposely for grazing. After the rainy season when the bulls have fattened, she sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

She learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to use to buy five more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit, she intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

Her dream is that she will become a large- scale cattle farmer. 

She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To buy young bulls

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama B. est marié à deux femmes et père huit enfants. Il est né le 31 Décembre 1972 à Zanso, un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo - 3eme région administrative du Mali.   Il vit  à Loulouni ville.
Il mène des activités commerciales depuis maintenant plusieurs 7ans. Expérimenté en raison des années dans le commerce, il le fait avec assez de réussite. 
Il est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt passé a été correctement remboursé.
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 6 colis d’articles composés de : lait,sucre, huile, thé, savons, biscuits, bonbons, café, lipton, œufs de poules etc. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants et à Sikasso ville.
Il vend  dans son kiosque à Loulouni ville en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit; à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera utilisée dans les dépenses familiales.
Il envisage de faire de l’épargne pour se procurer d’un lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mr Adama B. is married to two women and has eight children. He was born on the 31st of December 1972 in Zanso, a village in the Kadiolo region, the third largest administrative region of Mali. He now lives in Loulouni town. He has been involved in his business activities for over seven years. Through his years of experience he is now a successful businessman. He is on his second loan collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association, and his previous loan was successfully repaid. He aims to use his loan to purchase six parcels composed of several items: milk, sugar, oil, tea, soap, biscuits, sweets, coffee, Lipton, chicken eggs etc. He sources his goods in Sikasso's neighbouring villages. He sells his wares from a kiosk in Loulouni town, through cash and sometimes credit sales to a customer base made up of men and women. He aims to generate an average monthly profit of 75.000FCFA some of which will be used for increasing his business funds and the rest in order to meet her family's needs. He aims to put some money aside in order to buy a plot of land to live in Sikasso town.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various goods

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en:
Gafurjon owns a retail business located in Istaravshan city. He sells clothing for kids. Gafurjon has been in this business for 5 years. He knows his clients and their tastes well and chooses the right inventory, so his business does well. Gafurjon would like to get a loan of 7500 Somoni to purchase more autumn clothing to sell. Gafurjon’s goal is to improve his business conditions – to build a nice little store at the same place where his container is located now.
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nhoel's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who live in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. All the members have selected Mrs. Nhoel S. is the group leader. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living conditions. 

Mrs. Nhoel S. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to use to grow rice to sell to support her family. Now she has a problem because it is time to grow rice in her field but she does not have rice seed and fertilizer. So, to improve her field, Mrs. Nhoel S. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer. With any remainder of this loan she is going to hire farming laborers and oxen to plow her field. She is a widow with two children who are laborers.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane W. M. is a 36-year-old salon proprietor in Shanzu Mombasa. She is single with one child and has been in this business for the last eight years and has been doing well. 

She is requesting her second loan from KADET after successfully servicing her first loan to purchase more salon appliances such as blow-drier, rollers etc. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her child. 

Jane hopes to own a big beauty parlor in the near future.

loans.use: Purchasing more salon appliances

loans.name: Nancy Judith

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nancy , ella tiene 56 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos viven con ella y estudian. Su marido es chofer. Ella es licenciada en Ciencias DE La Educación y  se desempeña como maestra en una escuela de la localidad.
 
Tiene una heladería en sociedad con una de sus hijas. Además se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja los viernes, sabados y domingos en las tardes,  en su trabajo de lunes a viernes  realiza sus ventas a sus compañeras de clases, ahora desea iniciar con un nuevo segmento de ventas quiere vender semijoyas de Romanel.
 
Este crédito es justamente para comprar semijoyas de Romanel como: cadenas, pulseras, collares, etc.
Está en el Banco Comunal  12 años y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Sus metas son seguir trabajando y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank named Maria Monserrate meets every two weeks in the district of Montecristi, a region known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for the nationally and internationally renowned artisans. It is the region from where the famous straw hats come from. 

Here we find Nancy. She is 56 years old, she is married, and she has four children. Two of her children live with her and are attending school. Her husband is a driver. She has a degree in Education Science and she works as a teacher in a local school. 

She also has an ice cream shop with one of her two daughters. She also sells Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories). She works on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays in the afternoon. She sells to her colleagues from Monday to Friday. She now endeavors to start selling a new type of product; Romanel brand semi-precious jewelry.

This loan is to purchase Romanel jewelry, including: neck chains, bracelets, necklaces etc. 

She has been a member of her community bank for the past 12 years and she enjoys taking part for the benefits the organization provides. Her goal is to keep working and to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase Romanel brand beauty products.

loans.name: Hugo Cesar

texts.es:
Hugo de 56 años, con dedicación, esfuerzo y la liquidación que le dieron en el trabajo cuando lo retiraron por recorte de personal pudo comprar víveres de primera necesidad para ubicar la tienda que siempre quiso.  

Viviendo en una zona llamada Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas) ha sido conocido como el que tiene la tienda del barrio. Trabaja con ayuda de su hijo desde la mañana hasta el anochecer. La tienda la tiene ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa vende todo tipo de víveres como arroz, granos, bebidas, enlatados etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, bebidas para surtir su tienda. En el futuro quiere surtir su tienda con mercadería y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Hugo is 56 years old.  Through commitment, hard work and the severance pay which they gave him from his previous job when they laid him off due to staff cutbacks, he has been able to buy basic groceries and set up the store that he has always wanted.

Hugo lives in an area called Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads whose houses are to be found in the mountains).  He has become known as the man who owns the neighborhood store.  Hugo works, with his son's help, from morning until nightfall.  His store is located in the front of his home and he sells all kinds of foodstuffs such as rice, grains, drinks, canned goods, etc.

Hugo will use his loan to buy basic foodstuffs such as rice, oil and drinks to stock his store.  In the future, he would like to stock his store with merchandise and finish building his home.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn J. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old. Emelyn is married and has three children, aged 17, 13 and 12. To make a living, Emelyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Emelyn also grows pigs for fattening. She sells the pigs to the market.

Emelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de llamadas telefónicas en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles del Cusco, la socia también tiene un carro que su esposo trabaja haciendo servicio de taxi, la socia quiere tener un negocio de locutorio de llamadas  telefónicas. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.                        

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" ["Hard-working Mothers"]. The bank is in the district, province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Valentina; she is 38, lives with her partner, and has 2 children. She shares her daily chores with her telephone business. She offers a call service on different streets in Cusco. She also has a car, and her husband uses it to offer a taxi service. Valentina would like to have a telephone booth business. She is requesting this loan for maintenance for her car. 

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan for maintenance for her car

loans.name: Asif

texts.ru:
Asif A. 20 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Asif jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Asif okonchil kolledj i uje 1 qod kak imeyet magazin qde prodayot produkti. Asif  etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca , u yeqo otca bil sobstvenniy magazi Asif po nachalu pomoqal svoyemu otcu po rabote no potom reshil otkrit svoy magazin. 
Asif prodayet pishiviye produkti, no seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya pereprodaji tak kak na eto yest spros sredi pokupateley.
texts.en: Asif A. is twenty years old. He is not married and does not have children. Asif lives in the city of Baku together with his family. Asif has graduated from college and has owned a store where he sells food for a year now. He learned this business from his father who also had own store. At first Asif helped his father in his business and then decided to open his own store. He sells food and now needs 2000 AZN to buy cleaning products for resale because there's a demand for these products from his customers.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products for resale

loans.name: Magaly  Yanet

texts.es:
Magali es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad. Vive con su esposo e hijo de 3 años de edad en el caserío El Verde en el distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Cuenta con su terreno propio a pocos metros de su casa donde se dedica a la producción agrícola de cereales y maíz amarillo. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Después de cosechar sus productos, vende su cosecha a algunos negociantes de la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga del sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Desea invertir su préstamo en la siembra, el manejo y la cosecha de su terreno para ampliar la producción de su maíz amarillo. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.

Magali es muy trabajadora y encargada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Magali is a 29 year old mother who lives with her husband and three year old son in the village of El Verde in the District of Pítipo. This farming district is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Magali has her own land a few meters from her house where she grows grain and yellow corn. She has more than ten years of experience in this business. After harvesting her products, she sells some of them to local traders. The earnings she generates from her business activities are used to sustain the family finances.

Magali wants to invest her loan in the planting, management, and harvesting on her land so that she can expand her production of yellow corn. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Magali is a hard worker who manages her family well. The people she knows have great respect for her.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting yellow corn

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan. The members hope to increase their income to improve their familys' standard of living through these loans. Pen, who was born in 1965, is the group leader selected by the other members. 

Her husband, Phann, is an iron welder who is able to earn a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children who are all students.

Pen earns her living by tailoring at home. In order to support this business, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase a sewing machine for supporting her business activities.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for supporting her business activities.

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie G. is from the village of Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 23 years old. Charie is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Charie owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing photography services to local community members. Charie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Charie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Charie is requesting a new loan of 14,800 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Charie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L., 33, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Angelito L., a bus driver, and is the mother of a young boy now at preparatory school. By the grace of God, Gemma has managed to support her child's schooling and she is now working hard to be able to send him all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Gemma, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

Gemma maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands such as Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer, who has a one-month-to-pay credit. Since dealers’ cost prices are lower than those in the catalog, they earn profit on the price difference. Gemma's regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, Gemma is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Gemma dreams of being able to give her child a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. 

As a CCT community partner, Gemma faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics and other items ordered in advance by her customers

loans.name: Marling Odily

texts.es: Marling Odily se dedica a la venta de productos veterinarios, hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio. Ella ha puesto mucho empeño por mejorar su negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Ella trabaja de manera independiente, por lo que siempre le ha gustado interactuar con sus clientes ya que ellos les piden consejos con los diferentes medicamentos que necesitan para sus mascotas. Este crédito es para la compra alimentos, pastillas, medicamentos, tratamientos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Marling Odily sells veterinary products. She has had this business for 2 years. She has put a lot of hard work into improving her business and it is not the first time that she has taken a loan for her business. She works independently and she has always enjoyed interacting with her clients. They ask for advice with the various medications that they need for their pets. This loan will be used to purchase pet food, tablets, medicines, treatments, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase pet food, tablets, medicines, treatments and other products

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es: Adrian O.  pertenece a la alcancía comunal Ebenezer conformada hace mas de 5 años y está integrada por 8 participantes, los cuales  son todos vecinos y radican en el distrito del Agustino, un grupo con características de éxito y mucha perseverancia en el desempeño de sus negocios. Muestra de ello es el señor Adrian O. de 41 años de edad conviviente y  con dos pequeños hijos a su cuidado. El  diariamente se dedica a la reparación de instrumentos musicales que realiza en su casa ya que fue ahí donde instalo un pequeño taller, posterior a eso luego de repáralos los vende a personas que ya le avían hecho pedidos con anticipación. Con el presente préstamo lo invertirá en compra de materiales para reparación de instrumentos musicales. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar más su negocio con la compra de instrumentos musicales nuevos para su posterior venta.
texts.en: Adrian O. is a member of the communal bank named "Ebenezer". It was formed more than 5 years ago and it is made up of 8 members, all of whom are neighbors in the district of Agustino. The group is excited and perseverant with their individual businesses. The representative is Adrian O. who is 41 years old, married common-law, and he has two young children in his care. He works daily in the repair of musical instruments from his home, location where he has installed his shop. After repairing the instruments he sells them to his clients that had placed orders in advance. He will invest the current loan with the purchase of materials for the repair of musical instruments. In the future he would like to expand his business with the purchase of new musical instruments for later resale.

loans.use: to purchase materials used in the repair of musical instruments.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en: Chuluunbaatar G. is 32 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school. They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works at a gas station as a petrol dispenser. Chuluunbaatar works at a leather and hide processing factory as a machine operator. He has been working there for 11 years. His family owns a small plot of land and a house. Chuluunbaatar likes gardening and farming. His garden has lots of fruit trees. He is planning to raise a pigs using some free space in his backyard. Currently he is building a barn for pigs. He is requesting a loan, which he will  use to buy wood planks to complete the barn and to buy 10 piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase wood planks to complete a barn for pigs and to buy 10 piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan tiene 53 años, es casado y junto a su esposa tienen 2 hijos que están bajo su cargo. Juan se dedica a la venta productos lácteos, ambulante ubicado en las afueras del mercado. Desde hace 3 años que desde muy temprano se dedica a ofrecer estos productos a todos los transeúntes que diariamente recorren los mercados, para este negocio cuenta con una amplia experiencia y con clientela muy fiel a su negocio. Juan está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en la compra de leche, queso, crema, cuajada, leche agria y otros. Juan es una persona responsable, tranquila, y las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona trabajadora y honesta.
texts.en:
Juan is 53 years old and married.  He and his wife have two children in their care.  Juan's business is selling dairy products.  He makes his sales as an itinerant street vendor outside the market.  For the past three years, from very early in the morning, he has been selling these products to all the passersby who visit the markets every day.  He has a lot of experience in this business and has some very loyal customers.

Juan is requesting this loan to invest in buying milk, cheese, cream, 'cuajada' (milk curd), 'leche agria' (a sour, fermented milk product) and other products.  Juan is a responsible, calm person and the people who know him consider him to be a hard-working and honest person.

loans.use: to buy milk, cheese, cream, 'cuajada' (milk curd), 'leche agria' (a sour, fermented milk product) and other products

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar de 50 años, reside en el caserío de Antabamba; ahí formó su familia junto a Gregoria, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos menores con quienes vive en su casa propia. Todas las mañanas como es de costumbre, se levanta muy temprano para salir a cuidar de sus terrenos de cultivo que desde hace 20 años viene sembrando con mucha dedicación. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa y arveja que cada temporada esparce entre sus propios terrenos agrícolas brindándole buenas ganancias en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelo a esta actividad también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno. En todo este tiempo de arduo trabajo logró obtener 25 vacas de las cuales elabora con la leche que produce un promedio de 40 a 30 quesos semanales, ofreciéndoles en la empresa de productos lácteos “La tarmeñita”, donde aparte de ofrecerle un buen precio por la compra, también lo capacitan para el mejoramiento continuo de la calidad de leche. Él se encuentra satisfecho por los logros que esta obteniendo y según menciona desea ahorrar el dinero necesario para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que son jóvenes y estudian carreras universitarias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Oscar, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de vacas lecheras de raza, que le proporcionen mayor cantidad de leche, según comenta cuesta un promedio de mil soles cada una.
texts.en:
50 year-old Oscar lives in the small village of Antabamba.  There he formed his family together with Gregoria, his wife of 20 years.  They have four dependent children with whom they live in their own home.  Every morning, Oscar gets up very early to go out and care for his farmland which he has been sowing for 20 years with a lot of commitment.  His main crops are potatoes and peas that he grows on his own land.  This makes him good profits in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  In parallel with this activity, he also raises cattle.  Over all these years of hard work, he has managed to obtain 25 cows whose milk he uses to make an average of 30 to 40 cheeses a week which he sells to the dairy company “La Tarmeñita”.  In addition to offering him a good price for his products, they also train him in how to continually improve the quality of his milk.

Oscar is happy with his achievements and he says that he would like to save the money he needs to be able to provide a better quality of life for his children who are young and studying university degrees.  He belongs to the "Los Pinos de Antabamba" community bank and this is his fourth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your support in helping him achieve his goals.  For his part, he pledges once more to make his repayments on time as he has done with previous loans that he has received.  Oscar, with your support, will invest the money he has requested in buying a good breed of dairy cow which will provide him with more milk.  He says that they cost, on average, 1,000 Peruvian soles each.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
La señora Melita es socia del banco comunal Las tigresas del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo.
Hace algún tiempo comenzó con el negocio de venta de bebidas heladas y lo realiza en su misma casa, cuenta con una congeladora para helar sus bebidas, los días de calor son cuando hay más demanda.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 cajas de cerveza, 10 jabas de gaseosa, 3 paquetes de agua, 1 ciento de vasos descartables, 1 paquete de gaseosa coca cola, 1 paquete de gaseosa inca cola.
A pesar de ser tan joven no quiere depender del sueldo de su esposo, quien es ingeniero de sistemas y gana lo suficiente, pero Melita prefiere trabajar y no depender de él, además, dice que así se siente más útil.  Trabajando los dos podrán ahorrar y podrán asegurar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Melita is a member of the 'Las Tigresas' (The Tigresses) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 23 years old, married, and has one child.

Some time ago, Melita started her business selling chilled drinks from her home.  She has a freezer where she chills her drinks.  She has most demand on hot days.

With her new loan for 1,700 Peruvian soles, Melita will buy 15 crates of beer, 10 crates of soda, 3 packets of water, 100 disposable cups, 1 packet of Coca Cola and 1 packet of Inca Cola.

In spite of her young age, Melita does not want to depend on her husband's wage.  He is a systems engineer and earns enough but Melita prefers to work and not have to depend on him.  In addition, she says that this way she feels more useful.  As both Melita and her husband work, they are able to save and can guarantee their son's education.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Luzviminda has a shop that sells Avon, Natasha and MSE products. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy products from Natasha and Avon to resell.

Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products from Natasha and Avon to resell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 38 years old and lives in Congo Town with her husband, who is a student, and their three children, who range in age from nine to 16.  For the last year, she has made a living by selling bags of charcoal in a local market. Her main expense is transporting the charcoal to market, and she is applying for this loan to buy 50 more bags to sell to her customers. Her goal is to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alhaji Mohamed

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has three children aged 7, 10, and 13. In 1989, Mohamed established his used clothing business. He began this business because he gained the experience of selling used clothing from his late father. Used clothes are easy to sell. Working seven days-a- week, and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received, and successfully repaid three loans. He now requires a new loan in order to buy additional mini dresses, tan tops, and cotton shirts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to educate his children, and finish his building. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for additional used clothing.

loans.name: Kariuki

texts.en:
Kariuki is a hardworking business man aged 54 years. He is married and blessed with 4 children. For the last 24 years he has been operating a hotel so as to make a living. Previously he was running a butchery. In the next 5 years, he wants to have transformed his hotel into a 3 star hotel. His dream is to own several businesses. 

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to make his business stable.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La señora Delia trabaja como personal de limpieza en una fábrica; además, se dedica a la venta de productos de peluquería. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital para la compra de: peinetas, sujetadores de cabello, maquillaje, cremas, para su venta en las peluquerías de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en  anticrítico en una casa,  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Miraflores en la ciudad de La Paz. Delia es viuda y tiene dos  hijos. Esta es la primera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Sra. Delia works as part of the cleaning staff at a factory. In addition, she sells beauty salon products. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital for buying combs, hair clips, makeup, and crèmes that she can sell to beauty salons in the city of La Paz. Delia lives in a rented house located in the District of Alto Miraflores in the city of La Paz. She is a widow and has two children.

This is the first time her loan has been referred to Kiva for funding. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2006.

loans.use: to buy combs, hair clips, makeup, and crèmes.

loans.name: Dalis

texts.es:
La señora Dalis es socia del banco comunal San Fernando del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años y se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, una de sus casas la puso en alquiler, por ello recibe una renta mensual y  cubre los gastos fijos del hogar.  Su esposo es el que mantiene la casa, ahora ella también participa económicamente, solo uno de sus hijos está viviendo con ellos, pero ya no depende de ellos porque trabaja.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 baldes de pintura, 2 bolsas de cemento, 1 metro de ripio, 4 listones, 1/2kilo de clavo.
Necesita  hacer algunos arreglos en la casa que esta alquilando pintar y hacer una vereda para mayor comodidad a sus inquilinos.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de seguir perteneciendo a su gran familia y pesar de pertenecer a la tercera edad.
texts.en:
Dalis is a member of the village bank San Fernando in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 65, married and has 6 grown children. 

She has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for 7 years in the business of renting rooms. She put one of her homes up for rent, getting a monthly payment that covers her fixed costs of living. Her husband maintains the house, and now she can also contribute financially. Only one of their children still lives with them, but is not dependent on them because he works.

With the new loan of 1,000 nuevos soles she will buy: 2 buckets of paint, 2 bags of cement, 1 meter of gravel, 4 bars and a 1/2 kilo of nails. She needs to make some repairs to the rental house, painting it and making a path to make it more comfortable for her renters. 

She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the chance to continue being part of their great family in spite of being elderly.

loans.use: to buy paint and cement.

loans.name: Ng'ombe

texts.en:
Ng'ombe is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition she also operates a charcoal selling business, which she earns her other source of income.  She hopes to excel in her businesses and establish another business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for the retail shop.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar, for the retail shop.

loans.name: Mea

texts.en: Mea is 33 years old. She is married with three children. Mea has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Mea has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol (pictured above) and her husband, Ty, live in a village about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They are married and have eight children: five sons and three daughters. One of their children is married, one is a garment worker, two have full-time employment and the others attend school. 

Chanthol and her husband are farmers. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. Chanthol is requesting another loan of $500 to continue her vegetable farm by purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Concepción Valerio

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva Concepción compró un carro de perros calientes, sillas, y hasta le alcanzó para comprar materias primas e insumos, con las que preparó sus deliciosos productos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva para comprar un enfriador e implementos de trabajo, realizará adecuaciones a su cocina para trabajar en mejores condiciones y comprará insumos, porque se acerca navidad y espera ganar mucho dinero en esta temporada de gran repunte en las ventas. A sus financiadores envia el siguiente mensaje: " Estoy muy agradecido por mi credito anterior, espero que me sigan apoyando para continuar ipulsando el crecimiento de mi negocio. "
texts.en: With his previous Kiva credit, Concepción bought a hotdog cart and chairs, and the money even stretched to buy some of the raw materials and ingredients he uses to make his delicious products.  He is now applying for a new loan to buy a chiller and work instruments and to adapt his kitchen to improve working conditions and buy ingredients, as Christmas is coming, and hopes to make a lot of money during this period, when there is a big increase in sales.  To his backers, he sends the following message:  "I am very grateful for my previous loan.  I hope you can continue to support me so my business can keep growing."

loans.use: To buy raw materials and ingredients for his daily meals especially sauces and to add more chairs and work tools because he has many more customers.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with one child who attends school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the family's income. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mbeyu has operated a leso (kanga) selling business for the past four years. She also sells farm produce. Her clients are the local area women. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase more pairs of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to the funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of lesos for resale.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
Yunus is a 40-year-old man and is married to Ranti, a 34-year-old lady. From their marriage, they are blessed four children. The children are: Reinaldi, 16, studying at the 1st grade of Senior High School; Desriani, 13, studying at the 1st grade of Junior High School; Saimon, 10, and Arnoldino, 8, studying at Elementary school.

In order to cover his family's living expenses, Yunus worked in construction but the income he generated was unstable since it depended on the project offered. Yunus then initiated a kiosk business to generate more income. He sells daily basic items, mainly rice and the other items such as soft drinks, cooking oil, bath soap, detergent, eggs, instant noodles, etc. 

Yunus plans to get extra income from the business by purchasing a ton of rice and reselling it at his kiosk, but he does not have enough capital to do so. Therefore he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,000,000. Yunus is hoping that TLM will be willing to help him in improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase a ton of rice.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita, 62, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is a widow and the mother of four children, one of whom is already married. She, together with her children, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Carmelita operates a retail store where she sells dishwashing products. What she basically does is buy dishwashing products from wholesalers, and then sell them piecemeal for a profit. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy dishwashing products to increase her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Carmelita hopes to be able to expand soon, and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of dishwashing products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Fodelina hace 26 años, tienen 7 hijos, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo hace mas de 20 años.
El Sr. Sergio es comerciante hace cinco años, montó una pequeña despensa y venta de bebidas. Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba de lleno a la agricultura con varios tipos de cultivos para sobrevivir, pero eso  ya no era suficiente para mantener a su familia, y decidió montar su negocio con algunos ahorros. Esta orgulloso de su labor porque ya tiene hijos que formaron su propia familia y a los demás les sigue ofreciendo todo el cuidado y la educación que ellos necesitan. Su sueño es tener una Casa de Bebidas bien surtida ya que él es el único con ese tipo de negocio en su zona.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de Bebidas como ser cervezas, vinos, y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sergio, 46, has been married to Fodelina for 26 years and they have seven children; they have lived in the city of Coronel Oviedo for more than 20 years.

Sergio has been a merchant for five years.  He set up a small store and sells beverages.  He comments that he used to work full-time farming various types of crops to survive but it wasn’t sufficient any more to support his family and he decided to set up a business with some savings he had.  He is proud of his work because he now has children who have formed their own families and he continues to provide education and care needed by the other ones.  His dream is to have a well-stocked beverage store since his is the only business of this type in his zone.  

He’s asking for the loan to buy beverages like beer, wines and others to stock his store and continue to offer a wide variety to his customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муродджон умный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он женат. Более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги грузового такси. Он начал свой бизнес с помощью отца. Его отец купил ему легковой автомобиль, а он занимался перевозкой пассажиров по городу. Постепенно через 2 года он накопил деньги и купил себе Грузовой автомобиль «Зил». Каждый день с утра он уезжает на работу. У него много постоянных клиентов. Муродджон хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки шин для грузового автомобиля в зимний период.
texts.en: Murodjon is an intelligent and hard-working young man. He is married. For over five years, he has run a goods delivery service. His father helped him to start his business. His father bought him a car to use as a taxi around the city. Gradually, over two years, he saved enough money to buy a Zil brand truck. Every day, he leaves for work in the morning. He has many regular clients. Murodjon would like a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy tires for his truck for the winter season.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his truck

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият  умная и добросовестная. Она вместе с мужем занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и откормом крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. У них четверо детей. Они все взрослые и трудолюбивые. Семья для создания лучших условий стараются  работать усердно. На земле они выращивают сельхозкультуры, отходы от урожая идут на корм скота. Она хочет получить займ для приобретения минеральных удобрений, семян, ГСМ и оплаты  труда рабочих. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
Khosiyat is smart and honest.  She and her husband are engaged in growing crops and fattening cattle, sheep and goats.   They have four children and all of them are hard working adults.  The family is striving to work diligently to create a better life for themselves.  

On their land they grow crops and the plant material left after the harvest is used as fodder for the cattle.  Khosiyat would like to take out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel, and to pay hired help.  She is relying on your help and charity.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Suliveta

texts.en:
Suliveta is from the village of Moataa which is located on the outskirts of Apia, by a protected mangrove area.

Married with 3 children, Suliveta helps her husband with fishing. They both only have had secondary school education and neither have had a job before. Fishing is their life.

The photo shows some of the equipment which is usually purchased by fishing businesses in Samoa. Nets. Goggles, snorkel, flippers, waterproof torch. Fisherman also need a canoe. Samoa is surrounded by a coral reef and the fisherman generally work inside the reef. 

Suliveta helps out by selling the fish by the roadside. It is quite common in Samoa to see fish sold this way, hanging off an upright branch. Suliveta occupies the place just by the mangrove swamp on the main road going out of Apia, and if you   drive by that way, you will see her there every afternoon.

Like the other members of her village loan group, she has paid back many loans. These have helped not only with fishing equipment, but also to build a bathroom in the house and pay for childrens school fees.

loans.use: Fishing Equipment, Home Improvement, School Fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mineh Muthoni Gitahi intends to buy a dairy cow and buy household goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Jose Evaristo

texts.en:
My name is Jose Evaristo, I sell watches in the street all around the city. I've been doing this for several years and it provides me with enough income to support my family. Right now I need to increase the range of watches on offer because more variety means more sales.

Mi Nombre es Jose Evaristo, mi actividad principal es la venta de Relod de manera mabulante en toda la ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas mi negocio ya que entre mas variedad ofresco mejores son las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase QSQ, Salco Brilliant, and Salco White watches, and watch batteries.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 23 years old, single, living with his mother and sister. He has a small shop to sell spare part for cars and vehicles. He got his shop from his father who died in a terrorist attack. He wants to purchase new goods. He wants to improve and enhance his life. He is looking forward to increasing his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note 1: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

Note 2: This loan is for a continuation of the loan term of this entrepreneur. This entrepreneur was accidentally posted with a loan term of 1 month earlier when the loan term should have been for 12 months. The remaining 11 months and the outstanding balance of $1,100 are captured in this loan.

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Sapitriah

texts.id:
With a small investment of table and a small rack, Sapitriah open a stall to sell tidbits and soft drinks at Port Gilimanuk. She chosen that spot, because she felt it's startegic and many people wait there to board the ship. She starts work at 10am and finish at 3. With the capital of Rp. 500.000, Sapitriah usually gets a profit of Rp. 25.000 per day. However this will used to sustain herself and her 5 year old child. Her husband works as a sandal seller around her area. Even though she has a strategic location , but due to her inability to offer a variety of food and drinks, her customers are not always satisfied. With DINARI's help, Sapitriah has manage to increase her variety and make her customer happy and herself happy because of the increased income.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan bermodalkan sebuah meja dan rak sederhana, Sapitriah membuka usaha berjualan aneka makanan ringan di pelabuhan Gilimanuk. Lokasi itu dipilih karena banyak orang yang akan naik ke kapal laut beristirahat dilokasi Sapitriah berjualan. Sapitriah mulai membuka usahanya dari pukul 10 pagi sampai pukul 3 dini hari. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 500.000.-, Sapitriah bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 25.000.- per hari. Namun keuntungan itu harus disisihkan untuk membiayai hidupnya dan seorang anaknya uang berusia 5 tahun, sedangkan suaminya berprofesi sebagai pedagang sandal dan tas yang dipasarkan dengan cara berkeliling di sekitar lingkungan tempat tinggalnya atau di desa lainya. Karena menempati lokasi yang strategis, dagangan Sapitriah banyak dikunjungi oleh pelanggan. Namun karena keterbatasan modal, seringkali pelanggan tidak mendapat yang diinginkannya. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dana dari Dinari, Sapitriah menambah variasi dagangannya sehingga para pelanggan menjadi puas karena semua keinginannya bisa terpenuhi. Hal ini menyebabkan pelanggan Sapitriah bertambah banyak dan keuntungan pun didapatnya lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use: Membeli aneka makanan dan minuman ringan - To buy  tidbits and Soft Drinks.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Yoeurn has 4 children: 1 son and 3 daughters. She started her pig-raising business in 2003. Her husband serves as a member of the PREK Taten commune council. Their 3 daughters work at the garment factory in Pon-nhea Leu district.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase more baby pigs to expand her business. Meanwhile, she also will use some of the amount to buy wood supplies to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more baby pigs and buy wood supplies to repair her house.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 28 years and has 3 children. She is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Norma, together with her husband, sells children's clothing and have 2 stores at a local mall located in the Ayacucho city center. Norma started this business some years ago as a door to door saleswoman in the city of Lima. She also traveled to other provinces taking and selling her merchandise. It was during one of these trips to Ayacucho that she had her baby and she was not able to return to Lima because she had a C-section. That's when Norma decided to start her business in this city.

She began with a small stand where she had not too much merchandise but slowly with the loans that the community bank lend her and her savings her business began to grow. Now she has 2 stores and also has goals for her business like having a dressmaking shop and a place of their own.

She needs a 3,000 soles loan that will invest in buyingsuits, pants, polos, coats, and wardrobes and also the remodelation of her store. In her community bank, she has share happiness and sorrows that she has able to overcome with the help of her friends like when one of their members had an accident and they did a fundraiser to cover its medical expenses. Her dreams are to have a wedding and get married, have their own place, keep her family together and have a well establish dressmaking shop.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Norma tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar. Norma, junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de ropa de niños y tienen 2 tiendas en una galería que está ubicada en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Norma inició este negocio hace muchos años como ambulante en la ciudad de Lima pero también viajaba a provincias llevando mercadería. En uno de los viajes a Ayacucho ella tuvo a su bebé, y no podía regresar a Lima porque tuvo un parto por cesárea y fue por ello que ella decidió iniciar su negocio en esta ciudad. Comenzó con un pequeño puesto donde tenía muy poca mercadería y poco a poco con los créditos que le otorgó su Banco Comunal y los ahorros que tenía fue creciendo. Ahora tiene 2 tiendas y también tiene otras metas para su negocio como el tener un taller de confección de ropa y tener un local propio. El préstamo que ella necesita es de 3,000 soles que invertirá en la compra de conjuntos, pantalones, polos, ropones, ajuares y para la remodelación de su tienda. En su Banco Comunal ha compartido tristezas y alegrías que se superaron con ayuda de todas sus amigas, como cuando un socio se accidentó e hicieron una pollada para recaudar dinero para su curación. Los sueños de Norma son casarse, tener local propio, mantener su familia unida y tener un taller bien implementado.

loans.use: The loan that she needs is for 3,000 soles(Peruvian currency) which will be invested in buying suits, pants, polos, coats, and wardrobes and also the remodelation of her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery business in bulk.

loans.name: José Ilario

texts.es:
Cabinetmaking requires a lot of hard work and dedication. Cognizant of this fact, Mr. José Ilario has been in this field in the town of las Pilas in the Chinandega district of Nicaragua for over 20 years.

He is a married father of two small children, who are his reason for working hard in order to improve his financial situation. It is important to note that Mr. José Ilario has excelled as a cabinetmaker, which is why he has been able to gain the trust of the town’s residents.

Committed to providing the best service and highest quality for his town, he is looking for a way to improve his business through the purchase of new work tools. Thus, he is seeking the help of Ceprodel, so that he may obtain a loan that will permit him to buy his tools, thus helping him cover his household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La ebanistería es un negocio que requiere de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Consiente de esto, el señor José Ilario se dedica a este negocio desde hace 20 años en el pueblo las Pilas del departamento de Chinandega en Nicaragua.

Es casado y padre de dos pequeños hijos que son el motivo de sus esfuerzos por mejorar su situación económica. Es importante destacar que el señor José Ilario ha sobresalido por ser un buen ebanista y por tal motivo ha logrado alcanzar la confianza de muchas personas en su pueblo.

Comprometido con su pueblo a brindar un mejor servicio y de alta calidad, busca la manera de mejorar su negocio con la compra de nuevas herramientas para su trabajo y para esto acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan la compra de sus herramientas y así continuar supliendo las necesidades de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of work tools

loans.name: Katwe B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine N.. She is currently in the business of selling dry fish and is requesting a loan to increase her fish purchases. Christine is 30 years old and is married with a husband who sells used clothes for work. She has 2 children ranging from age 5 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for the family's basic needs. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more fish and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Ruth M., Salamula E., and Saida N.. Ruth M. has a business selling spare parts and wants to re-stock her shop. Salamula E. is currently operating a business in new clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase a counter and more clothes. Saida N. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to increase her stock.

loans.use: To add working capital to fish selling business

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Mrs. Norng L., age 51, is a mother of two children. She has lived in Phnom Penh over 20 years. She is a house wife who stays at home, looks after the children, and cooks food for the famiL. members. Her husband, Chan Yong, 43, has been a motor-taxi driver since 2002. NormalL. he makes around $3 a day. Their children are learning very hard and they always are admired for their hard work by their teacher. Seeing this, Norng L., realL. wants her children have a bachelor's degree in the near future in order to have a better job when they finish school. So to encourage them to study hard, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a computer to assist them with their class work. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Norng L. is not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her children

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora works tirelessly for the well-being of her two children who still live with her. She wants to help them get ahead, which is the reason she works despite the pain she suffers from osteoporosis. The best alternative for Teodora is the sale of clothing throughout various locations of the city and she seeks a loan to increase her product and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodora, trabaja incansablemente por el bienestar de sus 2 hijos que aún viven con ella. Desea ayudarlos a superarse y esta fue la razón por la cual ella trabaja a pesar de las dolencias que padece a causa de la osteoporosis que sufre. La mejor opción para Teodora es la venta de prendas de vestir por diferentes puntos de la ciudad y solicita un préstamo para acrecentar sus ofertas y ganancias.

loans.use: Increase of capital to raise sales.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 40-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Souad owns a store that sells products for the home. This is the second time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: El Eden I Group

texts.en:
Evangelina L. P. (pictured on the far left) is a 33-year-old woman who lives in a small community in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She has a small boutique in her home where she sells clothing, shoes, and beauty products. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing hair products, perfume, makeup, and various blouses. Evangelina said that she hopes to continue to grow her business so that she will be able to help support, along with her husband, their three children (ages 15, 7, and 6) and continue providing them with a good education. It is her hoP. to save enough money so that she would be able to go to college one day to study accounting. In her free time, Evangelina enjoys reading, singing, and spending time with her family.

Evangelina is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, El Eden I. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. One of the other women in the group has a small salon, one prepares and sells food in the street, and the others sell clothing.

On behalf of Evangelina, the El Eden I group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy hair products, perfume, makeup, and clothing for her boutique

loans.name: Darjana

texts.en:
Darjana is a young woman from the town of Doboj. She is not married, and to support herself she has been working as a waitress in a local coffee bar. However, she is only able to earn 300 KM (around 230 USD) a month from this job, which is not enough to live off of.

To supplement her income, she works as a typist, getting business from students and other individuals, and can earn around 200 KM per month, depending on how much work she has. She is requesting this loan from Zene za Zene to buy a new printer. She cannot afford to buy a new one on her salary, but she needs this printer to be able to do her work.

Darjana hopes that she will continue to get new clients and keep increasing her income through this side business.

loans.use: To buy a new printer to assist her in her typing business

loans.name: Coi Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hà thị Côi năm nay 38 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do chồng chị mất sớm một mình chị phải nuôi 2 con nhỏ. Năm đầu tiên tham gia vào Quỹ chị xin vay mức vốn 2.000.000đ để đầu tư vào việc đóng gạch bán cho người dân địa phương cho thu nhập 400.000đ/ tháng. Đến nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho 3 mẹ con chị Côi là đóng gạch ban. Ngoài huy động nguồn nhân lực của gia đình chị Côi còn phải thuê thêm 1 công nhân để đảm bảo đủ số lượng gạch bán cho bà con địa phương. Không chỉ đónggạch bán để tăng thêm thêm thu nhập cho gia đình chị Côi còn kết hợp chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà và nuôi cá. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua nguyên liệu  sản xuất gạch và chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Coi Thi H. is 38 years old. She faced many difficulties before joining the TYM fund because her husband had passed away early, leaving her with 2 small children. She made the first loan of 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in the manufacturing of bricks. This business usually brings in 400,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Until now, the family’s main income still came from making bricks. The business has since expanded and she can now hire another worker. To increase her moneymaking prospects, she raises pigs, chickens, and fish. She plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy supplies and food for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer
