loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married to Nde Peter N. and is a mother of ten children, five of which are below the age of fifteen. With this heavy responsibility on her husband to provide for her children and those of her house cleaners, Margaret decided to become a GHAPE member in 2000 so she could obtain a loan and continue with her business, so as to raise money and assist her husband in paying school fees and providing food for her children.

Through GHAPE, Margaret was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline; since then she has shown commitment in investing and repaying her loans.

With this loan, Margaret plans to construct a fence for her pigs, buy piglets, pay for the cleaning and hoeing of her farm, and for the purchase of seedlings. She knows her business will succeed because the droppings from her piggery will be used as fertilizer in her farm.  

She also plans to raise money to invest in an additional line of business and buy food for her family.

loans.use: construction of fence, purchase of piglets and labor for farming

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: Khadidiatou Baldé, 43 ans, mariée, 09 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1  depuis 6 ans. Elle est couturière avec un atelier au marché et veut faire une opération Tabaski. Pour cela, il lui faut acheter des tissus (bazin, tissu soda mama, brodé coton, tissu rafetna, tissus hommes et des fournitures pour faire des draps de lit, des ensembles hommes et des ensembles de dames et vendre. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Khadidiatou Baldé, age 43, is married and has nine children in her care. She has been a member of the villlage loan group Samba 15 for six years. She is a seamstress in a shop at the marketplace and wants to do trade for Tabaski (a holiday festival). To do so, she needs to buy fabrics (damask, 'soda mama' cloth, embroidery, rafetna, fabrics for men) and supplies for making bed sheets and suits for men and for women to sell. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell clothing

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en:
Orifjon R. is 41 years old and is married with 3 school aged children. For the past 7 years, Orifjon has provided taxi services with his car. The current business is the main source of income for his family. Orifjon works hard, rising early and going to bed late. Orifjon has no higher education but he dreams that all of his children are able to receive one. He is planning to send his daughter to the University next year.

Orifjon is planning to fix his car in order to provide a higher quality of service in the future.  He is requesting 4000 Somoni ($ 1200 USD) for the term of 12 months. With this loan, Orifjon is planning to purchase spare parts for his car. The well-being of this family is on your hands. Let’s get behind this dedicated father to make his dream come reality.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: La Sr. María tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es de profesión carpintero, tiene un hijo  mayor. Sus planes es terminar de construir su casa. Doña  María tiene un  pequeño negocio de venta de ropas usadas, nuevas y cosméticos desde hace cuatro años lo inicio con fondo propio, la competencia a aumentado pero también la demanda,  con la variedad de productos y el buen servicio a los clientes se mantiene estable en el mercado de las ventas  Sus objetivos para el negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta obteniendo mayores utilidades. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar mercadería y comercializarla en mayores cantidades generando una mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua, is married to a carpenter, and has an adult son. She plans to finish construction on her home. For 4 years now, Maria has run a small business where she sells new and used clothing and cosmetics. She began with her own funds and her competency has increased, but so has demand. With the variety of products she sells and the great service she provides to her clients, she maintains stability in the sales market. Her goals for her business are to increase the volume of sales and obtain better incomes. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC, she will be able to purchase merchandise and sell higher quantities to generate a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase packages of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun B. is 27 years old, married and lives with his wife in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is a mechanic fixing radio's, TV's and tapes. On average, he makes $5 a day. His wife runs a coffee shop from home and is able to make $2.50 a day. They have two young children. Chhun B. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase mechanic tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic tools
